analyzed: de'i rigs ni rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its type is permanent.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' tha snyad kyi bden pa bstan pas kyang yongs su mi skyo /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' tha snyad kyi bden pa bstan pas kyang yongs su mi skyo /
translated: Among them, bodhisattvas are not discouraged by the teaching of conventional truth.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa mngon sum du byed par yang mi ltung la sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed de /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa mngon sum du byed par yang mi ltung la sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed de /
translated: He does not fall into the direct realization of ultimate truth, but he does bring beings to full maturity.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattva’s expertise with regard to the truths.

original: gzhan yang / bden pa ni gcig ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang / bden pa ni gcig ste /
translated: Moreover, the truth is one;

original: gnyis su med do //
analyzed: gnyis su med do //
translated: it is not two.

original: de la bden pa gcig ni gang 'di chos thams cad la sgro 'dogs pa med cing sgro 'dogs par ltung ba'i sems can rnams kyang bden pa la rab tu 'dzud pa'o /
analyzed: de la bden pa gcig ni gang 'di chos thams cad la sgro 'dogs pa med cing sgro 'dogs par ltung ba'i sems can rnams kyang bden pa la rab tu 'dzud pa'o /
translated: The one truth is that which is not a superimposition on any phenomenon, and it is the introduction to the truth of those beings who fall into the view of superimposition.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sgro 'dogs pa'i bden pa bstan pas kyang mi skyo la /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sgro 'dogs pa'i bden pa bstan pas kyang mi skyo la /
translated: The bodhisattva is not discouraged by teaching the truth of superimposition,

original: sgro 'dogs pa med pa'i bden pa gcig bstan pa'ang mngon sum du mi byed cing /
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa med pa'i bden pa gcig bstan pa'ang mngon sum du mi byed cing /
translated: but he does not actualize the teaching of the one truth that is not a superimposition.

original: sems can rnams @191b kyang yongs su smin par byed pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams @191b kyang yongs su smin par byed pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And he brings beings to full maturity. This is called the bodhisattva’s expertise with regard to the truths.

original: gzhan yang / phung po lnga ni sdug bsngal ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang / phung po lnga ni sdug bsngal ba ste /
translated: Moreover, the five aggregates are suffering.

original: gang phung po lnga rnams sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid 'di ni sdug bsngal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang phung po lnga rnams sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid 'di ni sdug bsngal zhes bya'o //
translated: The five aggregates are characterized by suffering. This is called suffering.

original: gang gis sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid de stong par rtogs pa 'di ni sdug bsngal la sdug bsngal du shes pa 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid de stong par rtogs pa 'di ni sdug bsngal la sdug bsngal du shes pa 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The realization that the characteristic of suffering is empty is the noble ones’ knowledge of suffering as it really is.

original: gang phung po lnga'i sred pa'i rgyu dang / lta ba'i rgyu bag la nyal ba 'di ni /
analyzed: gang phung po lnga'i sred pa'i rgyu dang / lta ba'i rgyu bag la nyal ba 'di ni /
translated: The causes of craving for the five aggregates and the latent tendencies of the causes of views are

original: kun 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: called origination.

original: gang gis sred pa'i rgyu dang / lta ba'i rgyu de dag mi len pa dang / sgro mi 'dogs pa dang; reg par mi byed pa 'di ni kun 'byung bar shes pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis sred pa'i rgyu dang / lta ba'i rgyu de dag mi len pa dang / sgro mi 'dogs pa dang; reg par mi byed pa 'di ni kun 'byung bar shes pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The non-grasping of the causes of craving and the causes of views, the non-superimposition of them, and the non-experience of them is called the noble ones’ knowledge of origination as it really is.

original: gang phung po lnga po dag shin tu zad de 'gags nas /
analyzed: gang phung po lnga po dag shin tu zad de 'gags nas /
translated: The five aggregates are completely exhausted and cease.

original: sngon gyi mthar mi 'byung ba dang / phyi ma'i mthar mi 'pho ba dang / da ltar byung bar phyin pa med pa 'di ni 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa ste /
analyzed: sngon gyi mthar mi 'byung ba dang / phyi ma'i mthar mi 'pho ba dang / da ltar byung bar phyin pa med pa 'di ni 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa ste /
translated: They do not arise in the past, they do not move into the future, and they do not reach the present. This is the noble ones’ truth of cessation.

original: de la gang gis de ltar shes pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de la gang gis de ltar shes pa 'di ni /
translated: Whoever knows this is

original: 'gog pa la 'gog par shes pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa la 'gog par shes pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: the noble truth of the cessation of suffering.

original: lam gang la brten te sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa la rig cing gnyis su med pa'i ye shes su 'jug pa de ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya ste /🔽gang 'di la stong pa nyid du shes pa 'di ni lam la lam du shes pa 'phags pa'i bden @192a *//
analyzed: lam gang la brten te sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa la rig cing gnyis su med pa'i ye shes su 'jug pa de ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya ste / gang 'di la stong pa nyid du shes pa 'di ni lam la lam du shes pa 'phags pa'i bden @192a *//
translated: The path that one relies on to know suffering, the origin of suffering, and the cessation of suffering, and to enter into the nondual wisdom of cessation is called the noble truth of the path that leads to the cessation of suffering.

original: pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of this as emptiness is called the noble truth of the path as the path.

original: gang gis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po 'di dag la de ltar ye shes kyis rtog cing /
analyzed: gang gis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po 'di dag la de ltar ye shes kyis rtog cing /
translated: Whoever thus understands the four noble truths with wisdom

original: bden pa'i rtog pas mi rtog pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bden pa'i rtog pas mi rtog pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and does not conceptualize them with the conceptualization of truth is said to be a bodhisattva skilled in the truths.

original: gzhan yang / tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal te 'di ni sdug bsngal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang / tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal te 'di ni sdug bsngal zhes bya'o //
translated: Furthermore, all feelings are suffering. This is called suffering.

original: tshor ba de la rnam par 'byed cing rig par shes pa 'di ni sdug bsngal la sdug bsngal du shes pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba de la rnam par 'byed cing rig par shes pa 'di ni sdug bsngal la sdug bsngal du shes pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge that discerns and understands that feeling is called the noble truth of the knowledge of suffering with regard to suffering.

original: tshor ba de rgyu gang gis kun 'byung ba 'di ni kun 'byung ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: tshor ba de rgyu gang gis kun 'byung ba 'di ni kun 'byung ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The cause from which that feeling arises is called its origin.

original: gang gis rgyu de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa 'di ni kun 'byung ba la kun 'byung ba 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis rgyu de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa 'di ni kun 'byung ba la kun 'byung ba 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge that understands that cause as it truly is is called the noble truth of the knowledge of the origin with regard to the origin.

original: gang tshor ba thams cad rgyun chad de tshor ba med pa'ang tshor zhing /🔽tshor ba 'gog pa la'ang rtog la sems can la lta ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang tshor ba thams cad rgyun chad de tshor ba med pa'ang tshor zhing / tshor ba 'gog pa la'ang rtog la sems can la lta ba'i phyir /
translated: The cessation of all feelings, the feeling of the absence of feeling,🔽the realization of the cessation of feeling, and the non-attainment of the cessation of feeling

original: tshor ba 'gog pa mngon sum du'ang mi byed pa 'di ni 'gog pa la 'gog par shes pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba 'gog pa mngon sum du'ang mi byed pa 'di ni 'gog pa la 'gog par shes pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: because of observing sentient beings—this is called the noble truth of the knowledge of cessation with regard to cessation.

original: tshor ba gang gis bsgrubs pa'i lam de ni gzings lta bu ste /
analyzed: tshor ba gang gis bsgrubs pa'i lam de ni gzings lta bu ste /
translated: The path that is cultivated through feeling is like a raft,

original: gang tshor ba 'dod pa de ni lam 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang tshor ba 'dod pa de ni lam 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: for one who desires feeling does not desire the path.

original: 'di ni lam la lam du shes pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o; ;gang de ltar bden pa bzhi po 'di mthong ba dang / rnam par dag pas mnyam par rtog pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lam la lam du shes pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o; ;gang de ltar bden pa bzhi po 'di mthong ba dang / rnam par dag pas mnyam par rtog pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: “The bodhisattvas’ expertise concerning the truths is the discernment of the equality of the four truths through the vision of their purity.

original: gzhan yang / @192b mdor na skye ba ni sdug bsngal ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang / @192b mdor na skye ba ni sdug bsngal ba ste /
translated: “In brief, birth is suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called suffering.🔽The knowledge that discerns non-birth is called the noble truth of the knowledge of suffering as suffering.

original: gang mi skye ba la rtog pa'i shes pa 'di ni sdug bsngal la sdug bsngal du shes pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o; ;srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba ste /
analyzed: gang mi skye ba la rtog pa'i shes pa 'di ni sdug bsngal la sdug bsngal du shes pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o; ;srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba ste /
translated: Birth occurs due to the condition of existence.

original: srid pa gang yin pa de kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: srid pa gang yin pa de kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: Existence is the origin.

original: gang srid pa 'jig pa shes pa 'di ni kun 'byung ba la kun 'byung bar shes pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang srid pa 'jig pa shes pa 'di ni kun 'byung ba la kun 'byung bar shes pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the destruction of existence is called the noble truth of the knowledge of the origin as the origin.

original: skye ba thams cad skye ba med pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba thams cad skye ba med pa ste /
translated: All births are non-births.

original: mi skye ba ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: mi skye ba ni 'gog pa'o //
translated: Non-birth is cessation.

original: gang ma skyes pa de la 'gog pa gang yang med do //
analyzed: gang ma skyes pa de la 'gog pa gang yang med do //
translated: That which is unborn is not subject to cessation.

original: gang 'gog pa med par shes pa 'di ni zad pa'i 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang 'gog pa med par shes pa 'di ni zad pa'i 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the absence of cessation is called the noble truth of the cessation of suffering.🔽The knowledge of the path is the knowledge of the path as the path.🔽The knowledge of the truth is the knowledge of the truth as the truth.🔽The knowledge of the truth is the knowledge of the truth as the truth.🔽The knowledge of the truth is the knowledge of the truth as the truth.

original: gang de ltar bgrang ba dang / 'jal ba dang / tshol pa dang / rtog pa dang / 'jug pa'i shes pa 'di ni lam la lam du shes pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //🔽gang bden pa'i shes pa 'di la 'jug cing /
analyzed: gang de ltar bgrang ba dang / 'jal ba dang / tshol pa dang / rtog pa dang / 'jug pa'i shes pa 'di ni lam la lam du shes pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o // gang bden pa'i shes pa 'di la 'jug cing /
translated: The knowledge of the truth is the knowledge of the truth as the truth.🔽The knowledge of the truth is the knowledge of the truth as the truth.🔽The knowledge of the truth is the knowledge of the truth as the truth.🔽The knowledge of the truth is the knowledge of the truth as the truth.🔽The knowledge of the truth is the knowledge of the truth as the truth.

original: bden pa'i shes pa la'ang mi gnas pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //🔽de la byang chub sems dpa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bden pa'i shes pa la'ang mi gnas pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o // de la byang chub sems dpa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
translated: The knowledge of the truth is the knowledge of the truth as the truth.🔽The knowledge of the truth is the knowledge of the truth as the truth.🔽The knowledge of the truth is the knowledge of the truth as the truth.🔽The knowledge of the truth is the knowledge of the truth as the truth.🔽The knowledge of the truth is the knowledge of the truth as the truth.🔽The knowledge of the truth is the knowledge of the truth as the truth.🔽The knowledge of the truth is the knowledge of the truth as the truth.🔽The knowledge of the truth is the knowledge of the truth as the truth.🔽The knowledge of the truth is the knowledge of the truth as the truth.🔽The knowledge of the truth is the knowledge of the truth as the truth.🔽The knowledge of the truth is the knowledge of the truth as the truth.🔽The knowledge of the truth is the knowledge of the truth as the truth.🔽The knowledge of the truth is the knowledge of the truth as the truth.🔽The knowledge of the truth is the knowledge of the truth as the truth.🔽The knowledge of the truth is the knowledge of the truth as the truth.🔽The knowledge of the truth is the knowledge of the truth as the truth.🔽The knowledge of the truth is the knowledge of the truth as the truth.🔽The knowledge of the truth is the knowledge of the truth as the truth.🔽The knowledge of the truth is the knowledge of the truth as the truth.🔽The knowledge of the truth is the knowledge of the truth as the truth.🔽The knowledge of the truth is the knowledge of the truth as the truth.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽tshul bzhin ma yin pa kun 'byung ba las ma rig pa kun 'byung ngo //🔽ma rig pa kun 'byung ba las 'du byed kun 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di lta ste /🔽tshul bzhin ma yin pa kun 'byung ba las ma rig pa kun 'byung ngo //🔽ma rig pa kun 'byung ba las 'du byed kun 'byung ngo //
translated: The knowledge

original: 'du byed kun 'byung ba las rnam par shes pa kun 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'du byed kun 'byung ba las rnam par shes pa kun 'byung ngo //
translated: From the arising of volitions, the arising of consciousness occurs.

original: rnam par shes pa kun 'byung ba las ming dang / gzugs kun 'byung ngo //🔽ming dang / gzugs @193a *//
analyzed: rnam par shes pa kun 'byung ba las ming dang / gzugs kun 'byung ngo // ming dang / gzugs @193a *//
translated: From the arising of consciousness, the arising of name-and-form occurs.

original: kun 'byung ba las skye mched drug kun 'byung ngo //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba las skye mched drug kun 'byung ngo //
translated: From the arising of name-and-form, the arising of the six sense spheres occurs.

original: skye mched drug kun 'byung ba las reg pa kun 'byung ngo //
analyzed: skye mched drug kun 'byung ba las reg pa kun 'byung ngo //
translated: From the arising of the six sense spheres, the arising of contact occurs.

original: reg pa kun 'byung ba las tshor ba kun 'byung ngo //
analyzed: reg pa kun 'byung ba las tshor ba kun 'byung ngo //
translated: From the arising of contact, the arising of feeling occurs.

original: tshor ba kun 'byung ba las sred pa kun 'byung ngo //
analyzed: tshor ba kun 'byung ba las sred pa kun 'byung ngo //
translated: From the arising of feeling, the arising of craving occurs.

original: sred pa kun 'byung ba las len pa kun 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sred pa kun 'byung ba las len pa kun 'byung ngo //
translated: From the arising of craving, the arising of grasping occurs.

original: len pa kun 'byung ba las srid pa kun 'byung ngo //
analyzed: len pa kun 'byung ba las srid pa kun 'byung ngo //
translated: From the arising of grasping, the arising of existence occurs.

original: srid pa kun 'byung ba las skye ba kun 'byung ngo //
analyzed: srid pa kun 'byung ba las skye ba kun 'byung ngo //
translated: From the arising of existence, the arising of birth occurs.

original: skye ba kun 'byung ba las /
analyzed: skye ba kun 'byung ba las /
translated: From the arising of birth,

original: rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'jug pa rnams 'byung ste /
analyzed: rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'jug pa rnams 'byung ste /
translated: the arising of old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, despair, and distress occurs.

original: de lta na sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'ba' zhig po 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'ba' zhig po 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, this entire mass of suffering comes to be.

original: g-yo med pa /
analyzed: g-yo med pa /
translated: It is without deceit,

original: byed pa med pa /
analyzed: byed pa med pa /
translated: without action,

original: bdag po med pa /
analyzed: bdag po med pa /
translated: without a master,

original: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i chos ji ltar gnas pa bzhin 'byung ste /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i chos ji ltar gnas pa bzhin 'byung ste /
translated: and without grasping. It occurs in accordance with the way things are.

original: gang 'di la shes pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang 'di la shes pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This knowledge is called the bodhisattva’s expertise concerning dependent origination.

original: gzhan yang / gang dge ba'i rgyu las byung ba'am /🔽mi dge ba'i rgyu las byung ba'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang / gang dge ba'i rgyu las byung ba'am / mi dge ba'i rgyu las byung ba'am /
translated: Moreover, whatever arises from a virtuous cause,🔽or from an unvirtuous cause,

original: mi g-yo ba'i rgyu las byung ba'am /🔽'khor ba'i rgyu las byung ba'am /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i rgyu las byung ba'am / 'khor ba'i rgyu las byung ba'am /
translated: or from a cause that is neutral,🔽or from a cause that is saṃsāra,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu las byung ba de dag thams cad /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu las byung ba de dag thams cad /
translated: or from a cause that is nirvāṇa,

original: byang chub sems dpas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: the bodhisattva knows all of that correctly.

original: sems can gang dbang po'i rgyu las 'jug pa tshad mar byed pa de ni dbang po'i rgyu las byung zhing las kyi rgyu las @193b byung ba ste /
analyzed: sems can gang dbang po'i rgyu las 'jug pa tshad mar byed pa de ni dbang po'i rgyu las byung zhing las kyi rgyu las @193b byung ba ste /
translated: Those sentient beings who take the cause of the faculties as authoritative will be born from the cause of the faculties and from the cause of karma.

original: 'bras bu'i rgyu las 'grub par byed do zhes zin pa dang / ma zin pa'i chos rnams la gang de ltar rgyu kun 'byung ba las skye ba la mkhas pa 'di ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rgyu las 'grub par byed do zhes zin pa dang / ma zin pa'i chos rnams la gang de ltar rgyu kun 'byung ba las skye ba la mkhas pa 'di ni /
translated: The cause of the result is established. Those who are skilled in the arising of all causes from the origin of suffering in this way with regard to both internal and external phenomena are called

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: bodhisattvas who are skilled in dependent origination.

original: gzhan yang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa 'gags pas ma rig pa 'gag /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa 'gags pas ma rig pa 'gag /
translated: Moreover, those who are skilled in dependent origination will, through the cessation of incorrect mental activity, bring about the cessation of ignorance.

original: ma rig pa 'gags pas /
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gags pas /
translated: Through the cessation of ignorance,

original: 'du byed 'gag /
analyzed: 'du byed 'gag /
translated: they will bring about the cessation of karmic formation.

original: 'du byed 'gags pas /
analyzed: 'du byed 'gags pas /
translated: Through the cessation of karmic formation,

original: rnam par shes pa 'gag /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'gag /
translated: they will bring about the cessation of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa 'gags pas /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'gags pas /
translated: Through the cessation of consciousness,

original: ming dang / gzugs 'gag /
analyzed: ming dang / gzugs 'gag /
translated: they will bring about the cessation of name and form.🔽Through the cessation of name and form,

original: ming dang / gzugs 'gags pas; skye mched drug 'gag /
analyzed: ming dang / gzugs 'gags pas; skye mched drug 'gag /
translated: they will bring about the cessation of the six sense sources.

original: skye mched drug 'gag pas /
analyzed: skye mched drug 'gag pas /
translated: Through the cessation of the six sense sources,

original: reg pa 'gag /
analyzed: reg pa 'gag /
translated: they will bring about the cessation of contact.

original: reg pa 'gags pas /
analyzed: reg pa 'gags pas /
translated: From the cessation of contact,

original: tshor ba 'gag /
analyzed: tshor ba 'gag /
translated: feeling ceases.

original: tshor ba 'gags pas /
analyzed: tshor ba 'gags pas /
translated: From the cessation of feeling,

original: sred pa 'gag /
analyzed: sred pa 'gag /
translated: craving ceases.

original: sred pa 'gags pas /
analyzed: sred pa 'gags pas /
translated: From the cessation of craving,

original: len pa dgag /
analyzed: len pa dgag /
translated: grasping ceases.

original: len pa 'gags pas /
analyzed: len pa 'gags pas /
translated: From the cessation of grasping,

original: srid pa 'gag /
analyzed: srid pa 'gag /
translated: becoming ceases.

original: srid pa 'gags pas /
analyzed: srid pa 'gags pas /
translated: From the cessation of becoming,

original: skye ba 'gag /
analyzed: skye ba 'gag /
translated: birth ceases.

original: skye ba 'gags pas /
analyzed: skye ba 'gags pas /
translated: From the cessation of birth,

original: rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams kyang 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams kyang 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: aging, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, dejection, and strife all cease.

original: de ltar sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig po 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig po 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, this great mass of pure suffering ceases.

original: g-yo ba med pa /
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa /
translated: It is without movement,

original: byed pa med pa /
analyzed: byed pa med pa /
translated: without action,

original: bdag po med pa /
analyzed: bdag po med pa /
translated: without owner,🔽and without appropriator.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i chos ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du 'gog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i chos ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du 'gog par 'gyur ro //
translated: It ceases just as it is.

original: gang 'di la mkhas pa 'di ni /🔽byang chub sems dpa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung @194a *//
analyzed: gang 'di la mkhas pa 'di ni / byang chub sems dpa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung @194a *//
translated: One who is skilled in this

original: pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: is said to be a bodhisattva skilled in dependent origination.

original: gzhan yang / chos thams cad ni rgyu la rag lus pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang / chos thams cad ni rgyu la rag lus pa'o //
translated: Moreover, all phenomena depend on causes.

original: rkyen la rag lus pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen la rag lus pa'o //
translated: It is dependent on conditions.

original: tshogs la rag lus pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs la rag lus pa'o //
translated: It is dependent on a collection.

original: chos gang rgyu dang / rkyen dang / tshogs pa la rag lus pa de bdag la rag ma lus pa'o //
analyzed: chos gang rgyu dang / rkyen dang / tshogs pa la rag lus pa de bdag la rag ma lus pa'o //
translated: Any phenomenon that is dependent on causes, conditions, and a collection is not dependent on a self.

original: sems can la rag ma lus pa'o //
analyzed: sems can la rag ma lus pa'o //
translated: It is not dependent on a sentient being.

original: srog la rag ma lus pa'o //
analyzed: srog la rag ma lus pa'o //
translated: It is not dependent on a life-force.

original: gang zag la rag ma lus pa'o //🔽gang bdag la rag ma lus pa dang / sems can la rag ma lus pa dang / srog la rag ma lus pa dang / gang zag la rag ma lus pa 'di na zhe'am /🔽snga ma na zhe 'am /
analyzed: gang zag la rag ma lus pa'o // gang bdag la rag ma lus pa dang / sems can la rag ma lus pa dang / srog la rag ma lus pa dang / gang zag la rag ma lus pa 'di na zhe'am / snga ma na zhe 'am /
translated: It is not dependent on a person.

original: gzhan na zhes bgrang ba ci'ang med de /
analyzed: gzhan na zhes bgrang ba ci'ang med de /
translated: That which is not dependent on a self, not dependent on a sentient being, not dependent on a life-force, and not dependent on a person cannot be counted as being here, there, or somewhere else.

original: gang de ltar rtog pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang de ltar rtog pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is counted in this way is called the bodhisatvas’ skill with dependent origination.

original: gzhan yang / gang byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi rkyen thams cad nye bar gzhog la /
analyzed: gzhan yang / gang byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi rkyen thams cad nye bar gzhog la /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisatvas bring together all the conditions for awakening,

original: rkyen de dag kyang zad cing 'gog par rtog ste /
analyzed: rkyen de dag kyang zad cing 'gog par rtog ste /
translated: and they understand that those conditions are exhausted and cease.

original: sems can la blta ba'i phyir zad cing 'gog pa'i ye shes su'ang mi 'jog pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can la blta ba'i phyir zad cing 'gog pa'i ye shes su'ang mi 'jog pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And because of his concern for sentient beings, he does not rest in the cessation that is a termination. This is called the bodhisattva’s expertise regarding dependent origination.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i dus gsum la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i dus gsum la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattvas’ expertise regarding the three times?

original: gang bdag dang / sems can gzhan gyi 'das pa'i sems dang / sems las byung ba /
analyzed: gang bdag dang / sems can gzhan gyi 'das pa'i sems dang / sems las byung ba /
translated: It is the recollection of one’s own and others’ past minds and mental factors,

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba rnams rjes su dran pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba rnams rjes su dran pa ste /
translated: whether virtuous or nonvirtuous.

original: mi dge ba'i sems dang / sems las byung ba rnams dran nas kyang @194b rnam par smod pa dang / dge ba'i sems dang / sems las byung ba rnams dran nas kyang /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i sems dang / sems las byung ba rnams dran nas kyang @194b rnam par smod pa dang / dge ba'i sems dang / sems las byung ba rnams dran nas kyang /
translated: When one recollects nonvirtuous minds and mental factors, one should feel revulsion, and when one recollects virtuous minds and mental factors,

original: byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni 'das pa la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni 'das pa la mkhas pa'o //
translated: one should dedicate them to awakening. This is expertise regarding the past.

original: gang ma 'ongs pa'i sems dang / sems las byung ba /
analyzed: gang ma 'ongs pa'i sems dang / sems las byung ba /
translated: It is the resolve to have virtuous minds and mental factors in the future,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs la nges par sems shing /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs la nges par sems shing /
translated: and the resolve to accumulate the roots of virtue.

original: byang chub mngon du 'gyur pa'i las sems te /
analyzed: byang chub mngon du 'gyur pa'i las sems te /
translated: It is the resolve to act in order to actualize awakening.

original: bdag gi dge ba'i sems bskyed pa gang dag skye bar 'gyur ba de dag ni /
analyzed: bdag gi dge ba'i sems bskyed pa gang dag skye bar 'gyur ba de dag ni /
translated: Whatever wholesome thoughts and mental states arise in me,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya'o //
translated: I will dedicate them to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽“Unwholesome” is the opportunity for unwholesome thoughts and mental states.

original: mi dge ba'i sems dang / sems las byung ba rnams kyi skabs ni mi dge zhes gang de lta bur sems la bsgo ba de ni ma 'ongs pa la mkhas pa'o //🔽da ltar byung ba la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i sems dang / sems las byung ba rnams kyi skabs ni mi dge zhes gang de lta bur sems la bsgo ba de ni ma 'ongs pa la mkhas pa'o // da ltar byung ba la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
translated: To be mindful of that is skill with the future.

original: gang da ltar byung ba'i sems dang / sems las byung ba rnams tshul bzhin sbyor bas /
analyzed: gang da ltar byung ba'i sems dang / sems las byung ba rnams tshul bzhin sbyor bas /
translated: “Skill with the present” is the present thoughts and mental states that are applied properly,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'du byed pa dang / mi dge ba'i sems dang / sems las byung ba zlog pa dang / dge ba'i sems dang / sems las byung ba rnams byang chub tu mngon du byed pa ni da ltar byung ba la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'du byed pa dang / mi dge ba'i sems dang / sems las byung ba zlog pa dang / dge ba'i sems dang / sems las byung ba rnams byang chub tu mngon du byed pa ni da ltar byung ba la mkhas pa ste /
translated: the creation of roots of virtue, the turning away from unwholesome thoughts and mental states, and the manifestation of wholesome thoughts and mental states for awakening.

original: gang 'di dag la mkhas pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i dus gsum la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang 'di dag la mkhas pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i dus gsum la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One who is skilled in this is said to be a bodhisattva skilled in the three times.

original: gzhan yang / gang 'das pa'i dus kyi chos rnams stong par mos pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi chos rnams stong bar mos pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus kyi chos rnams stong par mos pa ste /🔽de ltar shes rab dang / ye shes kyi dus gsum @195a *//
analyzed: gzhan yang / gang 'das pa'i dus kyi chos rnams stong par mos pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi chos rnams stong bar mos pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus kyi chos rnams stong par mos pa ste / de ltar shes rab dang / ye shes kyi dus gsum @195a *//
translated: Moreover, one who is skilled in the three times is one who is skilled in the three times if one has the following three kinds of aspiration: aspiration to the emptiness of past phenomena, aspiration to the emptiness of future phenomena, and aspiration to the emptiness of present phenomena.

original: stong pa nyid du'ang rtog la 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bsod nams thams cad kyi rjes su thabs kyi ye shes kyi yi rang bar yang byed de /
analyzed: stong pa nyid du'ang rtog la 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bsod nams thams cad kyi rjes su thabs kyi ye shes kyi yi rang bar yang byed de /
translated: Thus, one who is skilled in the three times is one who is skilled in the three times if one has the following three kinds of wisdom: wisdom that realizes the emptiness of the three times, wisdom that realizes the emptiness of the three times, and wisdom that realizes the emptiness of the three times.

original: gang 'di la mkhas pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i dus gsum la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang 'di la mkhas pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i dus gsum la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One who is skilled in this is said to be a bodhisattva skilled in the three times.

original: gzhan yang / 'das pa'i dus na zad pa'i chos rnams phyi ma'i mtha' 'phos par mi lta zhing dge ba'i mngon par 'du byed pa la brtson 'grus kyang mi gtong ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang / 'das pa'i dus na zad pa'i chos rnams phyi ma'i mtha' 'phos par mi lta zhing dge ba'i mngon par 'du byed pa la brtson 'grus kyang mi gtong ste /
translated: Moreover, they do not consider that the phenomena of the past have passed into the future, and they do not abandon their effort to create virtue.🔽They do not create nonvirtue, and they do not abandon their effort to dedicate to Awakening the phenomena of the future that have not yet arisen.

original: mi dge ba'i 'du mi byed pa dang / gang ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi chos rnams mi skye mi 'byung bar rtog cing byang chub tu bsngo ba'i brtson 'grus mi 'dor ba dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus na chos rnams 'dug pa med cing mi gnas par rtogs te /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i 'du mi byed pa dang / gang ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi chos rnams mi skye mi 'byung bar rtog cing byang chub tu bsngo ba'i brtson 'grus mi 'dor ba dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus na chos rnams 'dug pa med cing mi gnas par rtogs te /
translated: And they understand that phenomena in the present do not remain.

original: byang chub sems dpa' lhag pa'i bsam pa rab tu brtan pa ni byang chub kyi sems kyang mi brjed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lhag pa'i bsam pa rab tu brtan pa ni byang chub kyi sems kyang mi brjed de /
translated: The bodhisattva who is very firm in her superior intention does not forget the thought of Awakening.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i dus gsum la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i dus gsum la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattva’s expertise concerning the three times.

original: gzhan yang / gang 'das pa de ni zab pa'o //🔽ma 'ongs pa de ni ma phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gang 'das pa de ni zab pa'o // ma 'ongs pa de ni ma phyin pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the past is deep.🔽The future has not yet come.

original: da ltar byung ba de ni gnas pa med pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba de ni gnas pa med pa'o //
translated: The present does not remain.

original: gang de ltar sems dang / sems las byung ba skyes pa dang / zhig pa dang / zhum pa rnams la rtog cing byang chub sgrub pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyang yang dag par sgrub pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i dus gsum la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang de ltar sems dang / sems las byung ba skyes pa dang / zhig pa dang / zhum pa rnams la rtog cing byang chub sgrub pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyang yang dag par sgrub pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i dus gsum la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is, when one is aware of the arising, passing away, and fading away of the mind and mental factors, and one accomplishes the roots of wholesomeness that are conducive to awakening, this is called the bodhisattvas’ expertise concerning the three times.

original: gzhan yang / gang @195b mngon par shes pa la mkhas pas 'das pa'i dus rjes su dran te /🔽sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa rnams rjes su dran nas byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na dge ba'i sems bskyed pa rnams rab tu shes pa dang / de la smon pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang / gang @195b mngon par shes pa la mkhas pas 'das pa'i dus rjes su dran te / sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa rnams rjes su dran nas byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na dge ba'i sems bskyed pa rnams rab tu shes pa dang / de la smon pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang /
translated: “Moreover, by means of their expertise in the higher knowledges, bodhisattvas recollect the past.🔽They recollect the roots of wholesomeness that they have previously planted and dedicate them toward awakening. They know the wholesome states of mind that will arise in the future and they bring about the fulfillment of their aspirations.

original: gang da ltar byung ba'i dus na dge ba'i rtsa ba skyes shing byung ba rnams yid la byed cing gnas par byed de /
analyzed: gang da ltar byung ba'i dus na dge ba'i rtsa ba skyes shing byung ba rnams yid la byed cing gnas par byed de /
translated: They attend to and maintain the wholesome roots that have arisen in the present.

original: byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni dus gsum la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni dus gsum la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This dedication of merit to enlightenment is called “skill in the three times.”

original: gzhan yang / gang sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'das pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dran nas sems can gang dag ji ltar smin par bya ba de dag thams cad de bzhin du yongs su smin par byed de /🔽gang ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi sangs rgyas mnyes par bya bas yongs su smin par bya ba de dag thams cad de bzhin du yongs su smin par byed pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sems can gang dag chos bstan pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang / gang sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'das pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dran nas sems can gang dag ji ltar smin par bya ba de dag thams cad de bzhin du yongs su smin par byed de / gang ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi sangs rgyas mnyes par bya bas yongs su smin par bya ba de dag thams cad de bzhin du yongs su smin par byed pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sems can gang dag chos bstan pa'am /
translated: Moreover, in order to bring all sentient beings to maturity, he recollects the past accumulations of merit and brings to maturity all those beings who are to be matured in such and such a way.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis yongs su smin par bya ba de dag thams cad kyang de bzhin du yongs su smin par byed de /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis yongs su smin par bya ba de dag thams cad kyang de bzhin du yongs su smin par byed de /
translated: He brings to maturity all those who are to be matured by pleasing the Buddhas of the future, and he brings to maturity all those beings of the present who are to be matured by the teaching of the Dharma or by the miracle of supernormal power.

original: gang dus gsum 'di dag la bdag gi don dang / gzhan gyi don dang / byang chub kyi don de dag thams cad ma chags pas yongs su rdzogs par byed pa 'di ni /
analyzed: gang dus gsum 'di dag la bdag gi don dang / gzhan gyi don dang / byang chub kyi don de dag thams cad ma chags pas yongs su rdzogs par byed pa 'di ni /
translated: When one perfects all of one’s own aims, the aims of others, and the aims of awakening through nonattachment in the three times,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dus gsum la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dus gsum la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: this is called the bodhisattva’s expertise in the three times.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa thams cad la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa thams cad la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattvas’ expertise in all the vehicles?

original: gsum po 'di dag ni theg pa ste /🔽nges par 'byin pa'o //🔽gsum po gang zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni theg pa ste / nges par 'byin pa'o // gsum po gang zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: There are three vehicles:

original: nyan @196a *// thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: nyan @196a *// thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / theg pa chen po'o //
translated: the vehicle of the hearers, the vehicle of the solitary buddhas, and the Great Vehicle.

original: gzhan yang / theg pa gnyis te /🔽gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang / theg pa gnyis te / gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: There are also two vehicles:

original: lha'i theg pa dang / mi'i theg pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i theg pa dang / mi'i theg pa'o //
translated: the vehicle of the gods and the vehicle of humans.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattvas’ expertise in the vehicles?

original: sangs rgyas byung ba med pas nyan thos kyi theg pa'ang med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byung ba med pas nyan thos kyi theg pa'ang med do //
translated: In the absence of the appearance of a buddha, there is no vehicle of the hearers.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: nyan thos rnams kyi yang dag par lta ba ni pha rol gyi sgra'i rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyi yang dag par lta ba ni pha rol gyi sgra'i rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: The correct view of the śrāvakas follows the words of others.

original: de la nyan pa ni gang 'di tshul khrims sdom pa ste /
analyzed: de la nyan pa ni gang 'di tshul khrims sdom pa ste /
translated: Listening is the restraint of morality.

original: ji ltar bslab pa bcas pa'i rjes su 'jug pa ni tshul khrims kyi phung bo yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar bslab pa bcas pa'i rjes su 'jug pa ni tshul khrims kyi phung bo yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Following the rules of training, the aggregate of morality is perfected.

original: tshul khrims kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs nas ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po yongs su rdzogs nas shes rab kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / shes rab kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs nas rnam par grol ba'i phung po yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs nas ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po yongs su rdzogs nas shes rab kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / shes rab kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs nas rnam par grol ba'i phung po yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang /
translated: When the aggregate of morality is perfected, the aggregate of concentration is perfected. When the aggregate of concentration is perfected, the aggregate of wisdom is perfected. When the aggregate of wisdom is perfected, the aggregate of liberation is perfected.

original: rnam par grol ba'i phung po yongs su rdzogs nas rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i phung po yongs su rdzogs nas rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ste /
translated: When the aggregate of liberation is perfected, the aggregate of the vision of the wisdom of liberation is perfected.

original: gang 'di la mkhas pa 'di ni nyan thos kyi theg pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang 'di la mkhas pa 'di ni nyan thos kyi theg pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One who is skilled in this is said to be skilled in the Śrāvaka Vehicle.

original: gzhan yang / nyan thos kyi theg pa la mkhas pa ni gang bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams la rnam par smod @196b pa dang / khams gsum pa thams cad la yid byung zhing 'dod chags dang bral ba dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang / nyan thos kyi theg pa la mkhas pa ni gang bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams la rnam par smod @196b pa dang / khams gsum pa thams cad la yid byung zhing 'dod chags dang bral ba dang /
translated: Moreover, being skilled in the Śrāvaka Vehicle means to be critical of meritorious, non-meritorious, and unshakable compositional activity, to be disgusted with and detached from the entire three realms,

original: 'du byed thams cad la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal bar rtog pa dang / chos thams cad la bdag med par rtog pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba la mngon par dga' ba dang / skad cig kyang srid par skye bar mi 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal bar rtog pa dang / chos thams cad la bdag med par rtog pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba la mngon par dga' ba dang / skad cig kyang srid par skye bar mi 'dod pa dang /
translated: to understand that all compositional activity is impermanent, to understand that all phenomena are suffering, to understand that all phenomena are devoid of self, to delight in the peace of nirvāṇa, and to not wish to be born in existence even for a moment.

original: rtag tu 'jig par lta ba dang / rtag tu yid mi rton pa dang / phung po rnams la gsod par 'du shes pa dang / khams rnams la sbrul gdug pa lta bur rtog pa'i 'du shes pa dang / skye mched rnams la grong stong lta bur 'du shes pa dang /
analyzed: rtag tu 'jig par lta ba dang / rtag tu yid mi rton pa dang / phung po rnams la gsod par 'du shes pa dang / khams rnams la sbrul gdug pa lta bur rtog pa'i 'du shes pa dang / skye mched rnams la grong stong lta bur 'du shes pa dang /
translated: It is the perception of the aggregates as killers, the perception of the elements as poisonous snakes, the perception of the sense-spheres as an empty town,

original: skye ba'i gnas thams cad la mi smon pa'i 'du shes dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas dang / skyabs su 'du shes pa dang / gang 'di ltar ston pa dang / rab tu ston pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i nyan thos kyi theg pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i gnas thams cad la mi smon pa'i 'du shes dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas dang / skyabs su 'du shes pa dang / gang 'di ltar ston pa dang / rab tu ston pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i nyan thos kyi theg pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: the perception of not aspiring to any place of birth, the perception of nirvāṇa as a place of rest and refuge, and teaching and demonstrating this—this is called the bodhisatvas’ skill in the vehicle of the hearers.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisatvas’ skill in the vehicle of the solitary buddhas?

original: rnam pa gang dang / rkyen gang gis rang sangs rgyas rnams nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rnam pa de dag dang / rkyen de dag byang chub sems dpas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: rnam pa gang dang / rkyen gang gis rang sangs rgyas rnams nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rnam pa de dag dang / rkyen de dag byang chub sems dpas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: Bodhisattvas know perfectly well the aspects and conditions by which the pratyekabuddhas are liberated.

original: de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: 'di lta ste /🔽'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bag yod pa chen pos nyan thos kyi lta bu ma yin pa'i sbyin pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs gsog pa dang / tshul khrims kyi bsod nams kyi @197a *//
analyzed: 'di lta ste / 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bag yod pa chen pos nyan thos kyi lta bu ma yin pa'i sbyin pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs gsog pa dang / tshul khrims kyi bsod nams kyi @197a *//
translated: They are as follows:

original: tshogs gsog pa dang / thos pa nyung ba la chos kyi nan tan byed pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la rim gro dang / bsnyen bkur byed pa la'ang zhum pa med pa dang / dbang po bar ma dang / rtag tu rab tu 'byung ba la gzhol ba dang /
analyzed: tshogs gsog pa dang / thos pa nyung ba la chos kyi nan tan byed pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la rim gro dang / bsnyen bkur byed pa la'ang zhum pa med pa dang / dbang po bar ma dang / rtag tu rab tu 'byung ba la gzhol ba dang /
translated: They accumulate the merit of generosity, not like the śrāvakas, with great aspiration, effort, and carefulness; they accumulate the merit of morality; they practice the Dharma with little listening; they are not discouraged in serving and venerating the blessed buddhas; they have middling faculties; they are always intent on going forth;

original: don nyung ba dang / byed pa nyung ba dang / 'du 'dzin la mi dga' zhing dben pa la dga' ba dang / rab tu dben par gnas mal 'cha' ba dang / bsnyen par dga' ba dang / mthu che ba dang / sbyin pa'i gnas kyi sa la mngon par dga' ba dang /🔽rgyun mi 'chad par rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la lta ba dang / nges par 'byung ba'i dbyings gcig la rtog pa dang / rang byung gi ye shes kyis rab tu brgal ba dang / dmigs pa la 'jug pa 'thob pa dang / bsam gtan dang /
analyzed: don nyung ba dang / byed pa nyung ba dang / 'du 'dzin la mi dga' zhing dben pa la dga' ba dang / rab tu dben par gnas mal 'cha' ba dang / bsnyen par dga' ba dang / mthu che ba dang / sbyin pa'i gnas kyi sa la mngon par dga' ba dang / rgyun mi 'chad par rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la lta ba dang / nges par 'byung ba'i dbyings gcig la rtog pa dang / rang byung gi ye shes kyis rab tu brgal ba dang / dmigs pa la 'jug pa 'thob pa dang / bsam gtan dang /
translated: It is to have few concerns, to have few activities, to not enjoy crowds, to enjoy solitude, to live in complete solitude, to enjoy solitude, to have great power, to delight in being a worthy recipient of offerings,🔽to constantly observe dependent origination, to contemplate the single sphere of transcendence, to be fully engaged with self-arisen wisdom, to attain the engagement with objects, to be uninterrupted in concentration,

original: rnam par thar ba dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la rgyun ma chad pa dang / gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa'i ye shes skyed pa dang / dmigs pa gang yang rung ba la rkyen gyi ye shes rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par thar ba dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la rgyun ma chad pa dang / gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa'i ye shes skyed pa dang / dmigs pa gang yang rung ba la rkyen gyi ye shes rtogs pa ste /
translated: liberation, absorption, and equipoise, to give rise to wisdom that is not dependent on others, and to realize the wisdom of conditions with regard to any object.

original: gang de ltar 'chad pa dang / ston pa dang / rab tu ston pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang de ltar 'chad pa dang / ston pa dang / rab tu ston pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattva’s expertise in the vehicle of the solitary buddhas.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattvas’ expertise in the Great Vehicle?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po la mkhas pa ni dpag tu med de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po la mkhas pa ni dpag tu med de /
translated: The bodhisattvas’ expertise in the Great Vehicle is immeasurable.

original: de las phyogs @197b tsam zhig bstan to //
analyzed: de las phyogs @197b tsam zhig bstan to //
translated: I have taught only a small part of it.

original: theg pa de ni sems can thams cad kyi go skabs 'byed pas na dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa de ni sems can thams cad kyi go skabs 'byed pas na dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: That vehicle is immeasurable because it provides an opportunity for all sentient beings.

original: theg pa de ni chags pa med pa'i ye shes la btang ba ste sgrib pa med pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa de ni chags pa med pa'i ye shes la btang ba ste sgrib pa med pa'o //
translated: That vehicle is unobstructed because it is directed toward unobstructed wisdom.

original: theg pa de ni sems can thams cad nye bar 'tsho ba ste /
analyzed: theg pa de ni sems can thams cad nye bar 'tsho ba ste /
translated: That vehicle is the support for all sentient beings.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bsags pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bsags pa'o //
translated: It is the accumulation of merit and the accumulation of all roots of virtue.

original: theg pa de ni sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa la las su rung ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su sbyang ba byas pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa de ni sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa la las su rung ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su sbyang ba byas pa'o //
translated: This vehicle is the purification of all perfections because it is the activity of the minds of all sentient beings.

original: theg pa de ni thogs pa med par byang chub kyi snying por 'gro bas na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi tshogs nyams su len par byed pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa de ni thogs pa med par byang chub kyi snying por 'gro bas na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi tshogs nyams su len par byed pa'o //
translated: This vehicle is the practice of the accumulation of omniscient wisdom because it goes to the site of enlightenment without obstruction.🔽This vehicle is the equal, unobstructed emission of light rays for all sentient beings because it is the field of giving for all sentient beings.

original: theg pa de ni sems can thams cad sbyin pa'i gnas kyi phyir sems can thams cad thogs pa med pa'i 'od zer mnyam par gtong ba'o; ;theg pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir lam ngan pa'i 'jigs pa thams cad las
analyzed: theg pa de ni sems can thams cad sbyin pa'i gnas kyi phyir sems can thams cad thogs pa med pa'i 'od zer mnyam par gtong ba'o; ;theg pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir lam ngan pa'i 'jigs pa thams cad las
translated: This vehicle is beyond all fear of bad paths because it is the direct perception of all the qualities of the Buddha.

original: 'das pa'o // theg pa de ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad dang; rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i rgyal mtshan dang / bdan bsgreng pa ste /
analyzed: 'das pa'o // theg pa de ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad dang; rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i rgyal mtshan dang / bdan bsgreng pa ste /
translated: This vehicle is the raising of the banner of the factors of awakening and dependent origination.

original: bdud dang / phas kyi rgol ba dang / ngan pa'i tshogs can gyi tshogs thams cad rab tu 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: bdud dang / phas kyi rgol ba dang / ngan pa'i tshogs can gyi tshogs thams cad rab tu 'joms pa'o //
translated: It is the complete vanquisher of all the hosts of Māra, opponents, and evil ones.

original: theg pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi theg pa sgrib pa med pa gyur pa ste /🔽mtha' dang / mtha' med pa dang / rtag pa dang / chad pa dang / 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dang / lta bar gyur pa thams @198a *//
analyzed: theg pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi theg pa sgrib pa med pa gyur pa ste / mtha' dang / mtha' med pa dang / rtag pa dang / chad pa dang / 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dang / lta bar gyur pa thams @198a *//
translated: This vehicle is the unobstructed vehicle of the buddhas.

original: cad dang / kun nas ldang ba dang / sgrib pa dang / chod pa dang / the tshom dang / 'gyod pa sel ba'o //
analyzed: cad dang / kun nas ldang ba dang / sgrib pa dang / chod pa dang / the tshom dang / 'gyod pa sel ba'o //
translated: It is the dispeller of all views, such as the view of an end, the view of no end, the view of permanence, the view of annihilation, the view of origination, the view of destruction, and all views, as well as the view of the afflictions, the view of obscurations, the view of obstacles, the view of doubt, and the view of regret.

original: theg pa de ni lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / snying rje chen pos phye bas na chos thams cad phun sum tshogs pa /
analyzed: theg pa de ni lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / snying rje chen pos phye bas na chos thams cad phun sum tshogs pa /
translated: This vehicle is distinguished by superior intention and great compassion. It is the perfection of all phenomena.

original: rin po che thams cad dang ldan pa /
analyzed: rin po che thams cad dang ldan pa /
translated: It is endowed with all jewels.

original: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad rnyed pa /
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad rnyed pa /
translated: It is the attainment of all perfections.

original: mi slu ba'i lam du 'gro pa /
analyzed: mi slu ba'i lam du 'gro pa /
translated: It is the path that leads to the undeceiving.

original: sems can thams nye bar 'tsho ba'o //
analyzed: sems can thams nye bar 'tsho ba'o //
translated: It is the sustenance of all beings.

original: theg pa de ni thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med pa ste /
analyzed: theg pa de ni thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med pa ste /
translated: This vehicle is completely free of any wrongdoing.

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang / mtshan dang / dpe byad bzang po dang; lus dang / ngag dang / sems kyi rgyan gyis brgyan pa ste /
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang / mtshan dang / dpe byad bzang po dang; lus dang / ngag dang / sems kyi rgyan gyis brgyan pa ste /
translated: and the adornments of the buddha-land.

original: gang 'di la mkhas pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang 'di la mkhas pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is skilled in these is said to be skilled in the Great Vehicle.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i chos thams cad la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i chos thams cad la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva’s skill in all the teachings?

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni mdor na 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas so //
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni mdor na 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas so //
translated: In brief, all the teachings are compounded and uncompounded.

original: de la byang chub sems dpas 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas la mkhas par bya ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpas 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas la mkhas par bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva should become skilled in the compounded and the uncompounded.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i 'dus byas la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i 'dus byas la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva’s skill in the compounded?

original: gang de dag lus kyi 'du byed dge ba dang / ngag gi 'du byed dge ba dang / yid kyi 'du byed dge ba mngon par 'dus byas pa de dag thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni /
analyzed: gang de dag lus kyi 'du byed dge ba dang / ngag gi 'du byed dge ba dang / yid kyi 'du byed dge ba mngon par 'dus byas pa de dag thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni /
translated: All those virtuous compositional activities of body, speech, and mind that are composed are dedicated to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'dus @198b byas la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'dus @198b byas la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattva’s expertise in the compounded.

original: gang yang dge ba'i lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi 'du byed mngon par 'dus byas pa de dag thams cad byang chub la rtog pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni /
analyzed: gang yang dge ba'i lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi 'du byed mngon par 'dus byas pa de dag thams cad byang chub la rtog pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni /
translated: Moreover, all those virtuous compositional activities of body, speech, and mind that are composed are dedicated to omniscience by being directed toward awakening.

original: de'i 'dus ma byas la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'dus ma byas la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called his expertise in the uncompounded.

original: gzhan yang / 'dus byas la mkhas pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po dag yang dag par sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang / 'dus byas la mkhas pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po dag yang dag par sgrub pa ste /
translated: Moreover, expertise in the compounded is the accomplishment of the five perfections.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: the perfection of generosity, the perfection of moral discipline, the perfection of patient acceptance, the perfection of perseverance, and the perfection of meditative concentration.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i 'dus byas la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i 'dus byas la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattva’s skill in the conditioned.

original: gang yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dus ma byas kyi ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po dag la mi smod cing /
analyzed: gang yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dus ma byas kyi ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po dag la mi smod cing /
translated: Moreover, the skill in the unconditioned is the bodhisattva’s non-repudiation of the five unconditioned perfections in the perfection of wisdom, the perfection of the knowledge of the unconditioned.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi tshogs dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par grol ba zag pa med pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni de'i 'dus ma byas la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi tshogs dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par grol ba zag pa med pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni de'i 'dus ma byas la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And the dedication to omniscience of the uncontaminated liberation of the bodhisattvas, by means of the accumulation of all the perfections and the accumulation of wholesome roots, is called the skill in the unconditioned.

original: gzhan yang / 'dus byas la mkhas pa ni gang sems can thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i 'od zer mnyam par gtong ba'i phyir bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can sdud pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i 'dus byas la mkhas pa'o //🔽gang yang sems can med pa dang / bdag med @199a *//🔽pas mi 'dzin mi len mchog tu 'dzin par mi byed cing /
analyzed: gzhan yang / 'dus byas la mkhas pa ni gang sems can thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i 'od zer mnyam par gtong ba'i phyir bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can sdud pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i 'dus byas la mkhas pa'o // gang yang sems can med pa dang / bdag med @199a *// pas mi 'dzin mi len mchog tu 'dzin par mi byed cing /
translated: Furthermore, the skill in the conditioned is the bodhisattva’s gathering of sentient beings through the four means of gathering, because they emit the light of unobstructed equality to all sentient beings.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po la mkhas pa de'ang 'dus ma byas la mos pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni de'i 'dus ma byas la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po la mkhas pa de'ang 'dus ma byas la mos pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni de'i 'dus ma byas la mkhas pa'o //
translated: The skill in the unconditioned is the bodhisattva’s non-grasping, non-appropriation, and non-fixation on the unconditioned, because they do not grasp or appropriate sentient beings or a self, and they dedicate their skill in the means of gathering to omniscience.

original: gzhan yang / 'dus byas la mkhas pa ni gang 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi nyon mongs pa rnams gcod pa dang / 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams mi gcod pa dang / byang chub sgrub pa'i kun tu sbyor ba rnams kyi rgyun 'brel pa nyi tshe ba'i kun tu sbyor ba rnams kun tu mi spyad pa 'di ni 'dus byas la mkhas pa zhes bya'o; ;gang yang stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang / 'dus byas la mkhas pa ni gang 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi nyon mongs pa rnams gcod pa dang / 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams mi gcod pa dang / byang chub sgrub pa'i kun tu sbyor ba rnams kyi rgyun 'brel pa nyi tshe ba'i kun tu sbyor ba rnams kun tu mi spyad pa 'di ni 'dus byas la mkhas pa zhes bya'o; ;gang yang stong pa nyid dang /
translated: Moreover, being skilled in conditioned phenomena means to cut through the afflictions of the continuum of saṃsāra, not to cut through the roots of virtue of the continuum of saṃsāra, and to not engage in the limited fetters that are the fetters of accomplishing awakening.

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i chos rnams la 'dris par byed pa'i ye shes rtog pa la mkhas pa dang / byang chub gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog cing 'dus ma byas kyang mngon sum du mi byed pa 'di ni de'i 'dus ma byas la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i chos rnams la 'dris par byed pa'i ye shes rtog pa la mkhas pa dang / byang chub gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog cing 'dus ma byas kyang mngon sum du mi byed pa 'di ni de'i 'dus ma byas la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Being skilled in the unconditioned means to be skilled in the wisdom that familiarizes with the phenomena of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, to not rely on another for awakening, and to not actualize the unconditioned.

original: gzhan yang / 'dus byas la mkhas pa ni gang khams gsum la'ang spyod la; khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis kyang mi gos pa 'di ni de'i 'dus byas la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang / 'dus byas la mkhas pa ni gang khams gsum la'ang spyod la; khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis kyang mi gos pa 'di ni de'i 'dus byas la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, being skilled in the conditioned means to engage with the three realms while remaining unstained by the afflictions of the three realms.

original: gzhan yang / khams gsum nas nges par 'byung ba'i ye shes rab tu shes kyang nges par 'byung ba'i dbyings su'ang mi ltung ba 'di ni de'i 'dus ma byas la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang / khams gsum nas nges par 'byung ba'i ye shes rab tu shes kyang nges par 'byung ba'i dbyings su'ang mi ltung ba 'di ni de'i 'dus ma byas la mkhas pa'o //
translated: Moreover, being skilled in the unconditioned means to know the wisdom that definitely emerges from the three realms without falling into the realm of definite emergence.

original: gang chos thams cad la mkhas pa zhes smras pa de ni thams cad mkhyen @199b pa'i tshig bla dvags so //
analyzed: gang chos thams cad la mkhas pa zhes smras pa de ni thams cad mkhyen @199b pa'i tshig bla dvags so //
translated: “Skill in all phenomena” is a synonym for omniscience.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rtag tu dran pa dang / blo gros dang / shes rab la mkhas pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes tshad med cing mi chags pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rtag tu dran pa dang / blo gros dang / shes rab la mkhas pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes tshad med cing mi chags pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is the skill in mindfulness, intelligence, and insight that brings about the completion of the boundless and unattached wisdom of omniscience.

original: de'i phyir chos thams cad la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos thams cad la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called skill in all phenomena.

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: mkhas pa brgyad po de dag gis zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab mi zad pa yin no //
analyzed: mkhas pa brgyad po de dag gis zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab mi zad pa yin no //
translated: the wisdom of bodhisattvas who are skilled in these eight is inexhaustible.

original: gzhan yang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i chos rnams rab tu shes pa ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: gzhan yang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i chos rnams rab tu shes pa ni shes rab bo //
translated: Moreover, the knowledge of wholesome and unwholesome phenomena is wisdom.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la rtog pa ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la rtog pa ni shes rab bo //
translated: The investigation of phenomena that are conducive to penetration is wisdom.

original: 'phags pa'i chos mngon par gyur pas na shes rab ni tshad mar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos mngon par gyur pas na shes rab ni tshad mar gyur pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is authoritative because it is the noble Dharma.

original: shes rab ni lta bar gyur pa dang / kun nas ldang ba dang / sgrib pa dang / chod pa thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni lta bar gyur pa dang / kun nas ldang ba dang / sgrib pa dang / chod pa thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu rtogs pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is the correct understanding of all views, compulsions, obscurations, and hindrances.

original: shes rab ni 'dod pa dang / re ba dang / smon pa thams cad kyi smon lam dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni 'dod pa dang / re ba dang / smon pa thams cad kyi smon lam dang bral ba'o //
translated: Wisdom is free from the aspirations of all desires, hopes, and wishes.

original: shes rab ni nyon mongs pa'i yongs su gdung ba thams cad 'jil bas na sim par byed pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni nyon mongs pa'i yongs su gdung ba thams cad 'jil bas na sim par byed pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is refreshing because it dispels all the torments of the afflictions.

original: shes rab ni chos kyi kun dga' la dga' ba'i rgyun ma chad pas na mchog tu dga' bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni chos kyi kun dga' la dga' ba'i rgyun ma chad pas na mchog tu dga' bar byed pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is the supreme joy, for it is the uninterrupted flow of delight in the joy of the Dharma.

original: shes rab ni don shes pa mngon sum du gyur pas rton pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni don shes pa mngon sum du gyur pas rton pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is the reliance, for it is the direct experience of the knowledge of reality.

original: shes rab ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun po dag gi rten to //
analyzed: shes rab ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun po dag gi rten to //
translated: Wisdom is the support of the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment.

original: shes rab ni theg pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'bras bu thob par gyur pas na thob pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: shes rab ni theg pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'bras bu thob par gyur pas na thob pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Wisdom is the characteristic of attainment, for it is the attainment of the fruit in accordance with the vehicle.

original: shes @200a *// rab ni rang bzhin gyis ye shes snang bas na rab tu shes pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: shes @200a *// rab ni rang bzhin gyis ye shes snang bas na rab tu shes pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Wisdom is the characteristic of knowledge, for it is the light of knowledge by nature.🔽Wisdom is the perfect crossing over, for it crosses over all the rivers.

original: shes rab ni chu bo thams cad las sgrol bas na yang dag par rab tu sgrol ba'o; ;shes rab ni yang dag par skyon med par 'dren pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni chu bo thams cad las sgrol bas na yang dag par rab tu sgrol ba'o; ;shes rab ni yang dag par skyon med par 'dren pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is the perfect guide, for it leads to the absence of error.

original: shes rab ni dge ba'i chos thams cad rab tu sdud pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni dge ba'i chos thams cad rab tu sdud pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is the gathering of all the wholesome dharmas.

original: shes rab ni sngon gyi nyon mongs pa dang / bag la nyal thams cad dang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni sngon gyi nyon mongs pa dang / bag la nyal thams cad dang bar byed pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is the purification of all the defilements and propensities of the past.

original: shes rab ni rtse mor gyur pa'i shes rab kyi mchog go /
analyzed: shes rab ni rtse mor gyur pa'i shes rab kyi mchog go /
translated: Wisdom is the supreme, highest wisdom.

original: shes rab ni rang byung gi ye shes rtogs pa'i phyir gya nom pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni rang byung gi ye shes rtogs pa'i phyir gya nom pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is sublime because it realizes self-arisen wisdom.

original: shes rab ni khams gsum pa thams cad dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir rgyu dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni khams gsum pa thams cad dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir rgyu dang bral ba'o //
translated: Wisdom is free from causes because it is unmixed with the three realms.

original: shes rab ni thabs kun gyis zin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni thabs kun gyis zin pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is embraced by all means.

original: shes rab ni 'phags pa thams cad kyis yongs su bzung ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni 'phags pa thams cad kyis yongs su bzung ba'o //
translated: Wisdom is embraced by all the noble ones.

original: shes rab ni mtshan ma dang; yongs su rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir tshad gzung du med pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni mtshan ma dang; yongs su rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir tshad gzung du med pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is immeasurable because it is free from all signs and concepts.🔽Wisdom is the antidote to carelessness because it is free from all ignorance and the darkness of delusion.

original: shes rab ni ma rig pa dang / gti mug gi mun pa thams cad ngang bral bas na bag med pa'i gnyen po'o; ;shes rab ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa thams cad kyi sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni ma rig pa dang / gti mug gi mun pa thams cad ngang bral bas na bag med pa'i gnyen po'o; ;shes rab ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa thams cad kyi sbyor ba'o //
translated: Wisdom is the practice of all those who abide on the bodhisattva levels.

original: shes rab ni theg pa thams cad la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams kyi 'dren pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni theg pa thams cad la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams kyi 'dren pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is the guide for those who have entered all vehicles.

original: shes rab ni ma rig pa dang / gti mug gi mun pa dang rab ring kyi ling tog sel bar byed pa'i phyir snang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni ma rig pa dang / gti mug gi mun pa dang rab ring kyi ling tog sel bar byed pa'i phyir snang bar byed pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is the light because it dispels the darkness of ignorance and the cataracts of delusion.

original: shes rab ni mig la ji ltar mos pa rnams la mig thams cad @200b spyin par byed pa'o //🔽shes rab ni mig dang / gzugs kyi lam las yang dag par 'das pa dang / de bzhin du rna ba dang / sgra dang / sna dang / dri dang / lce dang / ro dang / lus dang / reg bya dang / yid dang /
analyzed: shes rab ni mig la ji ltar mos pa rnams la mig thams cad @200b spyin par byed pa'o // shes rab ni mig dang / gzugs kyi lam las yang dag par 'das pa dang / de bzhin du rna ba dang / sgra dang / sna dang / dri dang / lce dang / ro dang / lus dang / reg bya dang / yid dang /
translated: Wisdom is the eye, for it gives the eye to those who are blind.

original: chos kyi lam las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir gnas med pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi lam las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir gnas med pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is the absence of a basis, for it transcends the paths of the eye and form, and likewise the ear and sound, the nose and smell, the tongue and taste, the body and touch, and the mind and mental objects.

original: shes rab ni bden pa las nges par 'byung bas don dam pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni bden pa las nges par 'byung bas don dam pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is the ultimate, for it is the deliverance from the truths.

original: shes rab ni shin tu dul ba rnams kyi mi 'khrugs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni shin tu dul ba rnams kyi mi 'khrugs pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is the unshakability of those who are well disciplined.

original: shes rab ni ye shes kyi sgo rnams kyi snang ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni ye shes kyi sgo rnams kyi snang ba'o //
translated: Wisdom is the light of the doors of knowledge.

original: shes rab ni thams cad du rgyu ba ste mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni thams cad du rgyu ba ste mi zad pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is the movement everywhere, for it is inexhaustible.

original: shes rab ni brten pa las 'jug pa mthong ba ste mi 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni brten pa las 'jug pa mthong ba ste mi 'gal ba'o //
translated: Wisdom is the vision of engagement through support, and is not contradictory.

original: shes rab ni 'dzin pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i bcings pa thams cad gcod pa'i phyir rnam par thar pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: shes rab ni 'dzin pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i bcings pa thams cad gcod pa'i phyir rnam par thar pa'i lam mo //
translated: Wisdom is the path of liberation, because it cuts through all the bonds of grasping and afflictive emotions.

original: shes rab ni nyon mongs pa thams cad dang ma 'dres /
analyzed: shes rab ni nyon mongs pa thams cad dang ma 'dres /
translated: Wisdom is not mixed up with any of the afflictive emotions.
