original: pa'o; ;shes rab ni 'grogs pa dang / sgrib pa dang / sgrib par 'gyur pa'i chos thams cad dang lhan cig mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o; ;shes rab ni 'grogs pa dang / sgrib pa dang / sgrib par 'gyur pa'i chos thams cad dang lhan cig mi gnas pa'o //
translated: Wisdom does not coexist with any of the obscurations and obscuring factors.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa ji snyed par shes rab dang / ye shes kyi las kyang de snyed do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa ji snyed par shes rab dang / ye shes kyi las kyang de snyed do //
translated: Wisdom and the activity of wisdom are as numerous as the mental activities of all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa dang / bag la nyal ji snyed par shes rab kyi spyod pa'i ye shes kyang de snyed do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa dang / bag la nyal ji snyed par shes rab kyi spyod pa'i ye shes kyang de snyed do //
translated: The wisdom of the activity of wisdom is as numerous as the afflictive emotions and latent tendencies of all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i sgo ji snyed par shes rab la 'jug pa'i sgo'ang de snyed do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i sgo ji snyed par shes rab la 'jug pa'i sgo'ang de snyed do //
translated: The doors of engagement with wisdom are as numerous as the doors of the afflictive emotions of all sentient beings.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i @201a *//
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i @201a *//
translated: the wisdom of the śrāvakas,🔽the wisdom of the pratyekabuddhas,🔽the wisdom of the bodhisattvas, and

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi shes rab ji snyed pa shes rab kyi gnas dang / rten kyang de snyed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi shes rab ji snyed pa shes rab kyi gnas dang / rten kyang de snyed do //
translated: the wisdom of the perfectly awakened buddhas.

original: de la byang chub sems dpas bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpas bslab par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas should train in this.

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab mi zad pa ste /
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab mi zad pa ste /
translated: this is the bodhisattvas’ imperishable wisdom.

original: shes rab mi zad pa 'dis byang chub sems dpa' rnams ye shes mi zad pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab mi zad pa 'dis byang chub sems dpa' rnams ye shes mi zad pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Through this imperishable wisdom, bodhisattvas attain imperishable wisdom.”

original: shes rab mi zad pa bstan pa'i chos kyi le'u 'di bshad pa na byang chub sems dpa' sngon yongs su sbyang ba byas pa sum khri nyis stong gis mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to; ;de nas byang chub sems dpa' blo gros mi zad
analyzed: shes rab mi zad pa bstan pa'i chos kyi le'u 'di bshad pa na byang chub sems dpa' sngon yongs su sbyang ba byas pa sum khri nyis stong gis mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to; ;de nas byang chub sems dpa' blo gros mi zad
translated: When this chapter of the Dharma, “The Teaching of the Imperishability of Wisdom,” was explained, thirty-two thousand bodhisattvas who had previously completed their training attained the acceptance of the nonorigination of phenomena.🔽Then the bodhisattva Akṣayamati

original: pas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: pas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: He said to the venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byams pa'ang mi zad pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byams pa'ang mi zad pa ste /
translated: the love of the bodhisatvas is also inexhaustible.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: thug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is limitless.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byams pa ni thug pa med par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byams pa ni thug pa med par shes par bya ste /
translated: The love of the bodhisatvas should be known to be limitless.

original: de dag gi byams pa nye bar sgrub pa yongs su chad pa med do //
analyzed: de dag gi byams pa nye bar sgrub pa yongs su chad pa med do //
translated: The accomplishment of their love is uninterrupted.🔽In this way, the bodhisatvas’ love pervades as far as the realm of sentient beings extends.

original: 'di ltar sems can gyis khams ji tsam pa de tsam du byang chub sems dpa' de'i byams pa'i sems bskyed pas khyab par byed do; ;btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can gyis khams ji tsam pa de tsam du byang chub sems dpa' de'i byams pa'i sems bskyed pas khyab par byed do; ;btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: dper na / nam mkha' 'dis gar yang ma khyab pa med do //
analyzed: dper na / nam mkha' 'dis gar yang ma khyab pa med do //
translated: there is nowhere in space that is not pervaded.

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i byams @201b pa 'dis gar ma khyab pa'i sems can de gang yang med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i byams @201b pa 'dis gar ma khyab pa'i sems can de gang yang med do //
translated: in the same way, there is no sentient being whatsoever that is not pervaded by the bodhisatvas’ love.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / sems can gyi khams ni tshad med de /
analyzed: dper na / sems can gyi khams ni tshad med de /
translated: For example, the realm of sentient beings is immeasurable.

original: de la zad pa med do //
analyzed: de la zad pa med do //
translated: It is inexhaustible.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i byams pa bsgom pa'ang tshad med de /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i byams pa bsgom pa'ang tshad med de /
translated: In the same way, the cultivation of love by the bodhisattvas is immeasurable.

original: de la zad pa med do //
analyzed: de la zad pa med do //
translated: It is inexhaustible.

original: 'di ltar nam mkha'i mi zad pas na sems can mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar nam mkha'i mi zad pas na sems can mi zad pa'o //
translated: Because the realm of sentient beings is inexhaustible due to the inexhaustibility of space.

original: sems can mi zad pas na byams pa mi zad de /
analyzed: sems can mi zad pas na byams pa mi zad de /
translated: And because the realm of sentient beings is inexhaustible, love is inexhaustible.

original: de'i phyir skyes bu dam pa de dag gi byams pa mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir skyes bu dam pa de dag gi byams pa mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the love of those holy beings is said to be inexhaustible.

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus byang chub sems dpa' blo gros mi zad pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus byang chub sems dpa' blo gros mi zad pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: When this was said, the elder Śāriputra said to the bodhisattva Akṣayamati,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of good family,

original: sems can gyi khams 'di ji tsam /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams 'di ji tsam /
translated: how vast is this realm of sentient beings?”

original: blo gros mi zad pas smras pa /
analyzed: blo gros mi zad pas smras pa /
translated: Akṣayamati replied,

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams ji snyed pa de bas kyang sems can gyi khams ches mang ngo //
analyzed: sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams ji snyed pa de bas kyang sems can gyi khams ches mang ngo //
translated: the realm of sentient beings is even vaster than the realms of earth, water, fire, and wind.”

original: smras pa / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: smras pa / rigs kyi bu /
translated: He replied, Son of good family,

original: dpe bya bar nus sam /
analyzed: dpe bya bar nus sam /
translated: can you make a comparison?

original: blo gros mi zad pas smras pa /
analyzed: blo gros mi zad pas smras pa /
translated: Aksayamati said,

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: nus mod kyi rgyu chung ngus ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nus mod kyi rgyu chung ngus ni ma yin no //
translated: I can, but not with a small cause.

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: dper na / shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed de /
analyzed: dper na / shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed de /
translated: For example, in the eastern direction there are as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River.

original: de bzhin du lho phyogs dang / de bzhin du nub phyogs dang; de bzhin du byang phyogs dang / de bzhin du phyogs bcu kun tu phyogs re rer yang 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed de dag thams cad rgya mtsho chen po chus yongs @202a *//🔽su gang ba gcig tu gyur la /
analyzed: de bzhin du lho phyogs dang / de bzhin du nub phyogs dang; de bzhin du byang phyogs dang / de bzhin du phyogs bcu kun tu phyogs re rer yang 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed de dag thams cad rgya mtsho chen po chus yongs @202a *//🔽su gang ba gcig tu gyur la /
translated: In the same way, in the south, in the same way in the west, in the same way in the north, and in the same way in all ten directions, in each direction there are as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River. All of them become a single great ocean filled with water.

original: sems can gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag 'dus te skra'i rtse mo brgyar gshags pa'i chas de las chu thigs pa gcig blangs la; de bzhin du gang na'ang sems can gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag 'dus te bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag🔽na skra'i rtse mo brgyar gshags pa'i chas chu las thigs pa gnyis blangs la /
analyzed: sems can gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag 'dus te skra'i rtse mo brgyar gshags pa'i chas de las chu thigs pa gcig blangs la; de bzhin du gang na'ang sems can gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag 'dus te bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na skra'i rtse mo brgyar gshags pa'i chas chu las thigs pa gnyis blangs la /
translated: “Śāradvatī­putra, suppose that all the sentient beings equal to the grains of sand in the Ganges river gathered together and took up a single drop of water with a hundredth of a hair tip split a hundred times.🔽In the same way, suppose that all the sentient beings equal to the grains of sand in the Ganges river gathered together and took up two drops of water with a hundredth of a hair tip split a hundred times.

original: mtshan ma bzhag pa 'di dang / bgrang ba 'di lta bus bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed cing sems can gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag gis skra'i rtse mo brgyar gshags pa'i chas chu'i thigs pa re re blangs pas chu'i phung po de tsam zad par gyur kyang sems can gyi khams
analyzed: mtshan ma bzhag pa 'di dang / bgrang ba 'di lta bus bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed cing sems can gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag gis skra'i rtse mo brgyar gshags pa'i chas chu'i thigs pa re re blangs pas chu'i phung po de tsam zad par gyur kyang sems can gyi khams
translated: “Śāradvatī­putra, by this token and by this reckoning, even if all the sentient beings equal to the grains of sand in the Ganges river gathered together and took up a single drop of water with a hundredth of a hair tip split a hundred times,

original: de ni thug pa'am zad pa gang yang med do //
analyzed: de ni thug pa'am zad pa gang yang med do //
translated: the extent of the realm of sentient beings would not be exhausted or even diminished.

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatī­putra,

original: de ltar sems can gyi khams tshad med de /
analyzed: de ltar sems can gyi khams tshad med de /
translated: Thus, the realm of sentient beings is immeasurable.

original: de dag la byang chub sems dpa'i byams pas khyab par byed do //
analyzed: de dag la byang chub sems dpa'i byams pas khyab par byed do //
translated: The bodhisattvas pervade them with their love.

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: what do you think?

original: gang gi byams pa de lta bur sgom pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba tshad med pa de zad par nus sam /🔽smras pa / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: gang gi byams pa de lta bur sgom pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba tshad med pa de zad par nus sam / smras pa / rigs kyi bu /
translated: Can the immeasurable roots of virtue of those who cultivate love in this way be exhausted?”

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: He replied, “No, son of noble family.

original: byams pa sgom pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di 'dra ba zad par su 'dod pa de nam mkha' zad par 'dod do //
analyzed: byams pa sgom pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di 'dra ba zad par su 'dod pa de nam mkha' zad par 'dod do //
translated: Whoever wishes to exhaust such roots of virtue as the cultivation of love wishes to exhaust space.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang gis byams pa mi zad pa 'di thos nas skrag par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang gis byams pa mi zad pa 'di thos nas skrag par mi 'gyur na /
translated: Those bodhisattvas who, upon hearing this imperishable love, are not frightened

original: de dag kyang byams pa mi @202b zad par 'phags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang byams pa mi @202b zad par 'phags par 'gyur ro //
translated: will also become exalted in their imperishable love.”

original: blo gros mi zad pas smras pa /
analyzed: blo gros mi zad pas smras pa /
translated: Akṣayamati said,

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: byams pa ni bdag srung zhing gzhan la phan par gnas pa ste /
analyzed: byams pa ni bdag srung zhing gzhan la phan par gnas pa ste /
translated: love protects oneself and benefits others.

original: mchog tu rtsod pa med pa dang; gnod sems kyi tha ba'i skyon dang / khro ba dang / 'khon du 'dzin pa thams cad rab tu 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu rtsod pa med pa dang; gnod sems kyi tha ba'i skyon dang / khro ba dang / 'khon du 'dzin pa thams cad rab tu 'joms pa'o //
translated: It is the supreme absence of conflict. It is the complete destruction of the faults of malice and the faults of anger and resentment.

original: bag la nyal dang / kun nas ldang ba dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: bag la nyal dang / kun nas ldang ba dang bral ba ste /
translated: It is free from latent tendencies and the arising of afflictions.

original: dad pa skyed cing sems can thams cad kyi 'khrul pa la nyes par mi lta'o //
analyzed: dad pa skyed cing sems can thams cad kyi 'khrul pa la nyes par mi lta'o //
translated: It is the generation of faith and the non-observation of the faults of sentient beings.

original: yongs su gdung ba med cing lus dang / sems bde ba skyed pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su gdung ba med cing lus dang / sems bde ba skyed pa ste /
translated: It is the absence of torment and the generation of physical and mental bliss.

original: gzhan gyi gnod par bya ba las shin tu 'das pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi gnod par bya ba las shin tu 'das pa'o //
translated: It is the transcendence of the harm of others.

original: nyes pa thams cad kyi 'jigs pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: nyes pa thams cad kyi 'jigs pa dang bral ba ste /
translated: It is the freedom from the fear of all faults.

original: 'phags pa'i lam dang mthun zhing gshe ba dang / sdang ba'i sems dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams dad par byed pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam dang mthun zhing gshe ba dang / sdang ba'i sems dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams dad par byed pa /
translated: It is in accord with the noble path and it generates faith in sentient beings who have a mind of anger and hatred.

original: g-yul thams cad las sgrol ba ste /
analyzed: g-yul thams cad las sgrol ba ste /
translated: It is the liberation from all battles.

original: dbyig pa dang / mtshon cha 'chang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dbyig pa dang / mtshon cha 'chang ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not the holding of sticks and weapons.

original: sems can thams cad rab tu thar bar bya ba la dga' ba /
analyzed: sems can thams cad rab tu thar bar bya ba la dga' ba /
translated: It is the delight in the complete liberation of all sentient beings.

original: khong khro ba thams cad dang bral ba /
analyzed: khong khro ba thams cad dang bral ba /
translated: He is free from all anger.

original: tshul 'chos pa dang / kha gsag dang / thob kyis 'jal ba thams cad dang bral ba /
analyzed: tshul 'chos pa dang / kha gsag dang / thob kyis 'jal ba thams cad dang bral ba /
translated: He is free from all hypocrisy, flattery, and domineering.

original: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa thams cad 'byung bar byed pa /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa thams cad 'byung bar byed pa /
translated: He is the one who brings forth all gain, respect, and praise.

original: brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba thams cad kyis phyag byas pa /
analyzed: brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba thams cad kyis phyag byas pa /
translated: He is the one who is bowed to by all Śakras, Brahmās, and Lokapālas.

original: rang gi gzi brjid kyi rgyan gyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: rang gi gzi brjid kyi rgyan gyis brgyan pa /
translated: He is the one who is adorned with the ornaments of his own splendor.

original: mkhas pas rab tu bsngags pa /
analyzed: mkhas pas rab tu bsngags pa /
translated: He is the one who is praised by the wise.

original: byis pa thams cad srung ba /
analyzed: byis pa thams cad srung ba /
translated: He is the one who protects all the foolish.

original: tshangs pa'i lam dang mthun pa /🔽'dod pa'i khams @203a *//
analyzed: tshangs pa'i lam dang mthun pa / 'dod pa'i khams @203a *//
translated: He is the one who is in accord with the path of Brahmā.

original: dang ma 'dres pa /
analyzed: dang ma 'dres pa /
translated: He is the one who is not mixed up in the desire realm.

original: sems can thams cad thar pa'i lam gyi mchog theg pa thams cad yang dag par bsdus pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad thar pa'i lam gyi mchog theg pa thams cad yang dag par bsdus pa /
translated: He is the one who is the supreme path to liberation for all beings, who includes all vehicles.

original: zang zing med pa'i bsod nams kyis bzung ba /
analyzed: zang zing med pa'i bsod nams kyis bzung ba /
translated: He is the one who is held by the merit of being free from material things.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs thams cad bsags pa /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs thams cad bsags pa /
translated: He is the one who has accumulated all the accumulations of merit.

original: rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po thams cad kyis zil gyis nyin no ba /
analyzed: rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po thams cad kyis zil gyis nyin no ba /
translated: He surpasses all the things that create merit that come from material generosity.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus brgyan pa /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus brgyan pa /
translated: He is adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great being and the eighty minor marks.

original: dbang po nyams pa dang / ma tshang ba thams cad spangs pa /
analyzed: dbang po nyams pa dang / ma tshang ba thams cad spangs pa /
translated: He has abandoned all the defects and deficiencies of the faculties.

original: bde 'gro thams cad dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam dang mthun pa /
analyzed: bde 'gro thams cad dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam dang mthun pa /
translated: He is in accord with the path to all happy rebirths and to nirvāṇa.

original: ngan song thams cad dang / mi khom pa brgyad las 'das pa /
analyzed: ngan song thams cad dang / mi khom pa brgyad las 'das pa /
translated: He has transcended all the lower realms and the eight unfavorable states.

original: chos kyi kun dga' la mos pa /
analyzed: chos kyi kun dga' la mos pa /
translated: He delights in the joy of the Dharma.

original: 'dod pa dang / longs spyong kyi dbang phyug la mngon par dga' ba med pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / longs spyong kyi dbang phyug la mngon par dga' ba med pa /
translated: He has no interest in the mastery of desire and enjoyment.

original: sems can thams cad la sems snyoms pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la sems snyoms pa /
translated: He is impartial toward all sentient beings.

original: spyin pa'i spyor ba tha dad pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: spyin pa'i spyor ba tha dad pa dang bral ba /
translated: He is free from the different practices of generosity.

original: tshul khrims dang / bslab pa thams cad kyi sgo dang / tshul khrims 'chal ba thams cad yongs su skyob pa /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / bslab pa thams cad kyi sgo dang / tshul khrims 'chal ba thams cad yongs su skyob pa /
translated: He is the door of all the trainings and moral disciplines and he protects all those with faulty moral discipline.

original: bzod pa'i stobs ston pa dang / nga rgyal dang / rgyags pa dang / dregs pa thams cad dang bral ba /
analyzed: bzod pa'i stobs ston pa dang / nga rgyal dang / rgyags pa dang / dregs pa thams cad dang bral ba /
translated: and being free from pride, conceit, and arrogance.

original: 'phags pa rnams 'jug pa'i bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i rtsa ba mi 'khrugs pa'i brtson 'grus brtsams shing yang dag par sbyor ba /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams 'jug pa'i bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i rtsa ba mi 'khrugs pa'i brtson 'grus brtsams shing yang dag par sbyor ba /
translated: They are the roots of the noble ones’ concentration, absorption, and meditative equipoise, and they are the roots of the diligence that is applied and correct.

original: bya ba thams cad las yang dag par sgrol ba /
analyzed: bya ba thams cad las yang dag par sgrol ba /
translated: They are the perfect liberation from all activities.

original: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par @203b 'jug pas nyon mongs pa thams cad las nges par 'byung ba /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par @203b 'jug pas nyon mongs pa thams cad las nges par 'byung ba /
translated: They are the definite deliverance from all afflictions through concentration, liberation, absorption, and meditative equipoise.

original: gsang sngags dang / thos pa 'dzin pas nges par sems pa'i shes rab kyi rgyu skyed pa /
analyzed: gsang sngags dang / thos pa 'dzin pas nges par sems pa'i shes rab kyi rgyu skyed pa /
translated: They are the causes of the wisdom of definite reflection through the retention of secret mantras and learning.

original: rang gi phyogs dang / gzhan gyi phyogs la nges pa; bdud kyi phyogs dang / nyon mongs pa rnams bsal ba /
analyzed: rang gi phyogs dang / gzhan gyi phyogs la nges pa; bdud kyi phyogs dang / nyon mongs pa rnams bsal ba /
translated: They are the causes of the elimination of the afflictions and the forces of Māra, one’s own and others’ positions.

original: 'grogs na bde ba /
analyzed: 'grogs na bde ba /
translated: They are the causes of being easy to be with.

original: bsnyen bkur dang 'jug pa'i rgyu mthun pa la sems pa /
analyzed: bsnyen bkur dang 'jug pa'i rgyu mthun pa la sems pa /
translated: They are the causes of being served and respected.

original: spyod lam srung bar byed pa /
analyzed: spyod lam srung bar byed pa /
translated: It protects one’s behavior.

original: rgod pa thams cad las 'das pa /
analyzed: rgod pa thams cad las 'das pa /
translated: It transcends all agitation.

original: nga rgyal gyi las sel ba /
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi las sel ba /
translated: It removes the activity of pride.

original: ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pas byugs shing dri zhim pa ste /
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pas byugs shing dri zhim pa ste /
translated: It is anointed with shame and modesty, and has a sweet fragrance.

original: bag chags dang / mtshams sbyor ba dang / nyon mongs pa'i dri nga ba sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: bag chags dang / mtshams sbyor ba dang / nyon mongs pa'i dri nga ba sbyong ba'o //
translated: It purifies the bad smells of traces, connections, and afflictions.

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: byams pa ni sems can thams cad yongs su skyob pa ste /
analyzed: byams pa ni sems can thams cad yongs su skyob pa ste /
translated: loving kindness is the protection of all sentient beings.

original: byams pa chen po ni bdag gi bde ba gtong zhing sems can rnams la bde ba sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa chen po ni bdag gi bde ba gtong zhing sems can rnams la bde ba sbyin pa'o //
translated: Great loving kindness is giving up one’s own happiness and giving happiness to sentient beings.

original: nyan thos rnams kyi byams pa ni bdag skyong ba'o //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyi byams pa ni bdag skyong ba'o //
translated: The loving kindness of the hearers is the protection of oneself.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byams pa chen po ni sems can thams cad yongs su skyob pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byams pa chen po ni sems can thams cad yongs su skyob pa'o //
translated: The great loving kindness of the bodhisattvas is the protection of all sentient beings.

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: byams pa ni chu bo las sgrol ba'o //
analyzed: byams pa ni chu bo las sgrol ba'o //
translated: loving kindness is the crossing of the river.

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: byams pa ni gsum po 'di dag ste /
analyzed: byams pa ni gsum po 'di dag ste /
translated: loving kindness is threefold.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: sems can la dmigs pa'i byams pa dang / chos la dmigs pa'i byams pa dang / dmigs pa med pa'i byams pa'o //
analyzed: sems can la dmigs pa'i byams pa dang / chos la dmigs pa'i byams pa dang / dmigs pa med pa'i byams pa'o //
translated: love that focuses on sentient beings, love that focuses on phenomena, and love that is without focus.

original: de la sems can la dmigs pa'i byams pa ni sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi'o //🔽chos la dmigs @204a *//
analyzed: de la sems can la dmigs pa'i byams pa ni sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi'o // chos la dmigs @204a *//
translated: Among them, the love that focuses on sentient beings is that of bodhisattvas who have generated the first level of bodhicitta.

original: pa'i byams pa ni spyod pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: pa'i byams pa ni spyod pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi'o //
translated: The love that focuses on phenomena is that of bodhisattvas who have entered the bodhisattva way of life.

original: dmigs pa med pa'i byams pa ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i byams pa ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ste /
translated: The love that is without focus is that of bodhisattvas who have attained the acceptance that phenomena are unborn.

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byams pa mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byams pa mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: this is called the bodhisattvas’ imperishable love.

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying rje chen po'ang mi zad pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying rje chen po'ang mi zad pa ste /
translated: furthermore, the bodhisattvas’ great compassion is also imperishable.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the forerunner.

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: dper na / dbugs byung ba dang / rdub pa ni skyes bu chen po'i srog gi dbang po'i sngon du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: dper na / dbugs byung ba dang / rdub pa ni skyes bu chen po'i srog gi dbang po'i sngon du 'gro ba'o //
translated: For example, the in-breath and out-breath are the precursors of the life faculty of a great being.

original: de bzhin du theg pa chen po yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po ni sngon du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du theg pa chen po yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po ni sngon du 'gro ba'o //
translated: In the same way, great compassion is the precursor of a bodhisattva’s accomplishment of the Great Vehicle.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i 'khor lo rin po chen rin po che sna bdun gyi sngon du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: dper na / 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i 'khor lo rin po chen rin po che sna bdun gyi sngon du 'gro ba'o //
translated: For example, the precious wheel of a wheel-turning king is the precursor of the seven precious substances.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rnams thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yang dag par sgrub pa la snying rje chen po ni sngon du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rnams thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yang dag par sgrub pa la snying rje chen po ni sngon du 'gro ba'o //
translated: In the same way, great compassion is the precursor of a bodhisattva’s accomplishment of the wisdom of omniscience.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / tshong dpon nam /
analyzed: dper na / tshong dpon nam /
translated: For example, a merchant or

original: khyim bdag bu gcig pa la snying thag pa nas sdug par 'dzin pa de bzhin du snying rje chen po la rab tu gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad la snying thag pa nas sdug par 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: khyim bdag bu gcig pa la snying thag pa nas sdug par 'dzin pa de bzhin du snying rje chen po la rab tu gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad la snying thag pa nas sdug par 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Just as a householder loves his only son with all his heart, so the bodhisattva who is established in great compassion loves all beings with all his heart.

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽snying rje @204b chen po zhes bya ba ni 'di bdag nyid kyis bya bas na de'i phyir snying rje chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu / snying rje @204b chen po zhes bya ba ni 'di bdag nyid kyis bya bas na de'i phyir snying rje chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,🔽great compassion is so called because it is an activity that is done by oneself.

original: rang gi bya bas na snying rje chen po'o //
analyzed: rang gi bya bas na snying rje chen po'o //
translated: It is great compassion because it is one's own activity.

original: gzhan gyi skabs mi rnyed pas na snying rje chen po'o //🔽g-yo med pa las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni bsam pa thag pa nas bya ba'o //🔽sgyu med pa las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi skabs mi rnyed pas na snying rje chen po'o // g-yo med pa las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni bsam pa thag pa nas bya ba'o // sgyu med pa las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni sbyor ba'o //
translated: It is great compassion because it does not give an opportunity to others.🔽It is great compassion that is done with a sincere intention because it arises from non-deception.🔽It is great compassion that is applied because it arises from non-fraudulence.

original: phyir mi ldog pa las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni lhag pa'i bsam pas bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni lhag pa'i bsam pas bya ba'o //
translated: It is great compassion that is done with an altruistic intention because it arises from irreversibility.

original: ma bcos pa las byung bas na snying rje chen po'i rang bzhin rig pa'o //
analyzed: ma bcos pa las byung bas na snying rje chen po'i rang bzhin rig pa'o //
translated: It is the nature of great compassion because it arises from the uncontrived.

original: lam drang po nas byung bas na snying rje chen po ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: lam drang po nas byung bas na snying rje chen po ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: It is the natural purity of great compassion because it arises from the straight path.

original: gsal ba las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni sems kyi gyu med pa'o //
analyzed: gsal ba las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni sems kyi gyu med pa'o //
translated: It is the absence of mental activity of great compassion because it arises from clarity.

original: sems can thams cad la 'dud pa las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni nga rgyal med pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la 'dud pa las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni nga rgyal med pa'o //
translated: It is the absence of pride of great compassion because it arises from bowing to all sentient beings.

original: sems can tshad med pa'i phyir snying rje chen po ni tshang med pa 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sems can tshad med pa'i phyir snying rje chen po ni tshang med pa 'byung ba'o //
translated: It is the arising of the boundless of great compassion because of the boundlessness of sentient beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku 'thob pa las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni bdag gi lus la mi lta ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku 'thob pa las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni bdag gi lus la mi lta ba'o //
translated: It is the disregard for one’s own body of great compassion because it arises from obtaining the body of the Tathāgata.

original: sdig pa thams cad mi bya ba las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni srog la yid mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa thams cad mi bya ba las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni srog la yid mi rtog pa'o //
translated: It is the disregard for life of great compassion because it arises from the avoidance of all evil.

original: byang chub kyi sems las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni pha rol srung ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni pha rol srung ba'o //
translated: It is the protection of others of great compassion because it arises from the mind of awakening.

original: rang gi sems yongs su dag pa las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni sems can srung ba'o //🔽sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal sel ba las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni dbul po dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mgon med @205a *//
analyzed: rang gi sems yongs su dag pa las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni sems can srung ba'o // sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal sel ba las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni dbul po dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mgon med @205a *//
translated: Great compassion is the protection of sentient beings, because it arises from the complete purification of one's own mind.

original: pa la lta ba'o //🔽blo mi 'gyur ba las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni dam bcas pa /
analyzed: pa la lta ba'o // blo mi 'gyur ba las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni dam bcas pa /
translated: Great compassion is the vision of the poor, the suffering, and the unprotected, because it arises from the removal of the suffering of all sentient beings.

original: brten pa'o // bdag dang / sangs rgyas dang / lha rnams mi slu ba las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni bden pa la lta ba'o //
analyzed: brten pa'o // bdag dang / sangs rgyas dang / lha rnams mi slu ba las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni bden pa la lta ba'o //
translated: Great compassion is the vision of the truth, because it arises from the nondeception of oneself, the Buddhas, and the gods.

original: legs par byas pa'i las las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni spyod pa dag pa'o //🔽pha rol la bde ba rab tu sbyin pa las byung pas na snying rje chen po ni bdag gi bde ba gtong ba'o //
analyzed: legs par byas pa'i las las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni spyod pa dag pa'o // pha rol la bde ba rab tu sbyin pa las byung pas na snying rje chen po ni bdag gi bde ba gtong ba'o //
translated: Great compassion is the purity of conduct, because it arises from good karma.🔽Great compassion is the relinquishment of one's own happiness, because it arises from the bestowal of happiness upon others.

original: sred pa med pa las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni gzhan gyi bde ba bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa med pa las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni gzhan gyi bde ba bskyed pa'o //
translated: Great compassion is the generation of the happiness of others, because it arises from the absence of craving.

original: brtson 'grus brtan pa rtsom pa las byung ba na snying rje chen po ni sems can thams cad kyi khur khyer ba'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtan pa rtsom pa las byung ba na snying rje chen po ni sems can thams cad kyi khur khyer ba'o //
translated: Great compassion is the carrying of the burden of all sentient beings, arising from the undertaking of firm effort.

original: sems can gyi mthu chung ba'o nyes pa dang du len pa las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni bla ma'i bzod pa yang dag par blangs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi mthu chung ba'o nyes pa dang du len pa las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni bla ma'i bzod pa yang dag par blangs pa'o //
translated: Great compassion is the acceptance of the patience of the guru, arising from the acceptance of the faults of weak sentient beings.

original: sems can na ba rnams la rim gro byed pa las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni chags pa dang / smad pa sel ba'o //
analyzed: sems can na ba rnams la rim gro byed pa las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni chags pa dang / smad pa sel ba'o //
translated: Great compassion is the removal of attachment and contempt, arising from the service of sick sentient beings.

original: dman pa la mos pa'i sems can yongs su smin par bya ba las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni chos kyi dbang phyug thob pa'o //
analyzed: dman pa la mos pa'i sems can yongs su smin par bya ba las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni chos kyi dbang phyug thob pa'o //
translated: Great compassion is the attainment of the sovereignty of the Dharma, arising from the maturation of sentient beings who aspire to the inferior.

original: pha rol gyi yon tan brjod pa las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni rang gi yon tan mi sbyoms pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol gyi yon tan brjod pa las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni rang gi yon tan mi sbyoms pa'o //
translated: Great compassion is the non-concealment of one's own qualities, arising from the proclamation of the qualities of others.

original: zag pa med pa'i bde ba 'dod pa las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni sdug bsngal thams cad la ji mi snyam pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i bde ba 'dod pa las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni sdug bsngal thams cad la ji mi snyam pa'o //
translated: Great compassion is the indifference to all suffering, because it arises from the desire for the happiness of those who are suffering.

original: las legs par byas te mi 'gyod pa las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni sdug cing phongs pa'i dngos po @205b yongs su gtong ba'o //
analyzed: las legs par byas te mi 'gyod pa las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni sdug cing phongs pa'i dngos po @205b yongs su gtong ba'o //
translated: Great compassion is the giving up of dear and cherished things, because it arises from the absence of regret over good actions well done.

original: tshul khrims 'chal ba'i sems can rnams srung ba las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni tshul khrims legs par bsrungs pas byung ba'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal ba'i sems can rnams srung ba las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni tshul khrims legs par bsrungs pas byung ba'o //
translated: Great compassion is the protection of beings with faulty morality, because it arises from the observance of morality.

original: rdo rje'i lus 'thob pa las byung ba na snying rje chen po ni lus la gnod par byas pa dang du len pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i lus 'thob pa las byung ba na snying rje chen po ni lus la gnod par byas pa dang du len pa'o //
translated: Great compassion is the acceptance of injury to the body, because it arises from the acquisition of a vajra-body.

original: lus dang / srog la mi lta ba las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'o; ;yan lag dang / snying lag yongs su gtong ba las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni mi lta ba'o //
analyzed: lus dang / srog la mi lta ba las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'o; ;yan lag dang / snying lag yongs su gtong ba las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni mi lta ba'o //
translated: Great compassion is the maturation of beings, because it arises from disregard for body and life. Great compassion is non-apprehending, because it arises from the giving up of limbs and major parts of the body.

original: rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba mi 'dod pa las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni sems can pha rol po'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba mi 'dod pa las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni sems can pha rol po'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'o //
translated: Great compassion is the production of the roots of virtue in other sentient beings, because it arises from the desire for one's own roots of virtue.

original: phyir yang 'dod pa'i khams su dmigs pa las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni bsam gtan gyi ro mi myang ba'o //
analyzed: phyir yang 'dod pa'i khams su dmigs pa las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni bsam gtan gyi ro mi myang ba'o //
translated: Great compassion is not savoring the taste of the meditative absorptions, because it arises from the desire realm.

original: chags pa med pa'i ye shes snang ba las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni kun nas snang ba'o //
analyzed: chags pa med pa'i ye shes snang ba las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni kun nas snang ba'o //
translated: Great compassion is the universal illumination, because it arises from the illumination of non-attached wisdom.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / tshogs kun la mi smod pa las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni shes rab la mi ltos pa'o //🔽sems can thams cad kyi bsam ba rdzogs par bya ba las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni kun tu bkye ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / tshogs kun la mi smod pa las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni shes rab la mi ltos pa'o // sems can thams cad kyi bsam ba rdzogs par bya ba las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni kun tu bkye ba'o //
translated: Great compassion is not dependent on wisdom, because it arises from not disparaging any roots of virtue or accumulations.🔽Great compassion is the universal exertion, because it arises from the fulfillment of the aspirations of all sentient beings.

original: sngon gyi smon lam mi gtong ba las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni sems can thams cad rab tu thar bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam mi gtong ba las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni sems can thams cad rab tu thar bar byed pa'o //
translated: Great compassion is the complete liberation of all sentient beings, because it arises from not abandoning one's previous aspirations.

original: 'dus byas la sems can yongs su smin par bya ba las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni 'dus ma byas pa la mi reg pa'o //🔽sangs rgyas kyi tshul khrims la @206a *//
analyzed: 'dus byas la sems can yongs su smin par bya ba las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni 'dus ma byas pa la mi reg pa'o // sangs rgyas kyi tshul khrims la @206a *//
translated: Since it arises from the maturation of sentient beings in the conditioned, great compassion does not touch the unconditioned.

original: sems can rnams rab tu 'gog pa las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni tshul khrims 'chal ba'i sems can rnams la lta ba'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams rab tu 'gog pa las byung bas na snying rje chen po ni tshul khrims 'chal ba'i sems can rnams la lta ba'o //
translated: Since it arises from the cessation of sentient beings in the morality of the Buddhas, great compassion sees sentient beings with faulty morality.

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i nges par 'byung ba gang ci'ang rung ste de dag thams cad snying rje chen po las skyes pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i nges par 'byung ba gang ci'ang rung ste de dag thams cad snying rje chen po las skyes pa ste /
translated: in this way, whatever is the bodhisattva’s going forth, all of it arises from great compassion.

original: de'i phyir snying rje chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir snying rje chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‘great compassion.’

original: 'di ltar sbyin par byed pa dang / tshul khrims su byed pa dang / bzod par byed pa dang / brtson 'grus su byed pa dang / bsam gtan du byed pa dang / shes rab tu byed pa dang / thabs su byed pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad byed pa ni snying rje chen po'o //🔽bdag gi byed pa dang / rang 'byung gi ye shes sgrub par byed pa dang / legs par bya ba byed pa dang / 'gyod pa med par byed pa dang / gdon mi za bar byed pa ni snying rje chen po'o //🔽sems can thams cad kyi bya ba ci yod ces so sor nye bar gnas pa las byung bas na de'i phyir snying rje chen po zhes bya'o; ;btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyin par byed pa dang / tshul khrims su byed pa dang / bzod par byed pa dang / brtson 'grus su byed pa dang / bsam gtan du byed pa dang / shes rab tu byed pa dang / thabs su byed pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad byed pa ni snying rje chen po'o // bdag gi byed pa dang / rang 'byung gi ye shes sgrub par byed pa dang / legs par bya ba byed pa dang / 'gyod pa med par byed pa dang / gdon mi za bar byed pa ni snying rje chen po'o // sems can thams cad kyi bya ba ci yod ces so sor nye bar gnas pa las byung bas na de'i phyir snying rje chen po zhes bya'o; ;btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: It is the practice of generosity, the practice of morality, the practice of patience, the practice of perseverance, the practice of concentration, the practice of wisdom, the practice of skillful means, and the practice of all the factors of awakening.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying rje chen po mi bzad pa zhes bya'o ////
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying rje chen po mi bzad pa zhes bya'o ////
translated: It is the practice of self-mastery, the practice of the knowledge of the way things are, the practice of the knowledge of all things, the practice of the knowledge of the path, the practice of the knowledge of the absence of defilements, the practice of the knowledge of the absence of the defilements of the three times, the practice of the knowledge of the absence of the the practice of the knowledge of the absence of the defilements of the three times, the practice of the

original: ba ma po lnga pa /
analyzed: ba ma po lnga pa /
translated: the five superknowledges,

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: and the venerable Śāradvatīputra.

original: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dga' ba chen po'ang mi zad pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dga' ba chen po'ang mi zad pa ste /
translated: “Moreover, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the bodhisattvas’ great joy is also inexhaustible.

original: de la dga' ba chen po'ang gang zhe na /🔽gang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dran pa dang / rjes su dran pa @206b dang; dga' ba dang / mos pa dang / mchog tu dga' ba dang / sems ma gong zhing mi rdzi ba dang / sred pa med pa dang / 'dod pa'i dga' ba thams cad gton ba dang /
analyzed: de la dga' ba chen po'ang gang zhe na / gang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dran pa dang / rjes su dran pa @206b dang; dga' ba dang / mos pa dang / mchog tu dga' ba dang / sems ma gong zhing mi rdzi ba dang / sred pa med pa dang / 'dod pa'i dga' ba thams cad gton ba dang /
translated: What is great joy?🔽It is the recollection, remembrance, joy, interest, and delight in the qualities of the Buddha; it is the undaunted and unbowed mind, the absence of craving, and the rejection of all worldly pleasures.

original: chos kyi dga' ba thams cad kyi rten dang / sems mchog tu dga' ba dang / lus rab tu sim pa dang / sangs rgyas la dga' zhing yi rang ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la dga' zhing mos pas mtshan dang / dpe byad bzang po'i rgyan tshol ba la mkhas pa dang /
analyzed: chos kyi dga' ba thams cad kyi rten dang / sems mchog tu dga' ba dang / lus rab tu sim pa dang / sangs rgyas la dga' zhing yi rang ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la dga' zhing mos pas mtshan dang / dpe byad bzang po'i rgyan tshol ba la mkhas pa dang /
translated: It is the basis of all the joy of the Dharma, the supreme joy of the mind, the satisfaction of the body, the delight and joy in the Buddha, and the interest in the body of the Tathāgata, which leads to the skill in seeking the adornments of the major and minor marks.

original: dge ba'i chos mnyan pas mi skyo ba dang / de kho na'i chos la rton pa'i nan tan dang / dga' ba dang / dad pa dang / mchog tu dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' bas chos la mos pa dang / rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par sems can rnams la 'khong khro ba med pa'i blo dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos mnyan pas mi skyo ba dang / de kho na'i chos la rton pa'i nan tan dang / dga' ba dang / dad pa dang / mchog tu dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' bas chos la mos pa dang / rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par sems can rnams la 'khong khro ba med pa'i blo dang /
translated: It is to never tire of listening to the Dharma. It is to be diligent in relying on the Dharma of suchness. It is to have devotion to the Dharma with joy, faith, supreme joy, and great joy. It is to have a mind that is never angry with sentient beings.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos tshol ba la shin tu 'dun pa dang / chos 'dun pa de'ang mi 'dor ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rgya chen po dag la mos shing rnam par grol ba dang / nyi tshe ba'i theg pa bsal te sems bskyed pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos tshol ba la shin tu 'dun pa dang / chos 'dun pa de'ang mi 'dor ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rgya chen po dag la mos shing rnam par grol ba dang / nyi tshe ba'i theg pa bsal te sems bskyed pa dang /
translated: It is to have a strong aspiration to seek the Buddha’s Dharma. It is to never abandon that aspiration for the Dharma. It is to have devotion to the vast Dharma of the Buddha and to be liberated. It is to give rise to the mind of awakening by dispelling the limited vehicles.

original: ser sna med pas ma zhum par sems bskyed pa dang / slong ba la sbyin pa byin nas 'khor gsum yongs su dag par sbyangs pa dang / sbyin pa la mchog tu dga' ba dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnams la dad pa dang /
analyzed: ser sna med pas ma zhum par sems bskyed pa dang / slong ba la sbyin pa byin nas 'khor gsum yongs su dag par sbyangs pa dang / sbyin pa la mchog tu dga' ba dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnams la dad pa dang /
translated: It is to give rise to the mind of awakening without being discouraged by generosity. It is to give to beggars and to train in the complete purity of the three spheres. It is to take delight in generosity. It is to have faith in those who are disciplined.

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams la rjes su 'dzin cing byams pa dang / rang gi tshul khrims yongs su dag pas ngan 'gro'i 'jigs pa thams cad @207a *//
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams la rjes su 'dzin cing byams pa dang / rang gi tshul khrims yongs su dag pas ngan 'gro'i 'jigs pa thams cad @207a *//
translated: They are loving and caring toward those with corrupt discipline, and they reassure them, saying, ‘Through the purity of my discipline, I have transcended all the fears of the lower realms.

original: las shin tu 'da' bar dbugs 'byin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims la yongs su bsngo ba dang / brtan zhing mi phyed pa dang / pha rol ngan du brjod pa dang / ngan du smra ba'i tshig gi lam la khong khro ba med pa'i sems kyis bzod cing nges pa dang /
analyzed: las shin tu 'da' bar dbugs 'byin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims la yongs su bsngo ba dang / brtan zhing mi phyed pa dang / pha rol ngan du brjod pa dang / ngan du smra ba'i tshig gi lam la khong khro ba med pa'i sems kyis bzod cing nges pa dang /
translated: I have dedicated it to the discipline of the Thus-Gone One, and it is firm and indivisible.’ They are patient and certain, with a mind that is not angered by the offensive words and verbal abuse of others.

original: nga rgyal med pa dang / bla ma la 'dud cing ri mor byed pa dang / rtag tu 'dzum pa'i bzhin dang / khro gnyer med pa dang / gsong por smra ba dang / tshul 'chos pa med pa dang / kha gsag med pa dang /
analyzed: nga rgyal med pa dang / bla ma la 'dud cing ri mor byed pa dang / rtag tu 'dzum pa'i bzhin dang / khro gnyer med pa dang / gsong por smra ba dang / tshul 'chos pa med pa dang / kha gsag med pa dang /
translated: They are free of pride, deferential and respectful toward their teachers, always smiling, free of frowns, and pleasant in speech. They are without pretense or flattery,

original: thob kyis 'jal ba med pa dang / bsam bdag pa dang; brlang pa med pa dang / gya gyu med pa dang / thams cad la phan yon du lta ba dang / skyon med par lta ba dang / ltung ba mi gleng ba dang / yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ba'i chos kyi rjes su 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: thob kyis 'jal ba med pa dang / bsam bdag pa dang; brlang pa med pa dang / gya gyu med pa dang / thams cad la phan yon du lta ba dang / skyon med par lta ba dang / ltung ba mi gleng ba dang / yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ba'i chos kyi rjes su 'jug pa dang /
translated: It is to be without greed, to be without conceit, to be without harshness, to be without deceit, to see the benefits of everything, to see the absence of faults, to not speak of downfalls, and to follow the Dharma that brings joy.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ston pa ltar phangs su 'dzin pa dang / chos rnams la bdag bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la srog bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa dang / bla ma rnams la pham bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ston pa ltar phangs su 'dzin pa dang / chos rnams la bdag bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la srog bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa dang / bla ma rnams la pham bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa dang /
translated: It is to hold the bodhisattvas dear as much as a teacher, to hold the Dharma dear as much as oneself, to hold the thus-gone ones dear as much as one’s life, and to hold the gurus dear as much as one’s eyes.

original: sems can rnams la bu bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa dang; mkhan po dang / slob dpon rnams la sangs rgyas bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa dang / nan tan rnams la yan lag gi dam pa mgo bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa dang / pha @207b rol tu phyin pa rnams la rkang lag bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: sems can rnams la bu bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa dang; mkhan po dang / slob dpon rnams la sangs rgyas bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa dang / nan tan rnams la yan lag gi dam pa mgo bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa dang / pha @207b rol tu phyin pa rnams la rkang lag bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa dang /
translated: They cherish sentient beings as if they were their own children. They cherish spiritual teachers and masters as if they were buddhas. They cherish their spiritual practice as if it were their own head, the most precious part of their body. They cherish the perfections as if they were their own hands and feet.

original: chos smra ba rnams la rin po che thams cad bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la yid bzhin gyi nor bu bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa dang / rjes su bstan pa rnams la dga' ba'i rtsed mo bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: chos smra ba rnams la rin po che thams cad bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la yid bzhin gyi nor bu bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa dang / rjes su bstan pa rnams la dga' ba'i rtsed mo bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa dang /
translated: They cherish the Dharma teachers as if they were all the precious jewels. They cherish all the qualities of the buddhas as if they were wish-fulfilling gems. They cherish the instructions as if they were delightful games.

original: chog shes pa rnams la nad med pa bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa dang / chos btsal ba rnams la sman bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa dang / skul zhing dran par byed pa rnams la sman pa bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: chog shes pa rnams la nad med pa bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa dang / chos btsal ba rnams la sman bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa dang / skul zhing dran par byed pa rnams la sman pa bzhin du phangs su 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Those who are content are as dear to them as health. Those who seek the Dharma are as dear to them as medicine. Those who exhort and remind are as dear to them as doctors.

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: de ltar gang dbang po thams cad la dbang po ma gong ba 'di ni dga' ba chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gang dbang po thams cad la dbang po ma gong ba 'di ni dga' ba chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: in this way, those who are not heedless with regard to any of the faculties are said to have great delight.

original: dga' ba chen po zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa'i ye shes kyi phyir zhi ba'i rnam pa'o; ;mi rgod pa'i phyir rab tu zhi ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba chen po zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa'i ye shes kyi phyir zhi ba'i rnam pa'o; ;mi rgod pa'i phyir rab tu zhi ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: Great delight is a peaceful state because it is the wisdom of realization. It is a state of complete peace because it is not agitated.

original: khengs pa ma yin pa'i phyir shin tu sbyangs pa'i rnam pa'o //🔽rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i phyir dbang po dga' ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: khengs pa ma yin pa'i phyir shin tu sbyangs pa'i rnam pa'o // rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i phyir dbang po dga' ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: It is a state of pliancy because it is not arrogant.🔽It is a state of delight in the faculties because it is not distracted.

original: mi nyams pa'i phyir brtsul zhugs kyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: mi nyams pa'i phyir brtsul zhugs kyi rnam pa'o //
translated: It is a state of engagement because it is not degenerating.

original: 'dod pa'i phyir des pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i phyir des pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: It is a state of satisfaction because it is desirous.

original: bka' blo bde ba'i phyir thos pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: bka' blo bde ba'i phyir thos pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The form of hearing is for the sake of a happy mind.

original: sems las su rung ba'i phyir nye bar zhi ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: sems las su rung ba'i phyir nye bar zhi ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The form of tranquility is for the sake of a serviceable mind.

original: las legs par bya ba'i phyir dga' ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: las legs par bya ba'i phyir dga' ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The form of joy is for the sake of good karma.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i phyir mi 'gyod pa'i rnam pa'o //🔽ma g-yos pa'i phyir shin tu gnas pa'i rnam pa'o //🔽mi gnas pa'i phyir ma g-yos @208a *//
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i phyir mi 'gyod pa'i rnam pa'o // ma g-yos pa'i phyir shin tu gnas pa'i rnam pa'o // mi gnas pa'i phyir ma g-yos @208a *//
translated: The form of non-regret is for the sake of being without fault.🔽The form of stability is for the sake of not wavering.

original: pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The form of non-wavering is for the sake of not being unstable.

original: thul bar dka' ba'i phyir bsnyen dka' ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: thul bar dka' ba'i phyir bsnyen dka' ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The form of being difficult to approach is for the sake of being difficult to tame.

original: chud mi za ba'i phyir don gyi rnam pa'o //🔽ma nor ba de bzhin nyid kyi phyir bden pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: chud mi za ba'i phyir don gyi rnam pa'o // ma nor ba de bzhin nyid kyi phyir bden pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The form of meaning is for the sake of not being wasted.🔽The form of truth is for the sake of non-erroneous suchness.

original: de byed pa'i phyir kho na'i rnam pa'o //🔽stobs kyi phyir spro ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de byed pa'i phyir kho na'i rnam pa'o // stobs kyi phyir spro ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The form of just that is for the sake of just that.🔽The form of enthusiasm is for the sake of strength.

original: mi rdzi ba'i phyir stobs kyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: mi rdzi ba'i phyir stobs kyi rnam pa'o //
translated: The form of strength is for the sake of being invincible.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du tshol bas mi skyo ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du tshol bas mi skyo ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: The aspect of perfecting the qualities of buddhahood is the aspect of not being discouraged by seeking all the qualities of buddhahood in accordance with reality.

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dga' ba chen po mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dga' ba chen po mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: this is called the bodhisattvas’ imperishable great joy.

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi btang snyoms kyang mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi btang snyoms kyang mi zad pa'o //
translated: furthermore, the equanimity of the bodhisattvas is also imperishable.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi btang snyoms rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi btang snyoms rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of equanimity of the bodhisattvas.

original: rnam pa gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: nyon mongs pa la btang snyoms pa dang / bdag dang / gzhan bsrung ba'i phyir btang snyoms pa dang / dus dang / dus ma yin pa la btang snyoms pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la btang snyoms pa dang / bdag dang / gzhan bsrung ba'i phyir btang snyoms pa dang / dus dang / dus ma yin pa la btang snyoms pa'o //
translated: equanimity toward the afflictions, equanimity in order to protect oneself and others, and equanimity toward the timely and the untimely.

original: de la nyon mongs pa la btang snyoms pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa la btang snyoms pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is equanimity toward the afflictions?

original: bsti stang du byas pas mtho bar mi sems pa dang / bsti stang du ma byas pas dma' bar mi sems pa dang / rnyed pa dag la rlom sems med pa dang / ma rnyed pa dag la yi chad pa med pa dang / snyan pa dag la mngon par dga' ba med pa dang /
analyzed: bsti stang du byas pas mtho bar mi sems pa dang / bsti stang du ma byas pas dma' bar mi sems pa dang / rnyed pa dag la rlom sems med pa dang / ma rnyed pa dag la yi chad pa med pa dang / snyan pa dag la mngon par dga' ba med pa dang /
translated: It is to not think highly of oneself when one is honored and not to think lowly of oneself when one is not honored. It is to not be proud when one obtains something and not to be discouraged when one does not obtain something. It is to not be attached to what is pleasant and not to be discouraged by what is unpleasant.

original: mi @208b snyan pa dag la zhum pa med pa dang / smad pas sro shi bar mi 'gyur ba dang / bsngags pa la chos nyid rab tu gnas pa dang / sdug bsngal dag la so sor rtog pa'i stobs dang / bde ba dag la mi rtag pa dang /
analyzed: mi @208b snyan pa dag la zhum pa med pa dang / smad pas sro shi bar mi 'gyur ba dang / bsngags pa la chos nyid rab tu gnas pa dang / sdug bsngal dag la so sor rtog pa'i stobs dang / bde ba dag la mi rtag pa dang /
translated: It is to not be disheartened by criticism and to be established in the nature of phenomena when praised. It is to have the power of discernment with regard to suffering and the power of discernment with regard to impermanence and suffering with regard to happiness.

original: sdug bsngal bar rtog pa'i stobs dang / rjes su chags pa 'dor ba dang / khong khro ba spong bas mdza' ba dang / mi mdza' ba dag la sems mnyam pa dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams la blo mnyam pa dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal bar rtog pa'i stobs dang / rjes su chags pa 'dor ba dang / khong khro ba spong bas mdza' ba dang / mi mdza' ba dag la sems mnyam pa dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams la blo mnyam pa dang /
translated: It is to abandon attachment and to eliminate anger, and thus to have an attitude of equality toward friends and enemies. It is to have an attitude of equality toward those who have discipline and those who have no discipline.

original: legs par byas pa dang / nyes par byas pa rnams la'ang gnyis su mi byed pa dang / sdug pa dang / mi sdug par mi lta ba dang / legs par thos pa dang / nyes par thos pa la mi mjed pa dang / legs par smras pa dang /
analyzed: legs par byas pa dang / nyes par byas pa rnams la'ang gnyis su mi byed pa dang / sdug pa dang / mi sdug par mi lta ba dang / legs par thos pa dang / nyes par thos pa la mi mjed pa dang / legs par smras pa dang /
translated: They do not harbor resentment toward good or bad speech.

original: nyes par smras pa la bag la nyal ba med pa dang / ro myang ba'i nyes dmigs rnams la mtshungs par yongs su 'jal ba dang / sems can thams cad la bsam pa mnyam pa dang / lus dang / srog la mi lta ba dang /
analyzed: nyes par smras pa la bag la nyal ba med pa dang / ro myang ba'i nyes dmigs rnams la mtshungs par yongs su 'jal ba dang / sems can thams cad la bsam pa mnyam pa dang / lus dang / srog la mi lta ba dang /
translated: They are impartial toward the faults of indulging in tastes. They have the same attitude toward all sentient beings. They do not care about their bodies or lives.

original: rab dang / 'bring dang / tha ma rnams la 'od zer mnyam pa dang / bsngags pa dang / bsngags pa ma yin pa rnams la sems mnyam pa dang / bden pa dang / mi bden pa rnams la rang gi sems yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: rab dang / 'bring dang / tha ma rnams la 'od zer mnyam pa dang / bsngags pa dang / bsngags pa ma yin pa rnams la sems mnyam pa dang / bden pa dang / mi bden pa rnams la rang gi sems yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: They have the same radiance toward the best, the middling, and the worst. They have the same attitude toward praise and blame. They have a pure mind toward the true and the untrue.

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: de ltar gang ba sti stang du byed pa dang / gnod par byed pa la mtho dman du mi sems shing /
analyzed: de ltar gang ba sti stang du byed pa dang / gnod par byed pa la mtho dman du mi sems shing /
translated: Thus, he does not think of those who honor him as better, or of those who harm him as worse.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' btang snyoms pa @209a *//
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' btang snyoms pa @209a *//
translated: The bodhisattva is impartial toward them.

original: yin te / btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: yin te / btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa la btang snyoms pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa la btang snyoms pa zhes bya'o //
translated: this is called the bodhisattvas’ impartiality toward the afflictions.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdag dang / gzhan srung ba'i btang snyoms pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdag dang / gzhan srung ba'i btang snyoms pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattvas’ impartiality that protects both oneself and others?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i lus dang / yan lag dang / nying lag rnams bcad kyang khong khro bar mi byed cing mi tshol te btang snyoms pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i lus dang / yan lag dang / nying lag rnams bcad kyang khong khro bar mi byed cing mi tshol te btang snyoms pa yin no //
translated: Here, even if the bodhisattva’s body, limbs, and appendages are cut off, he does not become angry or seek revenge, but is impartial.

original: lus kyi rnam par 'gyur ba dang / ngag gi rnam par 'gyur ba las kyang rung ste gnyis ka la bzod pas na de'i phyir btang snyoms zhes bya'o; ;mig gi rnam pas kyang rma mi phyin /
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par 'gyur ba dang / ngag gi rnam par 'gyur ba las kyang rung ste gnyis ka la bzod pas na de'i phyir btang snyoms zhes bya'o; ;mig gi rnam pas kyang rma mi phyin /
translated: Since he is patient with both the physical and verbal actions of others, this is called impartiality. He is not wounded by the eyes,

original: gzugs kyi rnam pas kyang rma mi phyin te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rnam pas kyang rma mi phyin te /
translated: It is not wounded by the form aspect.

original: gnyis kas kyang rma mi phyin to //🔽de bzhin du rna bas ma yin /
analyzed: gnyis kas kyang rma mi phyin to // de bzhin du rna bas ma yin /
translated: It is not wounded by either.🔽It is not wounded by the ear aspect.

original: sgras ma yin /🔽snas ma yin /🔽dris ma yin /🔽lces ma yin /
analyzed: sgras ma yin / snas ma yin / dris ma yin / lces ma yin /
translated: It is not wounded by the sound aspect.🔽It is not wounded by the nose aspect.

original: ros ma yin /
analyzed: ros ma yin /
translated: It is not wounded by the smell aspect.🔽It is not wounded by the tongue aspect.🔽It is not wounded by the taste aspect.

original: lus kyis ma yin /
analyzed: lus kyis ma yin /
translated: It is not wounded by the body aspect.

original: reg byas ma yin /
analyzed: reg byas ma yin /
translated: It is not wounded by the touch aspect.

original: yid kyi rnam pas kyang rma mi phyin /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam pas kyang rma mi phyin /
translated: It is not wounded by the mind aspect.

original: chos kyi rnam pas kyang rma mi phyin te /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam pas kyang rma mi phyin te /
translated: It is not wounded by the dharma aspect.

original: de'i phyir btang snyoms zhes bya'o //🔽rma mi phyin cing nyams pa med pas de'i phyir btang snyoms zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir btang snyoms zhes bya'o // rma mi phyin cing nyams pa med pas de'i phyir btang snyoms zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called equanimity.🔽It is not wounded and does not fail, therefore it is called equanimity.

original: rma byung ba la rma ma phyin pas de'i phyir btang snyoms zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rma byung ba la rma ma phyin pas de'i phyir btang snyoms zhes bya'o //
translated: It is not wounded by the wound that has arisen, therefore it is called equanimity.

original: bdag dang / gzhan dang / gnyis ka srung bas de'i phyir btang snyoms zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag dang / gzhan dang / gnyis ka srung bas de'i phyir btang snyoms zhes bya'o //
translated: It protects self, other, and both, therefore it is called equanimity.

original: phan par byed pa dang / gnod par byed pa la mnyam par sbyor bas de'i phyir btang snyoms zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phan par byed pa dang / gnod par byed pa la mnyam par sbyor bas de'i phyir btang snyoms zhes bya'o //
translated: It is applied equally to the beneficial and the harmful, therefore it is called equanimity.

original: btang snyoms ni @209b mchog tu rtsod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms ni @209b mchog tu rtsod pa med pa'o //
translated: Equanimity is the supreme absence of conflict.

original: btang snyoms ni rang gi sems la nges par sems pa'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms ni rang gi sems la nges par sems pa'o //
translated: Equanimity is the mind that is certain about itself.

original: btang snyoms ni gzhan kyi sems srung ba'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms ni gzhan kyi sems srung ba'o //
translated: Equanimity is the protection of the minds of others.

original: btang snyoms ni bdag la rtog pa'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms ni bdag la rtog pa'o //
translated: Equanimity is the investigation of the self.

original: btang snyoms ni sems can gzhan dag la gnod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms ni sems can gzhan dag la gnod pa med pa'o //
translated: Equanimity is the non-harming of other sentient beings.

original: btang snyoms ni byang chub sems dpa'i mnyam par bzhag pa'i gnas skabs yin te /
analyzed: btang snyoms ni byang chub sems dpa'i mnyam par bzhag pa'i gnas skabs yin te /
translated: Equanimity is the state of concentration of the bodhisattva.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i bdag dang / gzhan srung ba'i btang snyoms zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i bdag dang / gzhan srung ba'i btang snyoms zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattva’s equanimity that protects both self and other.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i dus dang / dus ma yin pa la btang snyoms pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i dus dang / dus ma yin pa la btang snyoms pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva’s equanimity with regard to time and non-time?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni byang chub sems dpas btang snyoms bya bar bka' mi stsol to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni byang chub sems dpas btang snyoms bya bar bka' mi stsol to //
translated: The Blessed Buddhas do not enjoin the bodhisattva to be equanimous.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: byang chub sems dpas rtag tu bdag dang / gzhan gyi dge ba'i chos btsal ba la brtson zhing 'bad par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas rtag tu bdag dang / gzhan gyi dge ba'i chos btsal ba la brtson zhing 'bad par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because the bodhisattva is always striving and making an effort to seek out the wholesome states of self and other.

original: des dus dang / dus ma yin par btang snyoms par bya'o //
analyzed: des dus dang / dus ma yin par btang snyoms par bya'o //
translated: He should be indifferent to the right and wrong times.

original: de la dus dang / dus ma yin pa'i btang snyoms gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dus dang / dus ma yin pa'i btang snyoms gang zhe na /
translated: What is indifference to the right and wrong times?

original: snod ma yin pa dang / nyan par mi 'dod pa'i sems can rnams la btang snyoms pa dang / ma rnyed pa dang / smad pa dang / mi snyan pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la btang snyoms pa dang / sems can nyan thos kyi theg pa can skyon med pa la zhugs pa rnams la btang snyoms pa dang /
analyzed: snod ma yin pa dang / nyan par mi 'dod pa'i sems can rnams la btang snyoms pa dang / ma rnyed pa dang / smad pa dang / mi snyan pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la btang snyoms pa dang / sems can nyan thos kyi theg pa can skyon med pa la zhugs pa rnams la btang snyoms pa dang /
translated: It is indifference to beings who are not fit vessels, who do not want to listen, who have not found, who are despised, who are not respected, who are suffering, and who are disciples who have entered the faultless.

original: sbyin pa'i dus na tshul khrims brtul ba'i btang snyoms dang / tshul khrims kyi dus na sbyin pa brtul ba'i btang snyoms @210a *//
analyzed: sbyin pa'i dus na tshul khrims brtul ba'i btang snyoms dang / tshul khrims kyi dus na sbyin pa brtul ba'i btang snyoms @210a *//
translated: It is indifference to generosity when the time is for morality, and indifference to morality when the time is for generosity.

original: dang; bzod pa'i dus na brtson 'grus brtul ba'i btang snyoms dang / brtson 'grus kyi dus na bsam gtan brtul ba'i btang snyoms dang / bsam gtan gyi dus na sbyin pa la chags pa brtul ba'i btang snyoms dang / shes rab kyi dus na pha rol tu phyin pa lnga la dmigs pa brtul ba'i btang snyoms te /
analyzed: dang; bzod pa'i dus na brtson 'grus brtul ba'i btang snyoms dang / brtson 'grus kyi dus na bsam gtan brtul ba'i btang snyoms dang / bsam gtan gyi dus na sbyin pa la chags pa brtul ba'i btang snyoms dang / shes rab kyi dus na pha rol tu phyin pa lnga la dmigs pa brtul ba'i btang snyoms te /
translated: “Equanimity in the face of the difficulties of patience” means to be patient with the difficulties of perseverance. “ Equanimity in the face of the difficulties of meditation” means to be patient with the difficulties of concentration. “ Equanimity in the face of the difficulties of generosity” means to be patient with the difficulties of generosity. “ Equanimity in the face of the difficulties of wisdom” means to be patient with the difficulties of the five perfections.

original: 'di ni dus dang / dus ma yin pa la btang snyoms pa zhes bya'o //🔽de ltar gang mi bya ba'i chos rnams mi byed pa 'di ni btang snyoms zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dus dang / dus ma yin pa la btang snyoms pa zhes bya'o // de ltar gang mi bya ba'i chos rnams mi byed pa 'di ni btang snyoms zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called “equanimity with regard to time and non-time.”🔽“ Equanimity with regard to what should not be done” means not to do what should not be done.

original: de dang / de la mi rtsol ba'o //
analyzed: de dang / de la mi rtsol ba'o //
translated: This is called “equanimity.”

original: gang gdon mi za ba'i chos rnams la mi 'jug pa med pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / stobs dang / mos pa dang / mthu dang / brtson pa mi 'dor ba ste /
