analyzed: gang gdon mi za ba'i chos rnams la mi 'jug pa med pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / stobs dang / mos pa dang / mthu dang / brtson pa mi 'dor ba ste /
translated: “ Equanimity with regard to what must be done” means not to be without perseverance, strength, aspiration, power, and effort with regard to what must be done.

original: dge ba'i chos de dang / de dag yongs su rdzogs par byed pa 'di ni /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos de dang / de dag yongs su rdzogs par byed pa 'di ni /
translated: This is called “equanimity with regard to what must be done.”

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi btang snyoms mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi btang snyoms mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: this is called the bodhisattvas’ imperishable equanimity.

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par shes pa lnga 'ang mi zad pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par shes pa lnga 'ang mi zad pa ste /
translated: “Moreover, the bodhisattvas’ five kinds of superknowledge are also imperishable.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: lha'i mig dang / lha'i rna ba dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / rdzu 'phrul bya ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i mig dang / lha'i rna ba dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / rdzu 'phrul bya ba shes pa'o //
translated: the divine eye, the divine ear, the knowledge of the minds of others, the recollection of past lives, and the knowledge of the performance of miracles.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lha'i mig gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lha'i mig gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattvas’ divine eye?

original: gang lha thams cad kyi lha'i mig dang / gang klu thams cad dang / gnod sbyin thams cad dang / dri @210b za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang /
analyzed: gang lha thams cad kyi lha'i mig dang / gang klu thams cad dang / gnod sbyin thams cad dang / dri @210b za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang /
translated: It is the divine eye of all gods, all nāgas, all yakṣas, all gandharvas, all asuras, all garuḍas, all kinnaras, all mahoragas, all humans, and all nonhumans.

original: mi ma yin pa thams cad kyi lha'i mig dang / gang slob pa dang / mi slob pa'i nyan thos thams cad kyi lha'i mig dang / gang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi lha'i mig de dag pas byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las nges par byung ba /
analyzed: mi ma yin pa thams cad kyi lha'i mig dang / gang slob pa dang / mi slob pa'i nyan thos thams cad kyi lha'i mig dang / gang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi lha'i mig de dag pas byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las nges par byung ba /
translated: compared to all of those, the divine eye of bodhisattvas who have set out for omniscience,🔽who have set out for the vast,🔽is supreme.

original: rgya chen po las nges par byung ba rnams kyi lha'i mig ni ches mchog go /🔽ches dam pa'o //🔽ches rab bo //
analyzed: rgya chen po las nges par byung ba rnams kyi lha'i mig ni ches mchog go / ches dam pa'o // ches rab bo //
translated: It is most excellent.🔽It is most refined.

original: ches phul lo //
analyzed: ches phul lo //
translated: It is most sublime.

original: ches gsal lo //
analyzed: ches gsal lo //
translated: It is most clear.

original: ches bzang ngo //
analyzed: ches bzang ngo //
translated: It is most good.

original: ches stobs dang ldan no //
analyzed: ches stobs dang ldan no //
translated: It is most powerful.

original: ches 'od gsal te /
analyzed: ches 'od gsal te /
translated: It is most radiant.

original: lha'i mig des phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa dag na gzugs su snang ba rags pa'am /🔽phra ba'am / bzang po'am /
analyzed: lha'i mig des phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa dag na gzugs su snang ba rags pa'am / phra ba'am / bzang po'am /
translated: With that divine eye, in the limitless and boundless world systems of the ten directions, they see the appearances of forms,🔽whether coarse or subtle,

original: ngan pa'am / rgyang ring po'am /
analyzed: ngan pa'am / rgyang ring po'am /
translated: good or bad, far or near,

original: thag nye ba gang ci'ang rung ste; de dag thams cad de dag gi lha'i mig des rig cing snang la shin tu rtogs /
analyzed: thag nye ba gang ci'ang rung ste; de dag thams cad de dag gi lha'i mig des rig cing snang la shin tu rtogs /
translated: Whatever is near, whatever is far, all that is known, seen, and fully realized by their divine eye.

original: shin tu rig /
analyzed: shin tu rig /
translated: It is fully known,

original: shin tu mthong ste /
analyzed: shin tu mthong ste /
translated: fully seen.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa dag na sems can gzugs med pa ma gtogs pa'i sems can gang dag 'gro ba thams cad du skyes pa de dag thams cad kyi 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes so //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa dag na sems can gzugs med pa ma gtogs pa'i sems can gang dag 'gro ba thams cad du skyes pa de dag thams cad kyi 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes so //
translated: They know exactly the deaths of all beings born in all the realms of the ten directions, in infinite world systems, except for those of the formless realm.

original: de dag gi las kyi rgyu'ang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes so //
analyzed: de dag gi las kyi rgyu'ang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes so //
translated: They know exactly the causes of their actions.

original: de dag gi las kyi 'bras bu dag /
analyzed: de dag gi las kyi 'bras bu dag /
translated: They know exactly the results of their actions.

original: zhes pa'i rim pa'ang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes so //
analyzed: zhes pa'i rim pa'ang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes so //
translated: They know exactly the order of their actions.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig @211a *//
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig @211a *//
translated: In the ten directions,

original: rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad mthong ste /
analyzed: rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad mthong ste /
translated: They see all the arrays of the qualities of the buddhafields of the lord buddhas in the infinite, limitless world systems.

original: mthong nas kyang rang gi tshul khrims yongs su dag pas rang gi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa rnams yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: mthong nas kyang rang gi tshul khrims yongs su dag pas rang gi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa rnams yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: Having seen them, they dedicate the accumulations of merit and wisdom that they have gathered toward the purification of the arrays of the qualities of their own buddhafields through the purity of their own morality.

original: tshul khrims kyi yon tan la gnas pa de dag gi yongs su bsngo ba 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi yon tan la gnas pa de dag gi yongs su bsngo ba 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The dedications of those who abide in the qualities of morality are fulfilled.

original: de dag gi lha'i mig des sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun gang yin pa de dag thams cad kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: de dag gi lha'i mig des sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun gang yin pa de dag thams cad kyang mthong ngo //
translated: With that divine eye, they see all the bodhisattva saṅghas of those lord buddhas.

original: mthong nas kyang skyes bu dam pa de dag gi cho ga dang / spyod pa dang / spyod yul dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / spyod lam dang / gnas dang / mthu dang / chos dang / rnam par thar pa dang /
analyzed: mthong nas kyang skyes bu dam pa de dag gi cho ga dang / spyod pa dang / spyod yul dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / spyod lam dang / gnas dang / mthu dang / chos dang / rnam par thar pa dang /
translated: Having seen them, they will perfect all the conduct, sphere of activity, mindfulness, alertness, deportment, abodes, powers, qualities, liberations,

original: ye shes dang / rten dang / gzungs dang / spobs pa la mkhas pa dang / shes rab dang / ye shes dang / thabs la mkhas pa la 'jug pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: ye shes dang / rten dang / gzungs dang / spobs pa la mkhas pa dang / shes rab dang / ye shes dang / thabs la mkhas pa la 'jug pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: knowledge, supports, dhāraṇīs, eloquence, wisdom, knowledge, and skillful means of those holy beings.

original: de dag gi mig de ni gzugs thams cad mthong bas na sgrib pa med do //
analyzed: de dag gi mig de ni gzugs thams cad mthong bas na sgrib pa med do //
translated: “Their eyes are unobstructed because they see all forms.

original: de dag gi mig de ni gzugs thams cad la mi chags pas na chags pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi mig de ni gzugs thams cad la mi chags pas na chags pa med pa'o //
translated: Their eyes are unattached because they are not attached to any form.

original: de dag gi mig de ni bag la nyal dang / lta ba dang / kun nas @211b ldang ba las rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gi mig de ni bag la nyal dang / lta ba dang / kun nas @211b ldang ba las rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: Their eyes are liberated from latent tendencies, views, and agitation.

original: de dag gi mig de ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bas na rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi mig de ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bas na rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Their eyes are pure because they are naturally radiant.

original: de dag gi mig de ni yul thams cad la mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi mig de ni yul thams cad la mi gnas pa'o //
translated: Their eyes do not dwell on any object.

original: de dag gi mig de ni nyon mongs pa dang / bag la nyal thams cad mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gi mig de ni nyon mongs pa dang / bag la nyal thams cad mi skye ba'o //
translated: Their eyes do not give rise to any afflictions or latent tendencies.

original: de dag gi mig de ni the tshom med pas na rab rib med pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi mig de ni the tshom med pas na rab rib med pa'o //
translated: Their eyes are free of cataracts, because they are free of doubt.

original: de dag gi mig de ni sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos thams cad la kun nas ma langs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi mig de ni sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos thams cad la kun nas ma langs pa'o //
translated: Their eyes are not agitated by any phenomena that obscure.

original: de dag gi mig de ni chos thams cad snang ba la gsal ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi mig de ni chos thams cad snang ba la gsal ba thob pa'o //
translated: Their eyes are the attainment of illumination with regard to all phenomena.

original: de dag gi mig de ni ye shes la rton pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi mig de ni ye shes la rton pa ste /
translated: Their eyes rely on wisdom.

original: rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul ma yin no //
translated: They are not the domain of consciousness.

original: de dag gi mig de ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis ma chags mi sdang ma rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi mig de ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis ma chags mi sdang ma rmongs pa'o //
translated: Their eyes are not attached, averse, or deluded with regard to any afflictions.

original: de dag gi mig de ni 'phags pa'i dbang po rnams la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi mig de ni 'phags pa'i dbang po rnams la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'o //
translated: Their eyes are the factors of discrimination with regard to the noble faculties.

original: de dag gi mig de ni sems can thams cad la 'od zer mnyam par gtong bas na thogs pa med pa'i ye shes nyid dang / de dag gi mig de ni sems kyi mi dge ba'i chos dang bral bas na rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi mig de ni sems can thams cad la 'od zer mnyam par gtong bas na thogs pa med pa'i ye shes nyid dang / de dag gi mig de ni sems kyi mi dge ba'i chos dang bral bas na rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: That eye of theirs is pure, since it is free from the unwholesome dharmas of mind.

original: de dag gi mig de ni rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pas dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi mig de ni rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pas dri ma med pa'o //
translated: That eye of theirs is immaculate, since it is not naturally defiled.

original: de dag gi mig de ni bsam pa ma btang bas na sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis mngon par bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi mig de ni bsam pa ma btang bas na sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis mngon par bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: That eye of theirs is accomplished by the Buddha-eye, since it does not give up its intention.

original: de dag gi mig de ni rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang bral ba'i phyir ma chags ma bcings pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi mig de ni rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang bral ba'i phyir ma chags ma bcings pa'o //
translated: That eye of theirs is unattached and unbound, since it is free from attachment and aversion.

original: de dag gi mig de ni don gyi spyod yul gyi bden pas nye bar @212a *//
analyzed: de dag gi mig de ni don gyi spyod yul gyi bden pas nye bar @212a *//
translated: That eye of theirs is accomplished by the truth of the domain of meaning,

original: bsgrubs shing chos rnam par dag pa shes pa'i lam la ma chags par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrubs shing chos rnam par dag pa shes pa'i lam la ma chags par spyod pa'o //
translated: and it is practiced without attachment to the path of knowledge of pure dharmas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar skyes bu dam pa de dag ni snying rje chen po la gnas pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bu dam pa de dag ni snying rje chen po la gnas pa /
translated: “These holy beings are established in great compassion,

original: chos rnams rig pa /
analyzed: chos rnams rig pa /
translated: they are aware of the Dharma,

original: don shin tu rtogs pa /
analyzed: don shin tu rtogs pa /
translated: they have realized the meaning,

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa /
translated: they are free from wrongdoing,

original: ji ltar mthong ba dang / thos pa bzhin du chos smra ba /
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba dang / thos pa bzhin du chos smra ba /
translated: they teach the Dharma as they have seen and heard it,

original: mi dge ba bsnyil ba /
analyzed: mi dge ba bsnyil ba /
translated: they have eliminated nonvirtue,

original: byang chub kyi snying po la mngon du phyogs pa /
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po la mngon du phyogs pa /
translated: they are directed toward the essence of awakening,

original: sems gang du'ang thogs pa med pa /🔽ser sna can rnams la gtong ba dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sems gang du'ang thogs pa med pa / ser sna can rnams la gtong ba dang ldan pa /
translated: their minds are unimpeded in any respect,🔽they are generous to the stingy,

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams la snying brtse ba can /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams la snying brtse ba can /
translated: they are compassionate to those with faulty discipline,

original: gnod sems kyi sems dang ldan pa rnams la gnod par sems pa'i sems med pa /
analyzed: gnod sems kyi sems dang ldan pa rnams la gnod par sems pa'i sems med pa /
translated: they are free from thoughts of malice toward those with malicious minds,

original: le lo can rnams la brtson 'grus sgrub par byed pa /
analyzed: le lo can rnams la brtson 'grus sgrub par byed pa /
translated: they encourage diligence in the lazy,

original: sems rnam par g-yeng ba rnams la bsam gtan gyi yan lag ston pa /
analyzed: sems rnam par g-yeng ba rnams la bsam gtan gyi yan lag ston pa /
translated: they teach the branches of concentration to those with distracted minds,

original: 'chal ba'i shes rab can rnams la shes rab kyi mig sbyin par byed pa /
analyzed: 'chal ba'i shes rab can rnams la shes rab kyi mig sbyin par byed pa /
translated: they give the eye of wisdom to those with faulty wisdom,

original: lam ngan pa zhugs pa rnams la lam ston pa /
analyzed: lam ngan pa zhugs pa rnams la lam ston pa /
translated: and they show the path to those who have entered a bad path.

original: dman pa la mos pa rnams la sangs rgyas kyi chos rgya chen po rtogs par byed pa /
analyzed: dman pa la mos pa rnams la sangs rgyas kyi chos rgya chen po rtogs par byed pa /
translated: They are unimpaired higher perceptions that cause those who are interested in the lesser vehicle to understand the vast Dharma of the Buddha,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la 'dzud pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la 'dzud pa /
translated: that introduce them to the wisdom of omniscience,

original: byang chub yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir mngon par shes pa ma nyams pa rnams te /
analyzed: byang chub yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir mngon par shes pa ma nyams pa rnams te /
translated: and that bring about the completion of enlightenment.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lha'i mig gi mngon par shes pa mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lha'i mig gi mngon par shes pa mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattvas’ imperishable higher knowledge of the divine eye.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lha'i rna ba'i @212b mngon par shes pa mi zad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lha'i rna ba'i @212b mngon par shes pa mi zad pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattvas’ imperishable higher knowledge of the divine ear?

original: gang lha thams cad kyi lha'i rna ba dang / gang klu thams cad dang / gnod sbyin thams cad dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang /
analyzed: gang lha thams cad kyi lha'i rna ba dang / gang klu thams cad dang / gnod sbyin thams cad dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang /
translated: It is the divine ear of all the gods, of all the nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and nonhumans.

original: mi ma yin pa thams cad kyi lha'i rna ba dang / gang slob pa dang / mi slob pa'i nyan thos thams cad kyi lha'i rna ba dang / gang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi lha'i rna ba de dag pas byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las nges pa byung ba /
analyzed: mi ma yin pa thams cad kyi lha'i rna ba dang / gang slob pa dang / mi slob pa'i nyan thos thams cad kyi lha'i rna ba dang / gang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi lha'i rna ba de dag pas byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las nges pa byung ba /
translated: compared to those, the divine ear of bodhisattvas who have emerged from omniscience,

original: rgya chen po las nges par byung ba rnams kyi lha'i rna ba ches mchog go /🔽ches dam pa'o //
analyzed: rgya chen po las nges par byung ba rnams kyi lha'i rna ba ches mchog go / ches dam pa'o //
translated: who have emerged from the vast [teachings], is supreme.🔽It is most excellent.

original: ches rab bo //
analyzed: ches rab bo //
translated: It is most excellent.

original: ches gsal lo //
analyzed: ches gsal lo //
translated: It is most clear.

original: ches bzang ngo //
analyzed: ches bzang ngo //
translated: It is most good.

original: ches stobs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ches stobs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is most powerful.

original: ches 'od gsal te /
analyzed: ches 'od gsal te /
translated: It is most radiant.

original: lha'i rna ba des phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa dag na sgrar grags pa lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang /
analyzed: lha'i rna ba des phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa dag na sgrar grags pa lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang /
translated: With that divine ear, in the limitless and boundless world systems of the ten directions, the sounds of gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kiṃnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans—

original: mi dang / mi ma yin pa'i sgra rnams dang / gang yang 'phags pa'i sgra nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sgra gang yin pa de dag thams cad de'i lha'i rna ba'i dbang po la grag par 'gyur te /🔽tha na sems can dmyal ba pa dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas pa dang / gshin @213a *//
analyzed: mi dang / mi ma yin pa'i sgra rnams dang / gang yang 'phags pa'i sgra nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sgra gang yin pa de dag thams cad de'i lha'i rna ba'i dbang po la grag par 'gyur te / tha na sems can dmyal ba pa dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas pa dang / gshin @213a *//
translated: He hears the sounds of humans and non-humans, and also the sounds of the noble ones, such as the sounds of śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas, and perfectly enlightened buddhas.🔽He hears all those sounds with his divine ear.

original: rje'i 'jig rten pa dang / sbrang bu dang / phye ma leb dang / sbur bu dang / bung ba dag gi sgra gang yin pa de dag thams cad kyang thos so //
analyzed: rje'i 'jig rten pa dang / sbrang bu dang / phye ma leb dang / sbur bu dang / bung ba dag gi sgra gang yin pa de dag thams cad kyang thos so //
translated: He hears the sounds of hell beings, animals, and those in the world of Yama, as well as the sounds of flies, moths, beetles, and bees.

original: sems kyi dmigs pa dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du mi ston pa gang dag gis sems can de dag gi ngag gi las 'byung ba de dag thams cad kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so; ;ngag gi las gang dge ba'i rgyu yongs su 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: sems kyi dmigs pa dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du mi ston pa gang dag gis sems can de dag gi ngag gi las 'byung ba de dag thams cad kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so; ;ngag gi las gang dge ba'i rgyu yongs su 'dzin pa dang /
translated: They know exactly what virtuous, unvirtuous, or neutral mental objects sentient beings have in mind, and how these mental objects give rise to their verbal actions.

original: ngag gi las gang mi dge ba'i rgyu yongs su 'dzin pa dang / ngag gi las gang lung du mi ston pa'i rgyu yongs su 'dzin pa de dag thams cad kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: ngag gi las gang mi dge ba'i rgyu yongs su 'dzin pa dang / ngag gi las gang lung du mi ston pa'i rgyu yongs su 'dzin pa de dag thams cad kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: They know exactly what causes of virtue, nonvirtue, or neutrality their verbal actions may have.

original: 'dod chags bag la nyal ba'i ngag gi las gang sdang bas 'byin pa dang / 'dod chags bag la nyal ba'i ngag gi las gang rmongs pas 'byin pa dang / zhe sdang bag la nyal ba'i ngag gi las gang chags pas 'byin pa dang / zhe sdang bag la nyal ba'i ngag gi las gang rmongs pas 'byin pa dang /🔽gti mug bag la nyal ba'i ngag gi las gang chags pas 'byin pa dang / gti mug bag la nyal ba'i ngag gi las gang sdang bas 'byin pa dang / 'dod chags bag la nyal ba'i ngag gi las gang chags pa'i 'byin pa dang / zhe sdang bag la nyal ba'i ngag gi las gang sdang bas 'byin pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod chags bag la nyal ba'i ngag gi las gang sdang bas 'byin pa dang / 'dod chags bag la nyal ba'i ngag gi las gang rmongs pas 'byin pa dang / zhe sdang bag la nyal ba'i ngag gi las gang chags pas 'byin pa dang / zhe sdang bag la nyal ba'i ngag gi las gang rmongs pas 'byin pa dang / gti mug bag la nyal ba'i ngag gi las gang chags pas 'byin pa dang / gti mug bag la nyal ba'i ngag gi las gang sdang bas 'byin pa dang / 'dod chags bag la nyal ba'i ngag gi las gang chags pa'i 'byin pa dang / zhe sdang bag la nyal ba'i ngag gi las gang sdang bas 'byin pa dang /
translated: “They know perfectly the verbal actions that are motivated by attachment and arise from anger, the verbal actions that are motivated by attachment and arise from delusion, the verbal actions that are motivated by anger and arise from attachment, the verbal actions that are motivated by anger and arise from delusion,🔽the verbal actions that are motivated by delusion and arise from attachment, the verbal actions that are motivated by delusion and arise from anger, the verbal actions that are motivated by attachment and arise from attachment, the verbal actions that are motivated by anger and arise from anger,

original: gti mug bag la nyal ba'i ngag gi las @213b gang rmongs pas 'byin pa de dag thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gti mug bag la nyal ba'i ngag gi las @213b gang rmongs pas 'byin pa de dag thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: and the verbal actions that are motivated by delusion and arise from delusion.”

original: dag gi las gang bsam pa dag la sbyor ba nyams pa dang / ngag gi las gang sbyor ba dag la bsam pa nyams pa dang / ngag gi las gang bsam pa'ang dag la sbyor ba'ang dag pa dang / ngag gi las gang bsam pa'ang ma dag la sbyor ba'ang ma dag pa de thams cad lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes thogs pa med pa des yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dag gi las gang bsam pa dag la sbyor ba nyams pa dang / ngag gi las gang sbyor ba dag la bsam pa nyams pa dang / ngag gi las gang bsam pa'ang dag la sbyor ba'ang dag pa dang / ngag gi las gang bsam pa'ang ma dag la sbyor ba'ang ma dag pa de thams cad lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes thogs pa med pa des yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows perfectly, just as it is, through the unobstructed knowledge of the supernormal power of the divine ear, all the actions of the body and all the actions of speech, whether they are pure or impure, whether they are pure in thought but faulty in practice, whether they are pure in practice but faulty in thought, whether they are pure in thought and pure in practice, or whether they are faulty in thought and faulty in practice.

original: de dag lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes kyis 'phags pa dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa'i sgra rnams thos te /
analyzed: de dag lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes kyis 'phags pa dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa'i sgra rnams thos te /
translated: By means of the knowledge of the supernormal power of the divine ear, they hear the sounds of noble beings and the sounds of ignoble beings.

original: thos nas kyang 'phags pa'i sgra rnams la rjes su chags par yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: thos nas kyang 'phags pa'i sgra rnams la rjes su chags par yang mi 'gyur /
translated: Having heard them, they do not become attached to the sounds of noble beings,

original: 'phags pa ma yin pa'i sgra rnams la khong khro bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'phags pa ma yin pa'i sgra rnams la khong khro bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: nor do they become averse to the sounds of ignoble beings.

original: de dag 'phags pa'i sgra rnams la byams pa chen po thob cing 'phags pa ma yin pa'i sgra rnams la snying rje chen po 'thob bo //
analyzed: de dag 'phags pa'i sgra rnams la byams pa chen po thob cing 'phags pa ma yin pa'i sgra rnams la snying rje chen po 'thob bo //
translated: They attain great love for the sounds of the noble ones, and great compassion for the sounds of those who are not noble.

original: sgra thams cad la'ang sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' bye brag 'byed pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: sgra thams cad la'ang sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' bye brag 'byed pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: They know the past and future of all sounds just as they are.

original: de dag lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes des sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gsungs pa thos te /
analyzed: de dag lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes des sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gsungs pa thos te /
translated: With the knowledge of the supernormal power of the divine ear, they hear the speech of all the buddhas.

original: thos nas kyang dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / mi brjed pa'i chos nyid kyis thams cad 'dzin to //
analyzed: thos nas kyang dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / mi brjed pa'i chos nyid kyis thams cad 'dzin to //
translated: Having heard it, they retain it all with mindfulness, introspection, and the quality of non-forgetfulness.

original: bzung nas kyang brjed par mi byed cing snod ji lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams la dran par byed @214a *//
analyzed: bzung nas kyang brjed par mi byed cing snod ji lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams la dran par byed @214a *//
translated: Having retained it, they do not forget it, and they remind beings according to their vessels.

original: do; ;snying po dang / snying po ma yin pa'i chos rnams kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: do; ;snying po dang / snying po ma yin pa'i chos rnams kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: They know the essential and non-essential dharmas just as they are.

original: de dag de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gi chos bstan pa nyan na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis pa'i chos bstan pa la sgrib par byed pa'am /
analyzed: de dag de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gi chos bstan pa nyan na / de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis pa'i chos bstan pa la sgrib par byed pa'am /
translated: If they listen to the Dharma teaching of one Tathāgata,

original: kun nas ldang bar byed pa mi byed do //
analyzed: kun nas ldang bar byed pa mi byed do //
translated: they do not create an obstacle or a disturbance for the Dharma teaching of a second Tathāgata.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gsungs pa snga phyi med par 'dzin to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gsungs pa snga phyi med par 'dzin to //
translated: They hold the teachings of all Buddhas in mind without confusion.

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sgra gang dag thos pa de dag kyang dran pa dang / shes bzhin gyis dus dus su brjod do //
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sgra gang dag thos pa de dag kyang dran pa dang / shes bzhin gyis dus dus su brjod do //
translated: Whatever sounds they hear, whether virtuous, nonvirtuous, or neutral, they express them at the appropriate time with mindfulness and vigilance.

original: gal te 'khor gyi dus yin yang chos bstan pa'i dus ma yin par rig na 'jog ste /
analyzed: gal te 'khor gyi dus yin yang chos bstan pa'i dus ma yin par rig na 'jog ste /
translated: If they know that it is time for the assembly but not time for teaching the Dharma, they remain silent.

original: chos nas kyang mi ston to //
analyzed: chos nas kyang mi ston to //
translated: They do not teach the Dharma.

original: chos bstan pa'i dus yin la dbang gcig gi 'khor gyi dus yin na'ang thams cad la chos mi ston to //
analyzed: chos bstan pa'i dus yin la dbang gcig gi 'khor gyi dus yin na'ang thams cad la chos mi ston to //
translated: If it is time for teaching the Dharma but not time for the assembly of a single person, they do not teach the Dharma to everyone.

original: bden par lung bstan pa'ang gzhan la gnod na lung mi ston to //
analyzed: bden par lung bstan pa'ang gzhan la gnod na lung mi ston to //
translated: If they prophesy the truth, they do not prophesy if it would harm others.

original: mi bden pa'i lung bstan pa'ang don dang ldan zhing gzhan rjes su gzung ba dang mthun na thabs mkhas pa dang / bdag gi sems yongs su dag pas lung ston to //
analyzed: mi bden pa'i lung bstan pa'ang don dang ldan zhing gzhan rjes su gzung ba dang mthun na thabs mkhas pa dang / bdag gi sems yongs su dag pas lung ston to //
translated: If the prophecy is not true, but is in accord with the benefit of others and is in accord with the acceptance of others, it is skillful means.

original: sgra ji lta bu nyan par 'dod pa de lta bu'i sgra thos te /
analyzed: sgra ji lta bu nyan par 'dod pa de lta bu'i sgra thos te /
translated: “He hears whatever sounds he wishes to hear.

original: sgra ji lta bu nyan par mi 'dod pa de lta bu'i sgra mi thos so //
analyzed: sgra ji lta bu nyan par mi 'dod pa de lta bu'i sgra mi thos so //
translated: He does not hear whatever sounds he does not wish to hear.

original: 'khor gang na chos ston pa de'i sems can thams cad kyi rna ba'i gnas kyi shes pa'ang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes te /
analyzed: 'khor gang na chos ston pa de'i sems can thams cad kyi rna ba'i gnas kyi shes pa'ang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes te /
translated: “He knows the thoughts of all beings in the assembly in which he teaches the Dharma.

original: shes nas kyang rang bzhin de 'dra ba'i chos ston to //🔽de la sems @214b can gang dag chos shes par byed pa de dag ni de'i chos bstan pa thos so //
analyzed: shes nas kyang rang bzhin de 'dra ba'i chos ston to // de la sems @214b can gang dag chos shes par byed pa de dag ni de'i chos bstan pa thos so //
translated: Knowing that, he teaches the Dharma in that way.🔽Those beings who are receptive to the Dharma hear his teaching of the Dharma.

original: sems can gang dag chos shes par byed pa ma yin pa de dag ni de'i chos bstan pa mi thos so //
analyzed: sems can gang dag chos shes par byed pa ma yin pa de dag ni de'i chos bstan pa mi thos so //
translated: Those beings who are not receptive to the Dharma do not hear his teaching of the Dharma.

original: de dag gi rna ba'i khams de ni chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi rna ba'i khams de ni chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa yin no //
translated: Their ear element is the utterly pure realm of phenomena.

original: de dag gi rna ba'i khams de ni ye shes rnam par dag pa yin /
analyzed: de dag gi rna ba'i khams de ni ye shes rnam par dag pa yin /
translated: Their ear element is the purity of wisdom.

original: de dag gi rna ba'i khams de bdag gi khams shin tu rnam par dag pa yin /
analyzed: de dag gi rna ba'i khams de bdag gi khams shin tu rnam par dag pa yin /
translated: Their ear element is the utter purity of the element of self.

original: de dag gi rna ba'i khams de sems can gyi khams dang / srog gi khams dang / gang zag gi khams rnam par dag pa yin /
analyzed: de dag gi rna ba'i khams de sems can gyi khams dang / srog gi khams dang / gang zag gi khams rnam par dag pa yin /
translated: Their ear element is the purity of the element of sentient beings, the element of life, and the element of person.

original: de dag gi rna ba'i khams de sgra dang / yi ge dang / nges pa'i tshig ji lta ba bzhin du thos pas shin tu brtags pa yin /
analyzed: de dag gi rna ba'i khams de sgra dang / yi ge dang / nges pa'i tshig ji lta ba bzhin du thos pas shin tu brtags pa yin /
translated: Their ear element is well investigated by hearing sounds, letters, and definitions as they are.

original: 'gro ba lngar skyes pa'i sems can thams cad gang dag sgra dang / yi ge dang / nges pa'i tshig sna tshogs smra ba de dag la skad ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug pas chos ston to //
analyzed: 'gro ba lngar skyes pa'i sems can thams cad gang dag sgra dang / yi ge dang / nges pa'i tshig sna tshogs smra ba de dag la skad ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug pas chos ston to //
translated: They teach the Dharma to all sentient beings born in the five destinies, speaking various sounds, letters, and definitions, in accordance with their languages.

original: de dag gi lha'i rna ba'i khams de theg pa gzhan mi nyan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i snyan du yongs su bsngos pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi lha'i rna ba'i khams de theg pa gzhan mi nyan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i snyan du yongs su bsngos pa yin te /
translated: Because they do not listen to other vehicles, they dedicate their divine ear to the divine ear of the Tathagata.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattvas’ imperishability of the superknowledge of the divine ear.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi pha rol gyi sems shes pa'i mngon par shes pa mi zad pa gang zhe na /🔽pha rol gyi sems shes pa zhes bya ba ni gang sems can thams cad kyi sngon gyi mtha'i sems shes pa dang / phyi ma'i mtha'i sems @215a *//
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi pha rol gyi sems shes pa'i mngon par shes pa mi zad pa gang zhe na / pha rol gyi sems shes pa zhes bya ba ni gang sems can thams cad kyi sngon gyi mtha'i sems shes pa dang / phyi ma'i mtha'i sems @215a *//
translated: “What is the bodhisattvas’ imperishability of the superknowledge that knows the minds of others?

original: shes pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sems shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sems shes pa'o //
translated: The so-called knowledge of the minds of others is the knowledge of the minds of all sentient beings in the past, the knowledge of the minds of all sentient beings in the future, and the knowledge of the minds of all sentient beings in the present.

original: de 'das pa'i sems shes pas sems can rnams kyi sngon gyi mthas byung ba'i sems la 'jug ste /🔽sems can 'di'i sems 'di ni rgyu che'o //
analyzed: de 'das pa'i sems shes pas sems can rnams kyi sngon gyi mthas byung ba'i sems la 'jug ste / sems can 'di'i sems 'di ni rgyu che'o //
translated: “By knowing the past mind, they penetrate the past minds of sentient beings.🔽This mind of this sentient being is a great cause.

original: sems can 'di'i sems 'di ni rgyu 'bring ngo //
analyzed: sems can 'di'i sems 'di ni rgyu 'bring ngo //
translated: This mind of this sentient being is a middling cause.

original: sems can 'di'i sems 'di ni rgyu chung ngo //
analyzed: sems can 'di'i sems 'di ni rgyu chung ngo //
translated: This being’s mind is of a small cause.

original: sems can 'di'i dbang po rnams ni sbyin pa'i rnam pa'i rgyu dang ldan no //
analyzed: sems can 'di'i dbang po rnams ni sbyin pa'i rnam pa'i rgyu dang ldan no //
translated: This being’s faculties are endowed with the cause of the aspect of generosity.

original: sems can 'di'i dbang po rnams ni tshul khrims kyi rnam pa'i rgyu dang ldan no //🔽sems can 'di'i dbang po rnams ni bzod pa'i rnam pa'i rgyu dang ldan no //
analyzed: sems can 'di'i dbang po rnams ni tshul khrims kyi rnam pa'i rgyu dang ldan no // sems can 'di'i dbang po rnams ni bzod pa'i rnam pa'i rgyu dang ldan no //
translated: This being’s faculties are endowed with the cause of the aspect of morality.🔽This being’s faculties are endowed with the cause of the aspect of patience.

original: sems can 'di'i dbang po rnams ni brtson 'grus kyi rnam pa'i rgyu dang ldan no //
analyzed: sems can 'di'i dbang po rnams ni brtson 'grus kyi rnam pa'i rgyu dang ldan no //
translated: This being’s faculties are endowed with the cause of the aspect of effort.

original: sems can 'di'i dbang po rnams ni bsam gtan gyi rnam pa'i rgyu dang ldan no //
analyzed: sems can 'di'i dbang po rnams ni bsam gtan gyi rnam pa'i rgyu dang ldan no //
translated: This being’s faculties are endowed with the cause of the aspect of meditative stabilization.

original: sems can 'di'i dbang po rnams ni shes rab kyi rnam pa'i rgyu dang ldan no //🔽sems can 'di'i dbang po rnams ni byams pa'i rnam pa'i rgyu dang ldan no //
analyzed: sems can 'di'i dbang po rnams ni shes rab kyi rnam pa'i rgyu dang ldan no // sems can 'di'i dbang po rnams ni byams pa'i rnam pa'i rgyu dang ldan no //
translated: This being’s faculties are endowed with the cause of the aspect of wisdom.🔽This being’s faculties are endowed with the cause of the aspect of love.

original: sems can 'di'i dbang po rnams ni snying rje'i rnam pa'i rgyu dang ldan no //
analyzed: sems can 'di'i dbang po rnams ni snying rje'i rnam pa'i rgyu dang ldan no //
translated: This being’s faculties are endowed with the cause of the aspect of compassion.

original: sems can 'di'i dbang po rnams ni dga' ba'i rnam pa'i rgyu dang ldan no //
analyzed: sems can 'di'i dbang po rnams ni dga' ba'i rnam pa'i rgyu dang ldan no //
translated: “The faculties of this being are the cause of the aspect of joy.

original: sems can 'di'i dbang po rnams ni btang snyoms kyi rnam pa'i rgyu dang ldan no //
analyzed: sems can 'di'i dbang po rnams ni btang snyoms kyi rnam pa'i rgyu dang ldan no //
translated: The faculties of this being are the cause of the aspect of equanimity.

original: sems can 'di'i dbang po rnams ni nyan thos kyi theg pa'i rnam pa'i rgyu dang ldan no //
analyzed: sems can 'di'i dbang po rnams ni nyan thos kyi theg pa'i rnam pa'i rgyu dang ldan no //
translated: The faculties of this being are the cause of the aspect of the Śrāvakayāna.

original: sems can 'di'i dbang po rnams ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i rnam pa'i rgyu @215b dang ldan no //
analyzed: sems can 'di'i dbang po rnams ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i rnam pa'i rgyu @215b dang ldan no //
translated: The faculties of this being are the cause of the aspect of the Pratyeka­buddha­yāna.

original: sems can 'di'i dbang po rnams ni theg pa chen po'i rnam pa'i rgyu dang ldan no //
analyzed: sems can 'di'i dbang po rnams ni theg pa chen po'i rnam pa'i rgyu dang ldan no //
translated: The faculties of this being are the cause of the aspect of the Mahāyāna.

original: sems can 'di ni rgyu'i stobs can te /
analyzed: sems can 'di ni rgyu'i stobs can te /
translated: This being has the power of causes.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu'i rgyun 'di dang ldan na sems can 'di sbyor ba'i rgyus rigs dma' bar skyes so //🔽sems can 'di ni bsam pa dag la sbyor ba ma dag pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu'i rgyun 'di dang ldan na sems can 'di sbyor ba'i rgyus rigs dma' bar skyes so // sems can 'di ni bsam pa dag la sbyor ba ma dag pa'o //
translated: With this stream of causes of roots of virtue, this being has been born into a low family because of the cause of application.🔽This being has pure intention but impure application.

original: sems can 'di ni sbyor ba dag la bsam pa ma dag pa'o //
analyzed: sems can 'di ni sbyor ba dag la bsam pa ma dag pa'o //
translated: This being has pure application but impure intention.

original: sems can 'di ni bsam pa'ang dag la sbyor ba'ang dag pa'o //
analyzed: sems can 'di ni bsam pa'ang dag la sbyor ba'ang dag pa'o //
translated: This sentient being has pure intention and pure application.🔽This sentient being has impure intention and impure application.🔽In this way, they know the mental activity of all sentient beings, which arises from their faculties that arise from past causes.

original: sems can 'di ni bsam pa'ang ma dag la sbyor ba'ang ma dag pa'o zhes de ltar gang sems can thams cad kyi sngon gyi rgyu las byung byung ba'i dbang po rnams las sems kyi spyod pa shes pa de dag thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin🔽du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: sems can 'di ni bsam pa'ang ma dag la sbyor ba'ang ma dag pa'o zhes de ltar gang sems can thams cad kyi sngon gyi rgyu las byung byung ba'i dbang po rnams las sems kyi spyod pa shes pa de dag thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: They know all of that correctly, just as it is.

original: shes nas kyang so sor ci rigs par chos ston pa 'di ni sngon gyi mtha'i pha rol gyi sems shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes nas kyang so sor ci rigs par chos ston pa 'di ni sngon gyi mtha'i pha rol gyi sems shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Having known it, they teach the Dharma individually and appropriately. This is called the knowledge of the mind that is beyond the past limit.

original: de la phyi ma'i mtha'i pha rol gyi sems shes pa gang zhe na /🔽sems can 'di'i da ltar gyi sbyin pa'i rgyu ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'di'i tshul khrims kyi rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la phyi ma'i mtha'i pha rol gyi sems shes pa gang zhe na / sems can 'di'i da ltar gyi sbyin pa'i rgyu ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'di'i tshul khrims kyi rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: What is the knowledge of the mind that is beyond the future limit?🔽The present cause of generosity of this sentient being will, in the future, become the cause of their morality.

original: sems can 'di'i da ltar tshul khrims kyi rgyu ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'di'i bzod pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can 'di'i da ltar tshul khrims kyi rgyu ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'di'i bzod pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: The present cause of morality of this sentient being will, in the future, become the cause of their patience.

original: sems can 'di'i da ltar bzod pa'i rgyu ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'di'i brtson 'grus kyi rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can 'di'i da ltar bzod pa'i rgyu ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'di'i brtson 'grus kyi rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: The cause of patience in this sentient being will become the cause of his or her effort in the future.

original: sems can 'di'i da ltar brtson 'grus kyi rgyu ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'di'i bsam gtan 'gyur 'gyur ro //🔽sems can 'di'i da @216a *//
analyzed: sems can 'di'i da ltar brtson 'grus kyi rgyu ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'di'i bsam gtan 'gyur 'gyur ro // sems can 'di'i da @216a *//
translated: The cause of effort in this sentient being will become the cause of his or her meditative stabilization in the future.

original: ltar bsam gtan gyi rgyu ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'di'i shes rab kyi rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ltar bsam gtan gyi rgyu ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'di'i shes rab kyi rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: The cause of meditative stabilization in this sentient being will become the cause of his or her wisdom in the future.

original: sems can 'di'i da ltar 'jig rten pa'i shes pa dang spyod pa'i rgyu ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'di'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can 'di'i da ltar 'jig rten pa'i shes pa dang spyod pa'i rgyu ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'di'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: The cause of mundane knowledge and conduct in this sentient being will become the cause of his or her supramundane qualities in the future.

original: sems can 'di'i da ltar dbang po dman pa'i rgyu ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'di'i theg pa chen po'i rgyur 'gyur ro zhes de ltar ma 'ongs pa'i dus na sems can rnams kyi rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag dang / rnam pa gang dag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i sems can rnams kyi rgyu de dag dang /
analyzed: sems can 'di'i da ltar dbang po dman pa'i rgyu ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'di'i theg pa chen po'i rgyur 'gyur ro zhes de ltar ma 'ongs pa'i dus na sems can rnams kyi rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang dag dang / rnam pa gang dag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i sems can rnams kyi rgyu de dag dang /
translated: “This being’s present cause of inferior faculties will in the future become the cause of their Great Vehicle.” In this way, bodhisattvas know perfectly well what causes, what conditions, and what aspects will occur in the future for beings.

original: rkyen de dag dang / rnam pa de dag byang chub sems dpas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: rkyen de dag dang / rnam pa de dag byang chub sems dpas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: They know perfectly well what causes, what conditions, and what aspects will occur in the future for beings.

original: de sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba la skyo bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba la skyo bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: They never tire of bringing all beings to full maturity.

original: de'i sems la 'jug pa'i shes pa dang / chos kyi snod du gyur pa ji snyed pa de snyed du chos ston to //
analyzed: de'i sems la 'jug pa'i shes pa dang / chos kyi snod du gyur pa ji snyed pa de snyed du chos ston to //
translated: They teach the Dharma to the extent that they have the knowledge to enter the minds of beings and to the extent that beings are suitable vessels for the Dharma.

original: 'bras bu yod par chos ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yod par chos ston pa yin te /
translated: They teach the Dharma with a result.

original: chos kyi gtam la ser sna mi byed pa 'di ni phyi ma'i mtha'i pha rol gyi sems shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi gtam la ser sna mi byed pa 'di ni phyi ma'i mtha'i pha rol gyi sems shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the knowledge of the minds of others in the future.

original: de la da ltar byung ba'i pha rol gyi sems shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la da ltar byung ba'i pha rol gyi sems shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the knowledge of the minds of others in the present?

original: gang da ltar byung ba'i dus na sems can thams cad kyi sems dang / sems las byung ba gang dag skye ba de dag thams cad byang chub sems dpas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /🔽des 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems kyang 'dod chags @216b dang bcas pa'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gang da ltar byung ba'i dus na sems can thams cad kyi sems dang / sems las byung ba gang dag skye ba de dag thams cad byang chub sems dpas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te / des 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems kyang 'dod chags @216b dang bcas pa'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: The bodhisattva knows as it truly is all the minds and mental states of all beings that have arisen in the present.🔽He knows as it truly is a mind with passion as a mind with passion.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows as it truly is a mind without passion as a mind without passion.

original: de bzhin du zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang bral ba dang / bsdud pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang bral ba dang / bsdud pa dang /
translated: Likewise, he knows as it truly is that a mind with anger is a mind with anger, a mind without anger is a mind without anger, a mind with delusion is a mind with delusion, a mind without delusion is a mind without delusion, a mind with afflictions is a mind with afflictions, a mind without afflictions is a mind without afflictions, a mind that is contracted is a mind that is contracted,

original: rnam par g-yengs pa dang / mnyam par bzhag pa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang / bying ba dang / rab tu 'dzin pa dang / rgod pa dang / mi rgod pa dang rnam par zhi ba dang / rnam par ma zhi ba dang /
analyzed: rnam par g-yengs pa dang / mnyam par bzhag pa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang / bying ba dang / rab tu 'dzin pa dang / rgod pa dang / mi rgod pa dang rnam par zhi ba dang / rnam par ma zhi ba dang /
translated: a distracted mind is a distracted mind, an absorbed mind is an absorbed mind, an undirected mind is an undirected mind, a sunken mind is a sunken mind, an uplifted mind is an uplifted mind, an excited mind is an excited mind, an unexcited mind is an unexcited mind, a pacified mind is a pacified mind, an unpacified mind is an unpacified mind,

original: rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par ma grol ba dang / rgya che ba dang / rgya che ba ma yin pa dang / chung ngu dang / yangs pa dang / chen por gyur pa dang / tshad med pa'i sems kyang tshad med pa'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par ma grol ba dang / rgya che ba dang / rgya che ba ma yin pa dang / chung ngu dang / yangs pa dang / chen por gyur pa dang / tshad med pa'i sems kyang tshad med pa'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: a liberated mind is a liberated mind, an unliberated mind is an unliberated mind, a vast mind is a vast mind, a not vast mind is a not vast mind, a small mind is a small mind, a vast mind is a vast mind, a great mind is a great mind, and an immeasurable mind is an immeasurable mind.

original: de ltar nyon mongs pa gang dang / gang gis sems can gang dang / gang gis sems bsgribs par gyur pa de dag thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: de ltar nyon mongs pa gang dang / gang gis sems can gang dang / gang gis sems bsgribs par gyur pa de dag thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: In this way, he knows exactly which afflictions are obscuring the minds of which sentient beings.

original: shes nas kyang shes rab kyis ji ltar nyon mongs pa las nges par 'byung bar 'gyur bar chos ston to //
analyzed: shes nas kyang shes rab kyis ji ltar nyon mongs pa las nges par 'byung bar 'gyur bar chos ston to //
translated: And having known this, he teaches the Dharma in such a way that they will be liberated from those afflictions.

original: de 'khor gang du 'gro bar thog ma nyid du 'khor de'i sems la lta ste /
analyzed: de 'khor gang du 'gro bar thog ma nyid du 'khor de'i sems la lta ste /
translated: Wherever he goes in the retinue, he first looks at the minds of the retinue.

original: bltas nas kyang so so ci rigs par chos ston to //🔽de ltar gang sems can de dag gi dbang po mchog dang / mchog ma yin @217a *//
analyzed: bltas nas kyang so so ci rigs par chos ston to // de ltar gang sems can de dag gi dbang po mchog dang / mchog ma yin @217a *//
translated: And having looked, he teaches the Dharma in a way that is appropriate for each.

original: ba shes pa de dag thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: ba shes pa de dag thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: In this way, he knows exactly which faculties are superior and which are not among those sentient beings.

original: rang gi sems bsgribs pa'am /
analyzed: rang gi sems bsgribs pa'am /
translated: His own mind is not obscured,🔽nor is the mind of another obscured.

original: gzhan gyi sems bsgribs par mi 'gyur ro; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems bsgribs par mi 'gyur ro; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i de'i sems kyi rgyun ni ye shes kyis rig pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i de'i sems kyi rgyun ni ye shes kyis rig pa /
translated: Because the continuum of that bodhisattva’s mind is known through wisdom.

original: dran pas rig pa /
analyzed: dran pas rig pa /
translated: It is to know through mindfulness.

original: blo gros kyis rig pa /
analyzed: blo gros kyis rig pa /
translated: It is to know through intelligence.

original: rtogs pas rig pa /
analyzed: rtogs pas rig pa /
translated: It is to know through realization.

original: shes rab kyis rig pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyis rig pa /
translated: It is to know through wisdom.

original: byang chub kyis rig pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyis rig pa'o //
translated: It is to know through awakening.

original: sems kyi rgyun ni nyon mongs pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyun ni nyon mongs pa dang bral ba /
translated: It is to know the continuum of mind as free from afflictions.

original: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa yang dag par chad pa dag pa /
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa yang dag par chad pa dag pa /
translated: It is to know the continuum of mind as pure, having completely severed the afflictions of the latent tendencies.

original: dri ma med pa /
analyzed: dri ma med pa /
translated: It is to know the continuum of mind as stainless.

original: 'od gsal ba /🔽kha na ma tho pa med pa /
analyzed: 'od gsal ba / kha na ma tho pa med pa /
translated: It is to know the continuum of mind as radiant.

original: mi brlang ba /
analyzed: mi brlang ba /
translated: It is to know the continuum of mind as free from wrongdoing.🔽It is to know the continuum of mind as free from harshness.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa /
translated: It is to know the continuum of mind as free from afflictions.

original: rnyog pa med pa /🔽chos thams cad snang bas rig pa /
analyzed: rnyog pa med pa / chos thams cad snang bas rig pa /
translated: It is to know the continuum of mind as free from turbidity.🔽It is to know the continuum of mind as illuminating all phenomena.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa la zhugs shing sems kyi rgyun shin tu rig pa ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa la zhugs shing sems kyi rgyun shin tu rig pa ste /
translated: It is to know the continuum of mind as engaged in the mental activity of all sentient beings.

original: de ltar gang de lta bu'i chos la sems 'bab pa shes pa la 'jug pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol gyi sems shes pa'i mngon par shes pa mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gang de lta bu'i chos la sems 'bab pa shes pa la 'jug pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol gyi sems shes pa'i mngon par shes pa mi zad pa'o //
translated: In this way, the bodhisatvas’ knowledge of the minds of others is inexhaustible.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa mngon sum du byed pa'i mngon par shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa mngon sum du byed pa'i mngon par shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva’s superknowledge that consists of the knowledge of recollecting former abodes and that realizes the knowledge of direct perception?

original: des dran pa des sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran te /
analyzed: des dran pa des sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran te /
translated: By means of that recollection, he recollects former abodes.

original: dran pa de ni chos kyi dbyings kyi gnas kyis shin tu byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa de ni chos kyi dbyings kyi gnas kyis shin tu byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
translated: That recollection is well empowered by the abode of the dharma-dhātu.

original: rab tu rig pas ni mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu rig pas ni mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: By means of discernment, it is unshakable.

original: ye shes shin tu yongs su sbyang ba byas pas na mi rgod pa'o //🔽@217b zhi gnas la rab tu gnas pas na 'tshe ba med pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes shin tu yongs su sbyang ba byas pas na mi rgod pa'o // @217b zhi gnas la rab tu gnas pas na 'tshe ba med pa'o //
translated: By means of the purification of wisdom, it is not agitated.🔽By means of the stability of śamatha, it is harmless.

original: lhag mthong gis shin tu zin pas na nor ba med pa'o //
analyzed: lhag mthong gis shin tu zin pas na nor ba med pa'o //
translated: By means of the retention of vipaśyanā, it is not mistaken.

original: mngon sum du shes pas na gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du shes pas na gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa'o //
translated: By means of direct knowledge, it is not dependent on others.

original: dran zhing mi brjed pa'i chos can pas na dran par bya ba'o //
analyzed: dran zhing mi brjed pa'i chos can pas na dran par bya ba'o //
translated: By means of the quality of being mindful and not forgetting, it is to be remembered.

original: theg pa chen po rab tu shes pa'i phyir bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po rab tu shes pa'i phyir bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa'o //
translated: By means of understanding the Mahāyāna, it is the accumulation of merit.

original: gzhan la rag ma lus pas na ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'o; ;thams cad kyi pha rol tu 'gro ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi tshogs bsags pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la rag ma lus pas na ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'o; ;thams cad kyi pha rol tu 'gro ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi tshogs bsags pa'o //
translated: The accumulation of the collections of all perfections is the going beyond all.

original: de dran pa des sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran te /
analyzed: de dran pa des sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran te /
translated: By that mindfulness, he recollects his former abodes.

original: des tshe rabs gcig kyang rjes su dran no //
analyzed: des tshe rabs gcig kyang rjes su dran no //
translated: He recollects one birth.

original: gnyis dang / gsum dang / bzhi dang / lnga dang / bcu dang / nyi shu dang / sum cu dang / bzhi bcu dang / lnga bcu dang / tshe rabs brgya'ang rjes su dran no //
analyzed: gnyis dang / gsum dang / bzhi dang / lnga dang / bcu dang / nyi shu dang / sum cu dang / bzhi bcu dang / lnga bcu dang / tshe rabs brgya'ang rjes su dran no //
translated: He recollects two, three, four, five, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, a hundred births.

original: tshe rabs stong dang / tshe rabs brgya stong dang / tshe rabs brgya phrag du ma dang / tshe rabs stong phrag du ma dang / tshe rabs brgya stong phrag du ma dang / chags pa'i bskal pa dang / 'jig pa'i bskal pa dang / chags pa'i bskal pa du ma dang /
analyzed: tshe rabs stong dang / tshe rabs brgya stong dang / tshe rabs brgya phrag du ma dang / tshe rabs stong phrag du ma dang / tshe rabs brgya stong phrag du ma dang / chags pa'i bskal pa dang / 'jig pa'i bskal pa dang / chags pa'i bskal pa du ma dang /
translated: He recollects a thousand births, a hundred thousand births, many hundreds of births, many thousands of births, many hundreds of thousands of births. He recollects an eon of dissolution, an eon of evolution, an eon of dissolution and evolution. He recollects many eons of dissolution, many eons of evolution, many eons of dissolution and evolution.

original: 'jig pa'i bskal pa du ma dang / chags pa dang / 'jig pa'i bskal pa du ma'ang rjes su dran no //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i bskal pa du ma dang / chags pa dang / 'jig pa'i bskal pa du ma'ang rjes su dran no //
translated: He recollects many eons of dissolution, many eons of creation, and many eons of dissolution followed by creation.

original: bskal pa brgya dang / bskal pa stong dang / bskal pa brgya stong dang / bskal pa brgya phrag du ma dang / bskal pa stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa brgya stong phrag du ma'ang rjes su dran te /
analyzed: bskal pa brgya dang / bskal pa stong dang / bskal pa brgya stong dang / bskal pa brgya phrag du ma dang / bskal pa stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa brgya stong phrag du ma'ang rjes su dran te /
translated: He recollects a hundred eons, a thousand eons, a hundred thousand eons, many eons, many hundreds of eons, many thousands of eons, and many hundreds of thousands of eons.

original: sems can ming che ge mo zhes bya ba de dag byung @218a *//
analyzed: sems can ming che ge mo zhes bya ba de dag byung @218a *//
translated: He thinks, “Those sentient beings who were called by this or that name,🔽who were such and such,

original: bar gyur pa der bdag kyang byung ste /🔽bdag gi ming ni 'di zhes bya /🔽rigs ni 'di zhes bya /
analyzed: bar gyur pa der bdag kyang byung ste / bdag gi ming ni 'di zhes bya / rigs ni 'di zhes bya /
translated: who did this or that,🔽who were of this or that caste,

original: rus ni 'di zhes bya /
analyzed: rus ni 'di zhes bya /
translated: who were of this or that family,

original: kha dog ni 'di 'dra /
analyzed: kha dog ni 'di 'dra /
translated: who were of this or that color,

original: kha zas ni 'di lta bu zhig za za /🔽tshe'i tshad ni 'di tsam zhig thub thub /
analyzed: kha zas ni 'di lta bu zhig za za / tshe'i tshad ni 'di tsam zhig thub thub /
translated: who ate this or that,🔽who lived for this or that length of time,

original: yun ni 'di srid cig gnas gnas /
analyzed: yun ni 'di srid cig gnas gnas /
translated: who were long-lived,

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ni 'di lta bu zhig myong ngo //
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ni 'di lta bu zhig myong ngo //
translated: who experienced this or that pleasure or pain—🔽I was one of them.🔽I was born there,

original: bdag de nas shi 'phos nas che ge mo zhig tu skyes so //
analyzed: bdag de nas shi 'phos nas che ge mo zhig tu skyes so //
translated: and after dying there, I was born here.”

original: de nas kyang shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes te /
analyzed: de nas kyang shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes te /
translated: Then, after passing away from there, I was born here.

original: de ltar rnam pa dang bcas /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa dang bcas /
translated: In this way, I remember my many past abodes with their aspects,

original: rgyu mtshan dang bcas /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan dang bcas /
translated: their particulars, and their locations.

original: yul phyogs dang bcas par sngon gyi gnas rnam pa mang po rjes su dran no; ;des bdag dang / sems can gzhan gyi sngon gyi mtha' nas bzung ste sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran no //
analyzed: yul phyogs dang bcas par sngon gyi gnas rnam pa mang po rjes su dran no; ;des bdag dang / sems can gzhan gyi sngon gyi mtha' nas bzung ste sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran no //
translated: In this way, I remember my own past abodes and those of other sentient beings, beginning from the very limits of cyclic existence.🔽I remember my own roots of virtue and those of other sentient beings that arose in the past.

original: de bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / sems can gzhan gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba sngon gyi rgyu las byung ba dran zhing bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba dran nas byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar byed do //
analyzed: de bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / sems can gzhan gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba sngon gyi rgyu las byung ba dran zhing bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba dran nas byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar byed do //
translated: Having remembered my own roots of virtue, I dedicate them toward awakening.

original: sems can gzhan gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dran nas sems can rnams byang chub tu sems bskyed du 'dzud do //
analyzed: sems can gzhan gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dran nas sems can rnams byang chub tu sems bskyed du 'dzud do //
translated: Having remembered the roots of virtue of other sentient beings, I inspire other sentient beings to generate the mind of awakening.🔽I also regard the suffering of past conditioning as impermanent,

original: gang sngon gyi 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal de'ang mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag med par rton par byed do //
analyzed: gang sngon gyi 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal de'ang mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag med par rton par byed do //
translated: suffering, empty, and lacking a self.

original: des mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag med par rton pas gzugs kyis dregs pa med pa yin /
analyzed: des mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag med par rton pas gzugs kyis dregs pa med pa yin /
translated: They are not conceited about form because they rely on impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and no-self.

original: kha dog gis dregs pa med pa yin /
analyzed: kha dog gis dregs pa med pa yin /
translated: They are not conceited about complexion.

original: nad med pas dregs pa med pa yin /
analyzed: nad med pas dregs pa med pa yin /
translated: They are not conceited about health.

original: @218b lang tshos dregs pa med pa yin /🔽'tsho bas dregs pa med pa yin /
analyzed: @218b lang tshos dregs pa med pa yin / 'tsho bas dregs pa med pa yin /
translated: They are not conceited about youth.🔽They are not conceited about livelihood.

original: longs spyod kyis dregs pa med pa yin /🔽g-yog 'khor gyis dregs pa med pa yin /
analyzed: longs spyod kyis dregs pa med pa yin / g-yog 'khor gyis dregs pa med pa yin /
translated: They are not conceited about wealth.🔽They are not conceited about retinue.

original: dbang phyug gis dregs pa med pa yin /🔽brgya byin du 'dod pa med pa yin /
analyzed: dbang phyug gis dregs pa med pa yin / brgya byin du 'dod pa med pa yin /
translated: They are not conceited about power.🔽They do not desire to be Śakra.

original: tshangs par 'dod pa med pa yin /🔽'jig rten skyong bar 'dod pa med pa yin /
analyzed: tshangs par 'dod pa med pa yin / 'jig rten skyong bar 'dod pa med pa yin /
translated: They do not desire to be Brahmā.🔽They do not desire to be a world protector.

original: 'khor los bsgyur bar 'dod pa med pa yin /
analyzed: 'khor los bsgyur bar 'dod pa med pa yin /
translated: They do not desire to be a universal monarch.

original: skye ba thams cad 'dod pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba thams cad 'dod pa med pa yin no //
translated: They do not desire any birth.

original: 'dod pa dang / rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug la dbang byed pa thams cad kyang bdag la bde ba'i phyir mi 'dod de /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug la dbang byed pa thams cad kyang bdag la bde ba'i phyir mi 'dod de /
translated: They do not desire any happiness for themselves, such as the pleasures of the senses or the power of a kingdom.

original: gzhan du na sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir bsams bzhin du srid par skye ba 'dzin to //
analyzed: gzhan du na sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir bsams bzhin du srid par skye ba 'dzin to //
translated: Otherwise, he would not take birth in existence through his own will in order to ripen beings.

original: de mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag med par rton pas sngon gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i spyod pas ngo tsha zhing 'dzem ste gnod zhing rnam par smod do //
analyzed: de mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag med par rton pas sngon gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i spyod pas ngo tsha zhing 'dzem ste gnod zhing rnam par smod do //
translated: He is ashamed and embarrassed by the former conduct of defilement, and he is disgusted and condemns it, because he has recourse to impermanence, suffering, emptiness and selflessness.

original: da ltar gyi tshe yang srog gi phyir yang mi bya ba mi byed cing de sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ste rgyas par byed do //
analyzed: da ltar gyi tshe yang srog gi phyir yang mi bya ba mi byed cing de sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ste rgyas par byed do //
translated: He does not commit, even at the cost of his life, what should not be done in the present, and he dedicates those former wholesome roots to enlightenment and increases them.

original: da ltar byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'ang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'ang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: He also dedicates the wholesome roots of the present to all beings.

original: des mi mthun par yongs su bsngo ba spangs te /
analyzed: des mi mthun par yongs su bsngo ba spangs te /
translated: He avoids dedication that is not in harmony with that.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rigs dang / chos kyi rigs dang / dge 'dun gyi rigs rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo ste /🔽'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa zhes mngon sum du byed pa'i mngon @219a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rigs dang / chos kyi rigs dang / dge 'dun gyi rigs rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo ste / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa zhes mngon sum du byed pa'i mngon @219a *//
translated: They dedicate so that the lineage of the Buddha, the lineage of the Dharma, and the lineage of the Saṅgha may be uninterrupted, and so that omniscience may be attained.

original: par shes pa mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: par shes pa mi zad pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisatvas’ imperishable superknowledge of the knowledge of recollecting past lives, which is manifested by direct perception.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul bya ba shes pa mngon par shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul bya ba shes pa mngon par shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisatvas’ superknowledge of the knowledge of magical powers?

original: gang 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang; sems dang / spyod pas rab tu zin pa'i chos rnams sgrub pa dang / las su rung ba dang / dbang byed pas des rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi po 'di dag shin tu bsgoms pa'i phyir mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i rdzu 'phrul mngon du thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang; sems dang / spyod pas rab tu zin pa'i chos rnams sgrub pa dang / las su rung ba dang / dbang byed pas des rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi po 'di dag shin tu bsgoms pa'i phyir mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i rdzu 'phrul mngon du thob par 'gyur te /
translated: It is the accomplishment of the qualities that are well-taken care of by aspiration, diligence, mind, and investigation, the serviceability, and the mastery of the four bases of magical powers. Because of this, they attain magical powers without effort.

original: de rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul rnam pa du ma myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul rnam pa du ma myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will experience many kinds of miraculous displays.🔽Those miraculous displays will be vast, for the sake of beings, in order to bring beings to full maturity.

original: de'i rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul de dag ni sems can la blta ba'i phyir rgya cher sems can yongs su smin par byed par 'gyur te /🔽de'i rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gang gis sems can 'dul ba'i rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul de dang / de sems can rnams la nye bar ston te /
analyzed: de'i rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul de dag ni sems can la blta ba'i phyir rgya cher sems can yongs su smin par byed par 'gyur te / de'i rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gang gis sems can 'dul ba'i rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul de dang / de sems can rnams la nye bar ston te /
translated: He will display to beings whatever miraculous displays will tame them.🔽Whether it is a form,🔽or a power,

original: gzugs su'am / stobs su'am /🔽byin gyi rlabs su'ang rung ste /
analyzed: gzugs su'am / stobs su'am / byin gyi rlabs su'ang rung ste /
translated: or a blessing,🔽he will display to beings whatever form and color he should display in order to tame beings.🔽He will display the form and color of a buddha,

original: de gzugs dang / kha dog tu snang ba gang dang / gang gis sems can 'dul bar 'gyur ba'i gzugs dang / kha dog tu snang ba de dang / de nyid sems can rnams la nye bar ston to //
analyzed: de gzugs dang / kha dog tu snang ba gang dang / gang gis sems can 'dul bar 'gyur ba'i gzugs dang / kha dog tu snang ba de dang / de nyid sems can rnams la nye bar ston to //
translated: or the form and color of a bodhisattva,🔽or the form and color of a pratyekabuddha,🔽or the form and color of a śrāvaka,

original: sangs rgyas kyi gzugs dang / kha dog tu snang ba'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gzugs dang / kha dog tu snang ba'am /
translated: or the form and color of Brahmā,🔽or the form and color of Nārāyaṇa,🔽or the form and color of Īśvara,🔽or the form and color of Maheśvara,🔽or the form and color of a universal monarch,🔽or the form and color of a king,🔽or the form and color of a householder,🔽or the form and color of a brahmin,🔽or the form and color of a vaiśya,🔽or the form and color of a śūdra,🔽or the form and color of a man,🔽or the form and color of a woman,🔽or the form and color of a boy,🔽or the form and color of a girl,🔽or the form and color of a nāga,🔽or the form and color of a garuḍa,🔽or the form and color of a kinnara,🔽or the form and color of a mahoraga,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs dang / kha dog tu snang ba'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs dang / kha dog tu snang ba'am /
translated: or the form and color of a yakṣa,🔽or the form and color of a rākṣasa,🔽or the form and color of a piśāca,🔽or the form and color of a kumbhāṇḍa,🔽or the form and color of a pūtana,🔽or the form and color of a kaṭapūtanas,🔽or the form and color of a vetāla,🔽or the form and color of a bhūta,🔽or the form and color of a preta,🔽or the form and color of a piśuna,🔽or the form and color of a mātṛkā,🔽or the form and color of a yakṣiṇī,🔽or the form and color of a rākṣasī,🔽or the form and color of a pūtana,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi gzugs dang / kha dog tu snang ba'am /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi gzugs dang / kha dog tu snang ba'am /
translated: the form and color of a pratyekabuddha,

original: nyan thos kyi gzugs dang / kha dog tu snang ba'am /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi gzugs dang / kha dog tu snang ba'am /
translated: the form and color of a śrāvaka,

original: brgya byin gyi gzugs dang / kha dog tu snang ba'am /🔽@219b 'jig rten skyong ba'i gzugs dang / kha dog tu snang ba'am /
analyzed: brgya byin gyi gzugs dang / kha dog tu snang ba'am / @219b 'jig rten skyong ba'i gzugs dang / kha dog tu snang ba'am /
translated: the form and color of Śakra,🔽the form and color of a world protector,

original: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i gzugs dang / kha dog tu snang ba'am /
analyzed: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i gzugs dang / kha dog tu snang ba'am /
translated: the form and color of a universal monarch,

original: de bzhin du khyab 'jug dang / skem byed dang / dbang phyug chen po dang; tshangs pa dang / skye dgu'i bdag po'i gzugs dang / kha dog tu snang ba'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du khyab 'jug dang / skem byed dang / dbang phyug chen po dang; tshangs pa dang / skye dgu'i bdag po'i gzugs dang / kha dog tu snang ba'am /
translated: and likewise the form and color of Viṣṇu, Rudra, Maheśvara, Brahmā, or Prajāpati,

original: gang de ma yin pa'i gzugs dang / kha dog tu snang ba tha na dud 'gro'i skye gnas kyi gzugs dang / kha dog tu snang ba gang dang / gang gis sems can gdul bar 'gyur ba'i gzugs dang / kha dog tu snang ba de dang /🔽de nyid ston te /
analyzed: gang de ma yin pa'i gzugs dang / kha dog tu snang ba tha na dud 'gro'i skye gnas kyi gzugs dang / kha dog tu snang ba gang dang / gang gis sems can gdul bar 'gyur ba'i gzugs dang / kha dog tu snang ba de dang /🔽de nyid ston te /
translated: or any other form and color, down to the form and color of an animal birth, whatever form and color would tame beings, that very form and color he manifests.

original: mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: He teaches the Dharma to sentient beings in accordance with their interests.

original: de stobs gang dang / gang gis stobs snyems pa dang / khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / rgyags pa dang / dregs pa'i shas che ba'i sems can rnams gdul bar bya ba'i stobs de dang / de nyid ston te /🔽yang na brgya byin gyi stobs sam /
analyzed: de stobs gang dang / gang gis stobs snyems pa dang / khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / rgyags pa dang / dregs pa'i shas che ba'i sems can rnams gdul bar bya ba'i stobs de dang / de nyid ston te / yang na brgya byin gyi stobs sam /
translated: Whatever power he displays in order to tame those sentient beings who are arrogant, angry, proud, conceited, and haughty, that very power he demonstrates.🔽Or the power of Śakra.

original: yang na tshangs pa'i stobs sam /🔽yang na 'jig rten skyong ba'i stobs sam /
analyzed: yang na tshangs pa'i stobs sam / yang na 'jig rten skyong ba'i stobs sam /
