translated: Or the power of Brahmā.🔽Or the power of the world guardians.

original: yang na 'khor los bsgyur ba'i stobs sam /
analyzed: yang na 'khor los bsgyur ba'i stobs sam /
translated: Or the power of a universal monarch.

original: yang na tshan po che'i stobs sam /
analyzed: yang na tshan po che'i stobs sam /
translated: Or the power of a great being.

original: yang na sred med kyi bu'i stobs kyi bzhi cha'am /🔽yang na sred med kyi bu'i stobs kyi phyed dam /
analyzed: yang na sred med kyi bu'i stobs kyi bzhi cha'am / yang na sred med kyi bu'i stobs kyi phyed dam /
translated: Or a quarter of the power of Nārāyaṇa.🔽Or half the power of Nārāyaṇa.

original: yang na sred med kyi bu'i stobs kyang rung ste /
analyzed: yang na sred med kyi bu'i stobs kyang rung ste /
translated: Or the power of Nārāyaṇa.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i stobs gang dang ldan pas sor mo gsum gyis ri'i rgyal bo ri rab bteg ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i stobs gang dang ldan pas sor mo gsum gyis ri'i rgyal bo ri rab bteg ste /
translated: Whatever power a bodhisattva possesses, with that power he raises the king of mountains, Mount Sumeru, with three fingers.

original: 'phang du dpag tshad 'bum drug khri bzhi stong tsam la rgyar dpag tshad brgyad khri bzhi stong du 'phags pa'ang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'phang du dpag tshad 'bum drug khri bzhi stong tsam la rgyar dpag tshad brgyad khri bzhi stong du 'phags pa'ang 'di lta ste /
translated: In height it is about 1,640,000 yojanas and in width it is about 840,000 yojanas.

original: dper na / skyu ru ra'i @220a *//
analyzed: dper na / skyu ru ra'i @220a *//
translated: It is like a single myrobalan fruit.

original: 'bras bu gcig bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan du 'phangs kyang byang chub sems dpa' de'i stobs la nyams pa med do //
analyzed: 'bras bu gcig bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan du 'phangs kyang byang chub sems dpa' de'i stobs la nyams pa med do //
translated: Even if it were thrown to another world system, the bodhisattva would not lose his strength.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di ltar rgya che ba /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di ltar rgya che ba /
translated: This trichiliocosm is so vast

original: 'di ltar yangs pa chu'i khams nas bzung ste /🔽steng du 'og min gyi bar la thug pa 'di lag mthil gyi steng du bzhag ste bskal pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar yangs pa chu'i khams nas bzung ste / steng du 'og min gyi bar la thug pa 'di lag mthil gyi steng du bzhag ste bskal pa'am /
translated: and so wide that it extends from the water element🔽up to the Akaniṣṭha heaven above.🔽He places it on the palm of his hand and remains there for an eon

original: bskal pa las lhag par 'dug la /
analyzed: bskal pa las lhag par 'dug la /
translated: or more than an eon.

original: spyod lam thams cad kyang ston te /
analyzed: spyod lam thams cad kyang ston te /
translated: He displays all his activities.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de lta bu'i stobs dang / sems can stobs snyems shing khro ba dang; nga rgyal dang / rgyags pa dang / dregs pa'i shas che ba rnams la stobs snyems pa dang / khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / dregs pa gdul ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de lta bu'i stobs dang / sems can stobs snyems shing khro ba dang; nga rgyal dang / rgyags pa dang / dregs pa'i shas che ba rnams la stobs snyems pa dang / khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / dregs pa gdul ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: “Bodhisattvas teach the Dharma to beings who are arrogant, angry, proud, conceited, and haughty, in order to subdue their arrogance, anger, pride, conceit, and haughtiness.

original: de rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa de dag gis byin gyi rlabs kyis ye shes 'thob bo //
analyzed: de rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa de dag gis byin gyi rlabs kyis ye shes 'thob bo //
translated: “By means of those bases of supernatural powers, they attain the knowledge of consecration.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis ye shes de dag gang dang / gang la byin gyis brlabs pa de de kho na bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis ye shes de dag gang dang / gang la byin gyis brlabs pa de de kho na bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: “By means of the knowledge of consecration of the bodhisattvas, whatever they consecrate becomes just that.

original: des gal te rgya mtsho chen po la ba lang gi rjes tsam du gyur cig ces pa lang gi rjes su byin gyis brlabs na ba lang gi rjes tsam du 'dug go /
analyzed: des gal te rgya mtsho chen po la ba lang gi rjes tsam du gyur cig ces pa lang gi rjes su byin gyis brlabs na ba lang gi rjes tsam du 'dug go /
translated: If they consecrate the great ocean as being the size of a cow’s footprint, it becomes the size of a cow’s footprint.

original: ba lang gi rjes kyang rgya mtsho chen por gyur cig ces byin gyis brlabs na rgya mtsho chen po nyid du 'dug go /
analyzed: ba lang gi rjes kyang rgya mtsho chen por gyur cig ces byin gyis brlabs na rgya mtsho chen po nyid du 'dug go /
translated: If he blesses the footprint of an ox to become the great ocean, it becomes the great ocean.🔽If he blesses the conflagration of the eon to become a mass of water, it becomes a mass of water.

original: gal te sreg pa'i bskal pa chu'i phung por gyur cig ces byin gyis brlabs na de chu'i phung po nyid du 'dug @220b go ;chu'i phung po'ang me'i phung por gyur cig ces byin gyis brlabs na me'i phung po nyid du 'dug go /
analyzed: gal te sreg pa'i bskal pa chu'i phung por gyur cig ces byin gyis brlabs na de chu'i phung po nyid du 'dug @220b go ;chu'i phung po'ang me'i phung por gyur cig ces byin gyis brlabs na me'i phung po nyid du 'dug go /
translated: If he blesses a mass of water to become a mass of fire, it becomes a mass of fire.

original: me'i phung po'ang rlung gi phung por gyur cig ces byin gyis brlabs na de rlung gi phung po nyid du 'dug go /
analyzed: me'i phung po'ang rlung gi phung por gyur cig ces byin gyis brlabs na de rlung gi phung po nyid du 'dug go /
translated: If he blesses a mass of fire to become a mass of wind, it becomes a mass of wind.

original: rlung gi phung po'ang me'i phung por gyur cig ces byin gyis brlabs na de me'i phung po nyid du 'dug go /
analyzed: rlung gi phung po'ang me'i phung por gyur cig ces byin gyis brlabs na de me'i phung po nyid du 'dug go /
translated: If he blesses a mass of wind to become a mass of fire, it becomes a mass of fire.

original: me'i phung po'ang sa'i phung por gyur cig ces byin gyis brlabs na de sa'i phung po nyid du 'dug go /
analyzed: me'i phung po'ang sa'i phung por gyur cig ces byin gyis brlabs na de sa'i phung po nyid du 'dug go /
translated: If he blesses a mass of fire to become a mass of earth, it becomes a mass of earth.

original: sa'i phung po'ang me'i phung por gyur cig ces byin gyis brlabs na de me'i phung po nyid du 'dug go /
analyzed: sa'i phung po'ang me'i phung por gyur cig ces byin gyis brlabs na de me'i phung po nyid du 'dug go /
translated: If he blesses a mass of earth, saying, ‘May this become a mass of fire,’ it becomes a mass of fire.

original: de bzhin du tha ma dang / 'bring dang / rab kyi chos gang dang / gang byin gyi rlabs kyis byin du brlabs pa de dag de kho na bzhin du 'dug go /
analyzed: de bzhin du tha ma dang / 'bring dang / rab kyi chos gang dang / gang byin gyi rlabs kyis byin du brlabs pa de dag de kho na bzhin du 'dug go /
translated: In the same way, whatever Dharma he blesses, whether inferior, middling, or superior, it remains just as it is.

original: de'i byin gyi rlabs de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ma gtogs par brgya byin nam /
analyzed: de'i byin gyi rlabs de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ma gtogs par brgya byin nam /
translated: No one can disturb that blessing, not even Śakra, Brahmā, Māra,

original: tshangs pa'am / bdud dam /
analyzed: tshangs pa'am / bdud dam /
translated: or anyone else in the world,

original: bdud kyi ris kyi lha'am /🔽sus kyang rung ste /
analyzed: bdud kyi ris kyi lha'am / sus kyang rung ste /
translated: not even the gods of the pure realms.

original: 'jig rten du chos dang mthun pas sus kyang bskyod pa'am /
analyzed: 'jig rten du chos dang mthun pas sus kyang bskyod pa'am /
translated: No one in the world can disturb it,

original: bsgul ba'am / mi snang bar byed mi nus te /🔽sems can gyi ris na gang byang chub sems dpa'i byin gyi rlabs de la bskyod pa'am /
analyzed: bsgul ba'am / mi snang bar byed mi nus te / sems can gyi ris na gang byang chub sems dpa'i byin gyi rlabs de la bskyod pa'am /
translated: shake it, or make it disappear.🔽There is no one in the world of sentient beings who can disturb,

original: bsgul ba'am / mi snang bar byed nus pa'i sems can de gang yang med do //
analyzed: bsgul ba'am / mi snang bar byed nus pa'i sems can de gang yang med do //
translated: shake, or make it disappear.

original: de byang chub sems dpa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis ye shes kyi stobs bskyed pa des brjod pa sna tshogs dang / dga' ba dang / mgu ba lhur len pa'i sems can rnams la sgra ji lta ba bzhin du 'dug pas chos ston to //🔽de'i rdzu 'phrul gyi @221a *//
analyzed: de byang chub sems dpa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis ye shes kyi stobs bskyed pa des brjod pa sna tshogs dang / dga' ba dang / mgu ba lhur len pa'i sems can rnams la sgra ji lta ba bzhin du 'dug pas chos ston to // de'i rdzu 'phrul gyi @221a *//
translated: By the power of the knowledge of the bodhisattvas’ blessing, he teaches the Dharma to beings who are intent on various expressions, joys, and delights, in a way that accords with their language.

original: rkang pa de dag kyang mngon par 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: rkang pa de dag kyang mngon par 'phags pa'o //
translated: His bases of miraculous power are exalted.

original: rang gi kha na las pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi kha na las pa'o //
translated: They are his own.

original: 'dud dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi yul las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'dud dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi yul las 'das pa'o //
translated: They are beyond the domain of all afflictions.

original: sangs rgyas kyi yul la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yul la 'jug pa'o //
translated: They are the domain of the buddhas.

original: sems can thams cad la mi gnod par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la mi gnod par sbyor ba'o //
translated: They are applied without harming any being.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / tshogs bsags pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / tshogs bsags pa'o //
translated: They are the accumulation of roots of virtue.

original: bdud dang / bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams kyis mi 'phrogs ba ste /
analyzed: bdud dang / bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams kyis mi 'phrogs ba ste /
translated: They are not taken away by Māra or the devas of Māra’s retinue.

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa mi zad pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa mi zad pa ste /
translated: this is the bodhisattvas’ imperishable superknowledge that knows how to perform miracles.

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par shes pa lnga mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par shes pa lnga mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: these are called the bodhisattvas’ imperishable five superknowledges.

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi mi zad pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi mi zad pa ste /
translated: furthermore, the bodhisattvas’ imperishable four means of gathering are

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: what four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pa'o //
translated: generosity, kind talk, meaningful activity, and consistency.

original: de la sbyin pa ni gang zang zing sbyin pa dang / chos sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa ni gang zang zing sbyin pa dang / chos sbyin pa'o //
translated: Among them, generosity is the giving of material things and the giving of the Dharma.

original: snyan par smra ba ni gang slong ba dang / chos nyan pa rnams la tshig 'jam zhing snyan par smra ba'o //
analyzed: snyan par smra ba ni gang slong ba dang / chos nyan pa rnams la tshig 'jam zhing snyan par smra ba'o //
translated: Kind talk is speaking gentle and pleasant words to those who ask and to those who listen to the Dharma.

original: de la don spyod pa ni gang bdag dang / gzhan dag gi don bsam pa bzhin du yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o; ;de la don mthun pa ni gang theg pa gang la bdag yon tan du 'du shes pa'i theg pa de nyid la chos dang /🔽zang zing len pa rnams rab tu 'god pa'o //
analyzed: de la don spyod pa ni gang bdag dang / gzhan dag gi don bsam pa bzhin du yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o; ;de la don mthun pa ni gang theg pa gang la bdag yon tan du 'du shes pa'i theg pa de nyid la chos dang / zang zing len pa rnams rab tu 'god pa'o //
translated: “Among them, having a common goal is the establishment of those who are recipients of the Dharma and material gifts in the very same vehicle in which one has recognized the qualities.

original: gzhan yang / sbyin pa ni @221b gang slong ba rnams la yid mgu bar sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang / sbyin pa ni @221b gang slong ba rnams la yid mgu bar sbyin pa'o //
translated: “Moreover, generosity is the delighting of those who ask.

original: de la snyan par smra ba ni gang slong ba rnams la mi smod pa'o //🔽de la don spyod pa ni gang slong ba rnams kyi don yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la snyan par smra ba ni gang slong ba rnams la mi smod pa'o // de la don spyod pa ni gang slong ba rnams kyi don yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: “Among them, pleasant speech is the non-reproach of those who ask.🔽“Among them, helpful activity is the complete fulfillment of the goals of those who ask.

original: de la don mthun pa ni gang theg pa de nyid la yang dag par 'dzud pa'o //
analyzed: de la don mthun pa ni gang theg pa de nyid la yang dag par 'dzud pa'o //
translated: “Among them, having a common goal is the establishment of those very same vehicles.

original: gzhan yang / sbyin pa ni gang bsam pa thag pa nas gtong ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang / sbyin pa ni gang bsam pa thag pa nas gtong ba'o //
translated: “Moreover, generosity is the giving from the very depths of one’s heart.

original: snyan par smra ba ni gang sbyor ba yongs su chad pa med pa'o //
analyzed: snyan par smra ba ni gang sbyor ba yongs su chad pa med pa'o //
translated: “Pleasant speech is the uninterrupted application.

original: don sbyod pa ni gang lhag pa'i bsam pas byin te 'gyod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: don sbyod pa ni gang lhag pa'i bsam pas byin te 'gyod pa med pa'o //
translated: The practice of generosity is the giving of gifts with a higher motivation, without regret.

original: don mthun pa ni gang theg pa chen po la yongs su bsngo ba'o //
analyzed: don mthun pa ni gang theg pa chen po la yongs su bsngo ba'o //
translated: The practice of reconciliation is the dedication of the Great Vehicle.

original: gzhan yang / sbyin pa ni gang byams pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i sems kyis yongs su gtong ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang / sbyin pa ni gang byams pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i sems kyis yongs su gtong ba'o //
translated: Furthermore, generosity is the giving of gifts with a mind that is filled with love.

original: snyan par smra ba ni gang dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' bar gyur pa'i sems mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: snyan par smra ba ni gang dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' bar gyur pa'i sems mi gtong ba'o //
translated: Reconciliation is the non-abandonment of a mind that is filled with joy and supreme joy.

original: don spyod pa ni gang snying rje chen po yongs su dag pa'i sems bskyed pas sems can thams cad kyi bya ba ci yod pa dag la brtson pa'o //
analyzed: don spyod pa ni gang snying rje chen po yongs su dag pa'i sems bskyed pas sems can thams cad kyi bya ba ci yod pa dag la brtson pa'o //
translated: The practice of generosity is the application of all the activities of sentient beings with a mind that is filled with great compassion.

original: don mthun pa ni gang btang snyoms dang ldan pa'i sems mtho dma' med cing thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la yongs su bsngo ba'i sems so //
analyzed: don mthun pa ni gang btang snyoms dang ldan pa'i sems mtho dma' med cing thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la yongs su bsngo ba'i sems so //
translated: The practice of reconciliation is the mind that is free from the faults of pride and arrogance, and the mind that is dedicated to omniscient wisdom.

original: gzhan yang / sbyin pa ni gang chos bzhin btsal ba'i longs spyod rnams yongs su gtong ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang / sbyin pa ni gang chos bzhin btsal ba'i longs spyod rnams yongs su gtong ba'o //
translated: Furthermore, generosity is the giving of enjoyments that are sought in accordance with the Dharma.

original: snyan par smra ba ni gang dag la sbyin pa byin pa de dag chos la rab tu 'dzud pa'o //
analyzed: snyan par smra ba ni gang dag la sbyin pa byin pa de dag chos la rab tu 'dzud pa'o //
translated: Pleasant speech is to introduce those to whom one has given gifts to the Dharma.

original: don spyod pa ni gang bdag gi don dang / gzhan gyi don yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //🔽don mthun pa ni gang sems can thams cad kyi don @222a *//
analyzed: don spyod pa ni gang bdag gi don dang / gzhan gyi don yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o // don mthun pa ni gang sems can thams cad kyi don @222a *//
translated: Helpful activity is to bring to completion one's own and others' aims.

original: gyi phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: gyi phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: Consistency is to generate the mind of awakening for the sake of all sentient beings.

original: gzhan yang / sbyin pa ni gang nang dang / phyi'i dngos po rnams yongs su gtong ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang / sbyin pa ni gang nang dang / phyi'i dngos po rnams yongs su gtong ba'o //
translated: Moreover, giving is to give away inner and outer things.

original: snyan par smra ba ni gang chos thams cad kyi yon tan shes pa la slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud med pa'o //
analyzed: snyan par smra ba ni gang chos thams cad kyi yon tan shes pa la slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud med pa'o //
translated: Pleasant speech is to teach the qualities of all Dharmas without the stinginess of a teacher.

original: don spyod pa ni gang bdag gi don btang ste gzhan gyi don byed pa'o //
analyzed: don spyod pa ni gang bdag gi don btang ste gzhan gyi don byed pa'o //
translated: Helpful activity is to give up one's own aims and work for the aims of others.

original: don mthun pa ni gang longs spyod bsdus te lag tu thob pa'ang gzhan dag la byin nas mi dga' ba med pa'o //
analyzed: don mthun pa ni gang longs spyod bsdus te lag tu thob pa'ang gzhan dag la byin nas mi dga' ba med pa'o //
translated: Consistency is to give to others even the things one has received with one's own hands, without being unhappy.

original: de la chos sbyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos sbyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the giving of Dharma?

original: gang ji skad thos pa'i chos rnams ston pa'o //
analyzed: gang ji skad thos pa'i chos rnams ston pa'o //
translated: It is the teaching of the Dharma as one has heard it.

original: snyan par smra ba ni gang zang zing med pa'i sems kyis chos yang dag par rab tu ston pa'o //
analyzed: snyan par smra ba ni gang zang zing med pa'i sems kyis chos yang dag par rab tu ston pa'o //
translated: Pleasant speech is the teaching of the Dharma with a mind free of material desires.

original: don spyod pa ni gang gzhan dag la lung 'bogs pa dang / kha ton byed du 'jug pa la mi skyo ba'o //
analyzed: don spyod pa ni gang gzhan dag la lung 'bogs pa dang / kha ton byed du 'jug pa la mi skyo ba'o //
translated: Fulfilling aims is the non-discouragement of others in their recitation and study.

original: don mthun pa ni gang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems dang ma bral bas chos rnyed pa dang / gzhan dag kyang rab tu 'dzud pa'o //
analyzed: don mthun pa ni gang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems dang ma bral bas chos rnyed pa dang / gzhan dag kyang rab tu 'dzud pa'o //
translated: Consistency is the acquisition of the Dharma and the introduction of others to it without ever losing the mind of omniscience.

original: gzhan yang / chos kyi sbyin pa ni gang chos nyan pa 'ongs shing lhags pa rnams la mi skyo zhing mi g-yeng bar chos ston pa'o //🔽snyan par smra ba ni gang ji srid du rgyang ring por yang song ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang / chos kyi sbyin pa ni gang chos nyan pa 'ongs shing lhags pa rnams la mi skyo zhing mi g-yeng bar chos ston pa'o // snyan par smra ba ni gang ji srid du rgyang ring por yang song ste /
translated: Moreover, the gift of the Dharma is the teaching of the Dharma to those who have come to listen, without weariness and without distraction.

original: dam pa'i chos yang dag par ston pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos yang dag par ston pa'o //
translated: Pleasant speech is the teaching of the holy Dharma even at a distance.

original: don spyod pa ni gang chos 'dod pa'i gang zag rnams lhung bzed 'chang ngam /
analyzed: don spyod pa ni gang chos 'dod pa'i gang zag rnams lhung bzed 'chang ngam /
translated: Fulfilling aims is the non-abandonment of those persons who desire the Dharma, even if they should carry off one's alms bowl.

original: gos dang / zas dang / mal stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / yo byad med dam /🔽gzhan yang / de dag la gang dang / @222b gang gis brel ba de dag thams cad phyin te /
analyzed: gos dang / zas dang / mal stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / yo byad med dam / gzhan yang / de dag la gang dang / @222b gang gis brel ba de dag thams cad phyin te /
translated: or if they lack clothing, food, bedding, medicine for the sick, or necessary utensils,🔽or if they are busy with other things,

original: lhag pa'i bsam par song ba'i sems kyi rgyud kyis chos ston pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam par song ba'i sems kyi rgyud kyis chos ston pa'o //
translated: then he or she should go to them and teach the Dharma with a mind that is full of thoughts of loving-kindness.

original: don mthun pa ni gang chos kyi sbyin pa byin te /🔽bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par 'dzud cing yongs su bsngo ba'o //
analyzed: don mthun pa ni gang chos kyi sbyin pa byin te / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par 'dzud cing yongs su bsngo ba'o //
translated: “Generosity that is consistent with the Dharma” is the generosity of the Dharma,🔽and it is also the dedication of the roots of virtue to great compassion.🔽“Generosity that is consistent with the Dharma” is the generosity of the Dharma,

original: gzhan yang / chos kyi sbyin pa ni gang sbyin pa thams cad kyi mchog ni chos kyi sbyin pa yin par rig nas chos kyi sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang / chos kyi sbyin pa ni gang sbyin pa thams cad kyi mchog ni chos kyi sbyin pa yin par rig nas chos kyi sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba'o //
translated: and it is also the dedication of the roots of virtue to great compassion.

original: snyan par smra ba ni gang phan pa'i dngos po'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: snyan par smra ba ni gang phan pa'i dngos po'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: “Speaking pleasantly” is teaching the Dharma in order to benefit others.

original: don spyod pa ni gang don la rton pa'i chos ston gyi yi ge la rton pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don spyod pa ni gang don la rton pa'i chos ston gyi yi ge la rton pa ni ma yin no //
translated: “Acting for the benefit” is teaching the Dharma that is based on the meaning, not on the mere words.

original: don mthun pa ni gang sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir chos ston pa'o //
analyzed: don mthun pa ni gang sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir chos ston pa'o //
translated: Consistency of purpose is the teaching of the Dharma in order to perfect all the qualities of a Buddha.

original: gzhan yang / chos sbyin pa ni gang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang / chos sbyin pa ni gang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the gift of the Dharma is the perfection of generosity.

original: snyan par smra ba ni gang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: snyan par smra ba ni gang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Pleasant speech is the perfection of morality and the perfection of patience.

original: don spyod pa ni gang brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: don spyod pa ni gang brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Consistency of purpose is the perfection of vigor.

original: don mthun pa ni gang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: don mthun pa ni gang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Consistency of purpose is the perfection of meditation and the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzhan yang / chos sbyin pa ni dang po sems bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang / chos sbyin pa ni dang po sems bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rnams kyi'o //
translated: Moreover, the gift of the Dharma is for the bodhisattvas who have first aroused the thought of enlightenment.

original: snyan par smra ba ni spyod pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: snyan par smra ba ni spyod pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi'o //
translated: Pleasant speech is for the bodhisattvas who have entered on the way.

original: don spyod pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: don spyod pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi'o //
translated: Consistency of purpose is for the bodhisattvas who have reached the irreversible stage.

original: don mthun pa ni skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: don mthun pa ni skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi'o //
translated: The fourth is that of the bodhisattvas who are in their last life.

original: gzhan yang chos @223a *//
analyzed: gzhan yang chos @223a *//
translated: Moreover,

original: spyin pa ni byang chub kyi rtsa ba dang / sa bon gyi gzhi'o //
analyzed: spyin pa ni byang chub kyi rtsa ba dang / sa bon gyi gzhi'o //
translated: giving the Dharma is the root and seed of enlightenment.

original: snyan par smra ba ni byang chub kyi myu gu dang / 'dab ma yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: snyan par smra ba ni byang chub kyi myu gu dang / 'dab ma yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Pleasant speech is the complete leaves and shoots of enlightenment.

original: don spyod pa ni byang chub kyi me tog yongs su rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: don spyod pa ni byang chub kyi me tog yongs su rgyas pa'o //
translated: Working at the aims is the fully opened flowers of enlightenment.

original: don mthun pa ni byang chub kyi 'bras bu mngon par 'grub pa ste /
analyzed: don mthun pa ni byang chub kyi 'bras bu mngon par 'grub pa ste /
translated: Having a common aim is the full ripening of the fruit of enlightenment.

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi mi zad pa'o //
translated: these are the four ways of gathering a following that are inexhaustible for bodhisattvas.

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi mi zad pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi mi zad pa ste /
translated: moreover, the four detailed and thorough knowledges of the bodhisattvas are inexhaustible.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: gang 'di don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'di don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: It is the discernment of meaning, the discernment of phenomena, the discernment of definitions, and the discernment of eloquence.

original: de la don so so yang dag par rig pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la don so so yang dag par rig pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the discernment of meaning?

original: gang chos thams cad la don dam par shes pa ste /🔽chos shes pa dang / so sor rtog pa shes pa dang / rjes su 'gro ba shes pa dang / rgyu shes pa dang / rkyen shes pa dang / gnyis su med par shes pa dang / tshogs pa shes pa dang / tha mar mi 'gro ba shes pa dang /
analyzed: gang chos thams cad la don dam par shes pa ste / chos shes pa dang / so sor rtog pa shes pa dang / rjes su 'gro ba shes pa dang / rgyu shes pa dang / rkyen shes pa dang / gnyis su med par shes pa dang / tshogs pa shes pa dang / tha mar mi 'gro ba shes pa dang /
translated: It is the knowledge of the ultimate meaning of all phenomena.🔽It is the knowledge of phenomena, the knowledge of discernment, the knowledge of following, the knowledge of causes, the knowledge of conditions, the knowledge of nonduality, the knowledge of the collection, the knowledge of not going to an end,

original: bar na mi 'dug pa shes pa dang / rkyen la 'jug pa shes pa dang / de chos kyi dbyings dbyer med pa shes pa dang / de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su 'jug pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: bar na mi 'dug pa shes pa dang / rkyen la 'jug pa shes pa dang / de chos kyi dbyings dbyer med pa shes pa dang / de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su 'jug pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas pa shes pa dang /
translated: the knowledge of not remaining in the middle, the knowledge of engaging with conditions, the knowledge of the indivisibility of the realm of phenomena, following suchness, and the knowledge of abiding in the limit of reality.

original: stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i shes pa dang / @223b mtshan ma med pa la spyod pa shes pa dang / smon pa med pa la smon lam med par shes pa dang / mngon par 'du mi byed pa la mngon par 'du byed pa med par shes pa dang /🔽tshul gcig la 'jug pa shes pa dang / bdag med par rtogs pa'i shes pa dang / sems can med par rtogs pa'i shes pa dang / srog med par shin tu rtogs pa'i shes pa dang / gang zag med pa don dam par shes pa dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i shes pa dang / @223b mtshan ma med pa la spyod pa shes pa dang / smon pa med pa la smon lam med par shes pa dang / mngon par 'du mi byed pa la mngon par 'du byed pa med par shes pa dang / tshul gcig la 'jug pa shes pa dang / bdag med par rtogs pa'i shes pa dang / sems can med par rtogs pa'i shes pa dang / srog med par shin tu rtogs pa'i shes pa dang / gang zag med pa don dam par shes pa dang /
translated: It is to know the mind that realizes emptiness. It is to know the mind that engages with signlessness. It is to know the mind that is free of aspirations with regard to wishlessness. It is to know the mind that is free of formation with regard to the absence of formation.🔽It is to know the mind that engages with a single principle. It is to know the mind that realizes selflessness. It is to know the mind that realizes the absence of sentient beings. It is to know the mind that fully realizes the absence of life force. It is to know the mind that realizes the absence of person ultimately.

original: 'das pa'i dus la ma chags pa'i shes pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus la thug pa med pa'i shes pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus na thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med par shes pa dang / phung po rnams la sgyu mar shes pa dang /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus la ma chags pa'i shes pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus la thug pa med pa'i shes pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus na thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med par shes pa dang / phung po rnams la sgyu mar shes pa dang /
translated: It is to know the mind that is unattached to the past. It is to know the mind that is unimpeded with regard to the future. It is to know the mind that is never unwholesome with regard to the present. It is to know the mind that perceives the aggregates as illusions.

original: khams rnams la sprul gdug pa lta bur rtogs pa'i shes pa dang / skye mched rnams la grong stong pa lta bur nges par sems pa'i shes pa dang / nang nye bar zhi bar shes pa dang / phyi rol tu rgyu ba med par shes pa dang /🔽yul rnams la sgyu ma dang / bye brag med par shes pa dang / dran pa la gnas pa'i shes pa dang; bzod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba shes pa dang / blo gros kyis so sor rtog pa'i shes pa dang / bdag la rtog pa'i shes pa dang /
analyzed: khams rnams la sprul gdug pa lta bur rtogs pa'i shes pa dang / skye mched rnams la grong stong pa lta bur nges par sems pa'i shes pa dang / nang nye bar zhi bar shes pa dang / phyi rol tu rgyu ba med par shes pa dang / yul rnams la sgyu ma dang / bye brag med par shes pa dang / dran pa la gnas pa'i shes pa dang; bzod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba shes pa dang / blo gros kyis so sor rtog pa'i shes pa dang / bdag la rtog pa'i shes pa dang /
translated: the knowledge that perceives the elements to be like poisonous snakes, the knowledge that perceives the sense sources to be like an empty town, the knowledge that perceives inner peace, the knowledge that perceives outer non-movement,🔽the knowledge that perceives objects to be like illusions, the knowledge that perceives without distinction, the knowledge that abides in mindfulness, the knowledge that follows patience, the knowledge that individually discerns with intelligence, the knowledge that conceives of self,

original: bden pa rnams la rab tu rtog par shes pa dang / sdug bsngal la mi 'byung bar shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba la mngon par 'du mi byed par shes pa dang / 'gog pa la mtshan nyid med par shes pa dang / lam la sgrol bar shes pa dang /
analyzed: bden pa rnams la rab tu rtog par shes pa dang / sdug bsngal la mi 'byung bar shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba la mngon par 'du mi byed par shes pa dang / 'gog pa la mtshan nyid med par shes pa dang / lam la sgrol bar shes pa dang /
translated: the knowledge that perceives the truths, the knowledge that perceives the non-arising of suffering, the knowledge that perceives the non-conditioning of the origin, the knowledge that perceives the signlessness of cessation, the knowledge that perceives the liberation of the path,

original: chos @224a *// rnams la tshig rab tu dbye ba shes pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la dran pa med pa dang / yid la bya ba med pa shes pa dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams la dge ba dang /
analyzed: chos @224a *// rnams la tshig rab tu dbye ba shes pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la dran pa med pa dang / yid la bya ba med pa shes pa dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams la dge ba dang /
translated: It is to know the divisions of words in the Dharma. It is to know the absence of mindfulness and mental activity in the applications of mindfulness. It is to know the engagement with both virtue and nonvirtue in the authentic abandonments.

original: mi dge ba gnyis su 'jug pa'i shes pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams la lus dang / sems yang bar shes pa dang / dbang po rnams la 'jug par shes pa dang / stobs rnams la mi rdzi bar shes pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams la chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par shes pa dang /
analyzed: mi dge ba gnyis su 'jug pa'i shes pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams la lus dang / sems yang bar shes pa dang / dbang po rnams la 'jug par shes pa dang / stobs rnams la mi rdzi bar shes pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams la chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par shes pa dang /
translated: It is to know the lightness of body and mind in the bases of miraculous power. It is to know engagement in the faculties. It is to know invincibility in the powers. It is to know the realization of all phenomena just as they are in the branches of awakening.

original: lam la 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba med par shes pa dang / zhi gnas la gnas par shes pa dang / lhag mthong la snang bar shes pa dang / sgyu ma la rnam par bsgrubs par 'du shes pa dang / smig rgyu la nor bar 'du shes pa dang /
analyzed: lam la 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba med par shes pa dang / zhi gnas la gnas par shes pa dang / lhag mthong la snang bar shes pa dang / sgyu ma la rnam par bsgrubs par 'du shes pa dang / smig rgyu la nor bar 'du shes pa dang /
translated: mirages as mistaken,🔽dreams as not really seen,🔽echoes as observed conditions,🔽optical illusions as unmoving,

original: rmi lam la yang dag pa ma yin par mthong bar shes pa dang / brag ca la rkyen du dmigs pa'i shes pa dang / mig yor la mi g-yo bar shes pa dang / mtshan nyid tha dad pa rnams la mtshan nyid gcig tu shes pa dang /
analyzed: rmi lam la yang dag pa ma yin par mthong bar shes pa dang / brag ca la rkyen du dmigs pa'i shes pa dang / mig yor la mi g-yo bar shes pa dang / mtshan nyid tha dad pa rnams la mtshan nyid gcig tu shes pa dang /
translated: different characteristics as one,🔽assemblies as separation,🔽connections as unconnected,🔽the Śrāvakayāna as engaging through following the words of others,

original: 'du ba rnams la 'bral bar shes pa dang / mtshams sbyor ba rnams la mtshams sbyor ba med par shes pa dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa la gzhan gyi sgra'i rjes su 'gro bas 'jug par shes pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la rten pa 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: 'du ba rnams la 'bral bar shes pa dang / mtshams sbyor ba rnams la mtshams sbyor ba med par shes pa dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa la gzhan gyi sgra'i rjes su 'gro bas 'jug par shes pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la rten pa 'jug pa dang /
translated: the Pratyekabuddhayāna as engaging in dependence,

original: rab tu dben zhing rtse gcig @224b bar shes pa dang / theg pa chen po la dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / tshogs sbel bar shes pa 'di ni don so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu dben zhing rtse gcig @224b bar shes pa dang / theg pa chen po la dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / tshogs sbel bar shes pa 'di ni don so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the single-pointed concentration of complete isolation, and the knowledge of the accumulation of the roots of virtue of the Great Vehicle—this is called the correct understanding of the meaning.

original: gzhan yang / don so so yang dag par rig pa ni don so so yang dag par rig pa gang gis chos thams cad la don rton pas rton pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang / don so so yang dag par rig pa ni don so so yang dag par rig pa gang gis chos thams cad la don rton pas rton pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the correct understanding of the meaning is the correct understanding of the meaning by which one relies on the meaning in all phenomena.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad ni ma lus par stong pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni ma lus par stong pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are completely empty.

original: gang stong pa'i don de ni don no //
analyzed: gang stong pa'i don de ni don no //
translated: The meaning of emptiness is the meaning.

original: chos thams cad ni ma lus par mtshan ma med pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni ma lus par mtshan ma med pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are completely signless.

original: gang mtshan ma med pa'i don de ni don no //
analyzed: gang mtshan ma med pa'i don de ni don no //
translated: The meaning of signlessness is the meaning.

original: chos thams cad ni ma lus par smon pa med pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni ma lus par smon pa med pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are completely wishless.

original: gang smon pa med pa'i don de ni don no //
analyzed: gang smon pa med pa'i don de ni don no //
translated: The meaning of wishlessness is the meaning.

original: chos thams cad ni ma lus par mngon par 'du mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni ma lus par mngon par 'du mi byed pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are completely unconditioned.

original: gang mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i don de ni don no //
analyzed: gang mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i don de ni don no //
translated: The meaning of unconditionedness is the meaning.

original: chos thams cad ni ma lus par mi skye ba ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni ma lus par mi skye ba ste /
translated: All phenomena are ultimately unborn.

original: gang ma lus par mi skye ba'i don de ni don no //
analyzed: gang ma lus par mi skye ba'i don de ni don no //
translated: The meaning of that which is ultimately unborn is the meaning.

original: chos thams cad ni ma lus par ma byung ba ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni ma lus par ma byung ba ste /
translated: All phenomena are ultimately non-arisen.

original: gang ma lus par ma byung ba'i don de ni don no //
analyzed: gang ma lus par ma byung ba'i don de ni don no //
translated: The meaning of that which is ultimately non-arisen is the meaning.

original: chos thams cad ni ma lus par dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni ma lus par dngos po med pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are ultimately unreal.

original: gang ma lus par dngos po med pa'i don de ni don no //
analyzed: gang ma lus par dngos po med pa'i don de ni don no //
translated: The meaning of that which is ultimately unreal is the meaning.

original: chos thams cad ni ma lus par dben pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni ma lus par dben pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are ultimately void.

original: gang ma lus par dben pa'i don de ni don no //
analyzed: gang ma lus par dben pa'i don de ni don no //
translated: The meaning of that which is ultimately void is the meaning.

original: chos thams cad ni ma lus par bdag med pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni ma lus par bdag med pa /
translated: All phenomena are ultimately selfless,

original: sems can med pa /
analyzed: sems can med pa /
translated: without sentient beings,

original: srog med pa /
analyzed: srog med pa /
translated: without life-force,

original: gang zag pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gang zag pa med pa ste /
translated: and without individuals.

original: gang bdag med pa dang / sems can med pa dang / srog med pa dang / gang zag med pa'i don de ni don te /
analyzed: gang bdag med pa dang / sems can med pa dang / srog med pa dang / gang zag med pa'i don de ni don te /
translated: The meaning of that which is selfless, without sentient beings, without life-force, and without individuals is the meaning.

original: gang 'di lta bu'i @225a *//
analyzed: gang 'di lta bu'i @225a *//
translated: That realization of such phenomena

original: chos rnams rtogs pa de ni don so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos rnams rtogs pa de ni don so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: is called the correct understanding of the meaning.

original: gang 'dir bstan pa ni thogs pa med par bstan pa /
analyzed: gang 'dir bstan pa ni thogs pa med par bstan pa /
translated: The teaching here is the teaching of the absence of obstruction,

original: chags pa med par bstan pa /
analyzed: chags pa med par bstan pa /
translated: the teaching of the absence of attachment,

original: mi zad par bstan pa /
analyzed: mi zad par bstan pa /
translated: the teaching of the absence of exhaustion,

original: chos thams cad thob par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad thob par bstan pa ste /
translated: and the teaching of the attainment of all dharmas.

original: don bstan pa de ni so so yang dag par rig pa yin no //
analyzed: don bstan pa de ni so so yang dag par rig pa yin no //
translated: This teaching of the meaning is the correct understanding of the meaning.

original: don so so yang dag par rig pa de ni don thams cad bstan pa la mi zad pa yin te /
analyzed: don so so yang dag par rig pa de ni don thams cad bstan pa la mi zad pa yin te /
translated: This correct understanding of the meaning is the absence of exhaustion in the teaching of all meanings.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis kyang yang dag par bka' stsal cing yang dag par rjes su thugs rang ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis kyang yang dag par bka' stsal cing yang dag par rjes su thugs rang ba'o //
translated: It is the correct teaching and the correct understanding of the Bhagavat Buddhas.

original: de yang dag pa dang / de kho na dang / ma log pa dang / gzhan ma yin pa ste shes rab dang / ye shes kyis rtogs pa thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med pa ste /
analyzed: de yang dag pa dang / de kho na dang / ma log pa dang / gzhan ma yin pa ste shes rab dang / ye shes kyis rtogs pa thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med pa ste /
translated: It is the real, the suchness, the non-erroneous, the non-other. It is the absence of all reproachable actions through the understanding and knowledge of wisdom.

original: 'di ni don so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni don so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the correct understanding of the meaning.

original: de la chos so so yang dag par rig pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos so so yang dag par rig pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the correct understanding of the Dharma?

original: gang chos thams cad la rjes su 'jug pa shes pa ste /
analyzed: gang chos thams cad la rjes su 'jug pa shes pa ste /
translated: It is the knowledge that penetrates all dharmas.

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang /🔽'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / bzang po dang / ngan pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i cha dang mthun pa dang / 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das par nye bar song ba rnams la chos kyi dbyings mnyam pa nyid du shes pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / bzang po dang / ngan pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i cha dang mthun pa dang / 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das par nye bar song ba rnams la chos kyi dbyings mnyam pa nyid du shes pa dang /
translated: virtue and nonvirtue, reprehensible and irreproachable, contaminated and uncontaminated, compounded and uncompounded,🔽mundane and supramundane, good and bad, associated with the afflictions and unassociated with the afflictions, and conducive to either saṃsāra or nirvāṇa.

original: byang chub @225b mnyam pa nyid du shes pa dang / khams mnyam pa nyid du shes pa 'di ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub @225b mnyam pa nyid du shes pa dang / khams mnyam pa nyid du shes pa 'di ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the sameness of the Dharma element, the knowledge of the sameness of awakening, and the knowledge of the sameness of the constituents is called the correct understanding of the Dharma.

original: gzhan yang / chos so so yang dag par rig pa ni gang 'dod chags spyod pa'i sems can rnams kyi sems la 'jug cing 'bab par shes pa dang / bcos ma'i 'dod chags spyod pa dang / bcos ma ma yin pa'i 'dod chags spyod pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang / chos so so yang dag par rig pa ni gang 'dod chags spyod pa'i sems can rnams kyi sems la 'jug cing 'bab par shes pa dang / bcos ma'i 'dod chags spyod pa dang / bcos ma ma yin pa'i 'dod chags spyod pa dang /
translated: Furthermore, the knowledge of the individual dhātus is the knowledge of the minds of sentient beings who engage in desire, the knowledge of the minds of sentient beings who engage in anger, the knowledge of the minds of sentient beings who engage in stupidity, and the knowledge of the minds of sentient beings who engage in desire, anger, and stupidity equally.🔽The knowledge of the individual dhātus is the knowledge of the minds of sentient beings who engage in desire, the knowledge of the minds of sentient beings who engage in anger, the knowledge of the minds of sentient beings who engage in stupidity, and the knowledge of the minds of sentient beings who engage in desire, anger, and stupidity equally.🔽The knowledge of the individual dhātus is the knowledge of the minds of sentient beings who engage in desire, the knowledge of the minds of sentient beings who engage in anger, the knowledge of the minds of sentient beings who engage in stupidity, and the knowledge of the minds of sentient beings who engage in desire, anger, and stupidity equally.

original: snrel zhi'i 'dod chags spyod pa dang / lta ba'i 'dod chags spyod pa dang / mi zad pa'i 'dod chags spyod pa dang / 'jam pa'i 'dod chags spyod pa dang / yang ba'i 'dod chags spyod pa dang / yang ba ma yin pa'i 'dod chags spyod pa dang /
analyzed: snrel zhi'i 'dod chags spyod pa dang / lta ba'i 'dod chags spyod pa dang / mi zad pa'i 'dod chags spyod pa dang / 'jam pa'i 'dod chags spyod pa dang / yang ba'i 'dod chags spyod pa dang / yang ba ma yin pa'i 'dod chags spyod pa dang /
translated: The knowledge of the individual dhātus is the knowledge of the minds of sentient beings who engage in desire, the knowledge of the minds of sentient beings who engage in anger, the knowledge of the minds of sentient beings who engage in stupidity, and the knowledge of the minds of sentient beings who engage in desire, anger, and stupidity equally.🔽The knowledge of the individual dhātus is the knowledge of the minds of sentient beings who engage in desire, the knowledge of the minds of sentient beings who engage in anger, the knowledge of the minds of sentient beings who engage in stupidity, and the knowledge of the minds of sentient beings who engage in desire, anger, and stupidity equally.🔽The knowledge of the individual dhātus is the knowledge of the minds of sentient beings who engage in desire, the knowledge of the minds of sentient beings who engage in anger, the knowledge of the minds of sentient beings who engage in stupidity, and the knowledge of the minds of sentient beings who engage in desire, anger, and stupidity equally.

original: kun rdzob kyi 'dod chags spyod pa dang / sbyor ba'i 'dod chags spyod pa dang / bsam pa'i 'dod chags spyod pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa'i 'dod chags spyod pa dang / mtshan nyid kyi 'dod chags spyod pa dang / mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i 'dod chags spyod pa dang /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi 'dod chags spyod pa dang / sbyor ba'i 'dod chags spyod pa dang / bsam pa'i 'dod chags spyod pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa'i 'dod chags spyod pa dang / mtshan nyid kyi 'dod chags spyod pa dang / mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i 'dod chags spyod pa dang /
translated: There are those who engage in desire through the relative, those who engage in desire through application, those who engage in desire through thought, those who engage in desire through superior thought, those who engage in desire through characteristics, those who engage in desire through incompatible characteristics,

original: rnam par gzhag pa'i 'dod chags spyod pa dang / rkyen gyi 'dod chags spyod pa dang / sngon gyi mtha'i rkyen gyi 'dod chags spyod pa dang / phyi ma'i mtha'i rkyen gyi 'dod chags spyod pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i rkyen gyi 'dod chags spyod pa rnams dang /🔽sems can nang du 'dod chags la phyi rol tu 'dod chags med pa dag kyang yod /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa'i 'dod chags spyod pa dang / rkyen gyi 'dod chags spyod pa dang / sngon gyi mtha'i rkyen gyi 'dod chags spyod pa dang / phyi ma'i mtha'i rkyen gyi 'dod chags spyod pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i rkyen gyi 'dod chags spyod pa rnams dang / sems can nang du 'dod chags la phyi rol tu 'dod chags med pa dag kyang yod /
translated: those who engage in desire through establishment, those who engage in desire through conditions, those who engage in desire through the conditions of the past, those who engage in desire through the conditions of the future, and those who engage in desire through the conditions of the present.🔽There are sentient beings who have desire internally but not externally,🔽there are sentient beings who have desire externally but not internally,

original: sems can phyi rol tu 'dod chags la nang du 'dod chags med pa dang @226a *//
analyzed: sems can phyi rol tu 'dod chags la nang du 'dod chags med pa dang @226a *//
translated: and there are sentient beings who have desire both internally and externally.

original: kyang yod / sems can nang du'ang 'dod chags la phyi rol tu'ang 'dod chags pa dag kyang yod /
analyzed: kyang yod / sems can nang du'ang 'dod chags la phyi rol tu'ang 'dod chags pa dag kyang yod /
translated: There are those who are attached to both the inner and the outer.

original: sems can nang du'ang 'dod chags med la phyi rol tu'ang 'dod chags pa med pa dag kyang yod /
analyzed: sems can nang du'ang 'dod chags med la phyi rol tu'ang 'dod chags pa med pa dag kyang yod /
translated: There are those who are attached neither to the inner nor the outer.

original: sems can gzugs la 'dod chags la sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa la 'dod chags med pa dag kyang yod /
analyzed: sems can gzugs la 'dod chags la sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa la 'dod chags med pa dag kyang yod /
translated: There are those who are attached to form but not to sound, smell, taste, or touch.

original: sgra la 'dod chags la gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa la 'dod chags med pa dag kyang yod /
analyzed: sgra la 'dod chags la gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa la 'dod chags med pa dag kyang yod /
translated: There are those who are attached to sound but not to form, smell, taste, or touch.🔽There are those who are attached to smell but not to form, sound, taste, or touch.

original: dri la 'dod chags la gzugs dang / sgra dang / ro dang / reg pa la 'dod chags med pa dag kyang yod; ro la 'dod chags la gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / reg pa la 'dod chags med pa dag kyang yod /
analyzed: dri la 'dod chags la gzugs dang / sgra dang / ro dang / reg pa la 'dod chags med pa dag kyang yod; ro la 'dod chags la gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / reg pa la 'dod chags med pa dag kyang yod /
translated: There are those who are attached to taste but not to form, sound, smell, or touch.

original: sems can reg pa la 'dod chags la gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro la 'dod chags med pa dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: sems can reg pa la 'dod chags la gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro la 'dod chags med pa dag kyang yod de /
translated: There are those who are attached to touch but not to form, sound, smell, or taste.

original: 'di ni sems can 'dod chags spyod pa rnams kyi 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni sems can 'dod chags spyod pa rnams kyi 'jug pa ste /
translated: This is the entryway for sentient beings who engage in desire.

original: 'jug pa'i sgo 'dis sems can rnams kyi 'dod chags la spyod pa nyi khri chig stong ngo //🔽sems can rnams kyi zhe sdang la spyod pa'ang nyi khri chig stong ngo //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sgo 'dis sems can rnams kyi 'dod chags la spyod pa nyi khri chig stong ngo // sems can rnams kyi zhe sdang la spyod pa'ang nyi khri chig stong ngo //
translated: Through this entryway, there are twenty-one thousand ways in which sentient beings engage in desire.🔽There are twenty-one thousand ways in which sentient beings engage in anger.

original: sems can rnams kyi gti mug la spyod pa'ang nyi khri chig stong ngo //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi gti mug la spyod pa'ang nyi khri chig stong ngo //
translated: There are twenty-one thousand ways in which sentient beings engage in delusion.

original: sems can rnams kyi cha mnyam pa la spyod pa'ang nyi khri chig stong ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi cha mnyam pa la spyod pa'ang nyi khri chig stong ste /
translated: There are twenty-one thousand ways in which sentient beings engage in a combination of these.🔽These are the eighty-four thousand ways in which sentient beings engage in desire.

original: gang sems can gyi spyod pa brgyad khri bzhi stong po de dag gi sems kyi 'jug pa dang / 'bab pa shes pa dang / so so ci rigs par @226b chos ston par shes pa dang / dus la mi 'da' bar shes pa dang / snod kyi bye brag ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa dang /
analyzed: gang sems can gyi spyod pa brgyad khri bzhi stong po de dag gi sems kyi 'jug pa dang / 'bab pa shes pa dang / so so ci rigs par @226b chos ston par shes pa dang / dus la mi 'da' bar shes pa dang / snod kyi bye brag ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa dang /
translated: The bodhisattva knows the entryways and the flow of these eighty-four thousand ways in which sentient beings engage in desire. He knows how to teach the Dharma to each and every one of them in a way that is appropriate. He knows how to teach them in a timely way. He knows how to teach them in a way that is in accordance with the specific vessel of each being.

original: 'bras bu yod par chos bstan pa shes pa dang / ma chad ma lhag bar chos bstan pa shes pa de ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod par chos bstan pa shes pa dang / ma chad ma lhag bar chos bstan pa shes pa de ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the teaching of the Dharma in a way that is neither incomplete nor excessive.

original: de la nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the correct understanding of language?

original: gang sems can thams cad kyi skad la 'jug pa shes pa ste; lha'i skad dang / klu'i skad dang / gnod sbyin gyi skad dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang /
analyzed: gang sems can thams cad kyi skad la 'jug pa shes pa ste; lha'i skad dang / klu'i skad dang / gnod sbyin gyi skad dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang /
translated: It is the knowledge of the languages of all beings, the language of the gods, the language of nāgas, the language of yakṣas, the language of gandharvas, the language of asuras, the language of garuḍas, the language of kinnaras, the language of mahoragas,

original: mi dang / mi ma yin pa'i skad la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: mi dang / mi ma yin pa'i skad la 'jug pa ste /
translated: the language of humans, and the language of non-humans.

original: mdor na ji snyed du 'gro ba lngar skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyi skad dang / sgra dang / dbyangs dang / tshig gi la ma dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / brda dang / spyod pa ji snyed pa de dag thams cad rab tu shes te /
analyzed: mdor na ji snyed du 'gro ba lngar skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyi skad dang / sgra dang / dbyangs dang / tshig gi la ma dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / brda dang / spyod pa ji snyed pa de dag thams cad rab tu shes te /
translated: In short, it is the knowledge of all the languages, sounds, tones, expressions, words, definitions, communications, and conduct of beings born in the five realms.

original: shes nas kyang sgra de dang / de dag dang / nges pa'i tshig de dang / de dag gis sems can de dang / de dag la sgra ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug pas chos ston te /
analyzed: shes nas kyang sgra de dang / de dag dang / nges pa'i tshig de dang / de dag gis sems can de dang / de dag la sgra ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug pas chos ston te /
translated: Having understood, he teaches the Dharma to those sentient beings by means of those sounds, those etymologies, and those words, without engaging in literalism.

original: 'di ni nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the correct understanding of the etymological explanations.

original: gzhan yang / nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa ni spyod pa 'di dag 'di lta bur brtag par ba /🔽chos 'di dag 'di lta bur brtul bar bya /
analyzed: gzhan yang / nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa ni spyod pa 'di dag 'di lta bur brtag par ba / chos 'di dag 'di lta bur brtul bar bya /
translated: Moreover, the correct understanding of the etymological explanations is as follows: “These practices should be investigated in such and such a way.🔽These phenomena should be practiced in such and such a way.

original: chos 'di dag 'di lta bur mtshams sbyor bar bya /🔽chos 'di lta bur khong du chud par bya /
analyzed: chos 'di dag 'di lta bur mtshams sbyor bar bya / chos 'di lta bur khong du chud par bya /
translated: These phenomena should be connected in such and such a way.🔽These phenomena should be understood in such and such a way.

original: chos 'di lta bur yi ge rnams kyis brtag par bya'o zhes @227a *//
analyzed: chos 'di lta bur yi ge rnams kyis brtag par bya'o zhes @227a *//
translated: These phenomena should be investigated with such and such letters.”

original: des gcig gi tshig kyang shes /
analyzed: des gcig gi tshig kyang shes /
translated: He knows the words of one.

original: gnyis kyi tshig kyang shes /
analyzed: gnyis kyi tshig kyang shes /
translated: He knows the words of two.

original: mang po'i tshig kyang shes /🔽skyes pa'i tshig kyang shes /🔽bud med kyi tshig kyang shes /
analyzed: mang po'i tshig kyang shes / skyes pa'i tshig kyang shes / bud med kyi tshig kyang shes /
translated: He knows the words of many.🔽He knows the words of men.🔽He knows the words of women.

original: ma ning gi tshig kyang shes /
analyzed: ma ning gi tshig kyang shes /
translated: He knows the words of eunuchs.

original: 'das pa'i tshig kyang shes /🔽ma 'ongs pa'i tshig kyang shes /
analyzed: 'das pa'i tshig kyang shes / ma 'ongs pa'i tshig kyang shes /
translated: They know the words of the past.🔽They know the words of the future.

original: da ltar byung ba'i tshig kyang shes /🔽yi ge gcig tu sgro btags pa'ang shes /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i tshig kyang shes / yi ge gcig tu sgro btags pa'ang shes /
translated: They know the words of the present.🔽They know the superimposition of a single letter.

original: yi ge du mar sgro btags pa'ang shes /
analyzed: yi ge du mar sgro btags pa'ang shes /
translated: They know the superimposition of many letters.

original: sgro btags pa med pa'ang shes te /
analyzed: sgro btags pa med pa'ang shes te /
translated: They know the absence of superimposition.

original: 'di ni nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the correct understanding of etymology.

original: gzhan yang / nges pa'i tshig de ni chos thams cad 'gog pa la tshig gis chos shes pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang / nges pa'i tshig de ni chos thams cad 'gog pa la tshig gis chos shes pa ste /
translated: Moreover, that etymology is the knowledge of phenomena through words that is the cessation of all phenomena.

original: 'di ni nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the correct understanding of etymology.

original: de'i nges pa'i tshig de ni thogs pa med pa /
analyzed: de'i nges pa'i tshig de ni thogs pa med pa /
translated: That etymology is unobstructed,

original: 'khrul pa med pa /
analyzed: 'khrul pa med pa /
translated: unmistaken,

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa /
translated: very pure,

original: zlos pa med pa /
analyzed: zlos pa med pa /
translated: not repetitive,

original: mi drag pa /
analyzed: mi drag pa /
translated: not harsh,

original: ma brtags pa /🔽zur phyin pa /
analyzed: ma brtags pa / zur phyin pa /
translated: not contrived,🔽not incomplete,

original: rnam par gsal ba /
analyzed: rnam par gsal ba /
translated: clear,

original: don dang / yi ges bskor ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'khor tshim par byed pa /
analyzed: don dang / yi ges bskor ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'khor tshim par byed pa /
translated: and it satisfies the retinue in accordance with the way it is, with its meaning and its letters.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa /
translated: It is various,

original: zab mo zab par snang ba /
analyzed: zab mo zab par snang ba /
translated: deep, and appears deep.

original: kun rdzob dang / don dam pas brgyan pa /
analyzed: kun rdzob dang / don dam pas brgyan pa /
translated: It is adorned with the conventional and the ultimate.

original: rang gi sems dang / shes pa dang / lta ba rtogs pa /
analyzed: rang gi sems dang / shes pa dang / lta ba rtogs pa /
translated: It is the realization of one’s own mind, consciousness, and view.

original: sangs rgyas kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha said,

original: sems can thams cad mgu bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad mgu bar byed pa ste /
translated: “It is the satisfaction of all beings.

original: 'di ni nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the correct understanding of the etymologies.”

original: de la spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the correct understanding of eloquence?”

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: chags pa med par lung bsgo ba bstan @227b pa shes pa dang / phyad par lung bsgo ba bstan pa shes pa dang / thogs pa med par lung bsgo ba bstan pa shes pa dang / myur ba'i spobs pa dang / la gor ba'i spobs pa dang /
analyzed: chags pa med par lung bsgo ba bstan @227b pa shes pa dang / phyad par lung bsgo ba bstan pa shes pa dang / thogs pa med par lung bsgo ba bstan pa shes pa dang / myur ba'i spobs pa dang / la gor ba'i spobs pa dang /
translated: It is the knowledge of the teaching of the prediction of nonattachment, the knowledge of the teaching of the prediction of nonobstruction, the knowledge of the teaching of the prediction of nonhindrance, quick eloquence, uninterrupted eloquence,

original: mgyogs pa'i spobs pa dang / 'bras bu yod pa'i spobs pa dang / ji ltar dris pa bzhin du spobs pa dang / mi 'phrog pa'i spobs pa dang / yongs su mi nyams pa'i spobs pa dang / shin tu 'brel ba'i spobs pa dang / rtogs pa'i spobs pa dang /
analyzed: mgyogs pa'i spobs pa dang / 'bras bu yod pa'i spobs pa dang / ji ltar dris pa bzhin du spobs pa dang / mi 'phrog pa'i spobs pa dang / yongs su mi nyams pa'i spobs pa dang / shin tu 'brel ba'i spobs pa dang / rtogs pa'i spobs pa dang /
translated: It is eloquence that is swift, eloquent with results, eloquent in response to questions, eloquent and unassailable, eloquent and irreproachable, eloquent and well connected, eloquent and realized,

original: chos la dga' ba'i spobs pa dang / bzod pa'i stobs la gnas pa'i spobs pa dang / zab mo la spobs pa dang / sna tshogs kyi spobs pa dang / kun rdzob dang / don dam pa la spobs pa dang / sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang /
analyzed: chos la dga' ba'i spobs pa dang / bzod pa'i stobs la gnas pa'i spobs pa dang / zab mo la spobs pa dang / sna tshogs kyi spobs pa dang / kun rdzob dang / don dam pa la spobs pa dang / sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang /
translated: eloquent and delightful, eloquent and abiding in the power of patience, eloquent in the profound, eloquent in the various, eloquent in the conventional and ultimate, eloquent in generosity, discipline,

original: bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab la spobs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi tshig rab tu dbye bar bstan pa la spobs pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang /
analyzed: bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab la spobs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi tshig rab tu dbye bar bstan pa la spobs pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang /
translated: patience, diligence, concentration, and insight, and eloquent in teaching the divisions of the words of all the buddhadharmas, and it is eloquence in the applications of mindfulness, the correct exertions,

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang; stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam zab mo spobs pa dang / zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong la spobs pa ste /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang; stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam zab mo spobs pa dang / zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong la spobs pa ste /
translated: “ Eloquence in the profound bases of miraculous powers, faculties, powers, factors of awakening, and path; eloquence in calm abiding and insight;

original: spobs pa so saso yang dag par rig pa zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig la rtog pas tshig gi chos shes pa dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / bden pa la 'jug pa shes pa'i spobs @228a *//
analyzed: spobs pa so saso yang dag par rig pa zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig la rtog pas tshig gi chos shes pa dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / bden pa la 'jug pa shes pa'i spobs @228a *//
translated: “ Eloquence in the analytical knowledges” means eloquence in the Dharma of words through conceptualizing definitions, and eloquence in the absorptions, liberations, samādhis, and samāpattis, and in the knowledge of entering the truths.

original: pa'o; ;theg pa thams cad la spobs pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o; ;theg pa thams cad la spobs pa'o //
translated: It is eloquence in all vehicles.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du bstan pas sems can thams cad kyi sbyor ba tshim par bya ba la spobs pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du bstan pas sems can thams cad kyi sbyor ba tshim par bya ba la spobs pa ste /
translated: It is eloquence in satisfying the practice of all sentient beings through teaching exactly as it is.

original: mi dor mi lkugs pa'i tshig dang / mi brlang ba'i tshig dang / brtan pa'i tshig dang / mi rtsub pa'i tshig dang / 'jam pa'i tshig dang / dag pa'i tshig dang / rab tu grol ba'i tshig dang / thogs pa med pa'i tshig dang /🔽zur phyin pa'i tshig dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / mi g-yo ba'i tshig dang / mi rgol ba'i tshig dang / zhi ba'i tshig dang / btsun pa'i tshig dang / 'brel ba'i tshig dang / ldan pa'i tshig dang / tha ba med pa'i tshig dang /
analyzed: mi dor mi lkugs pa'i tshig dang / mi brlang ba'i tshig dang / brtan pa'i tshig dang / mi rtsub pa'i tshig dang / 'jam pa'i tshig dang / dag pa'i tshig dang / rab tu grol ba'i tshig dang / thogs pa med pa'i tshig dang / zur phyin pa'i tshig dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / mi g-yo ba'i tshig dang / mi rgol ba'i tshig dang / zhi ba'i tshig dang / btsun pa'i tshig dang / 'brel ba'i tshig dang / ldan pa'i tshig dang / tha ba med pa'i tshig dang /
