original: zhing mtha' yas par go bar byed pa'i rjes su song ba'i dbyangs dang / tshangs pa'i sgra skad la rtog cing go bar byed pa'i rjes su song ba'i dbyangs dang / sangs rgyas kyis bka' stsal pa'i spobs pas sems can gzhan dag dang / gang zag gzhan dag gi dbang po mchog dang /
analyzed: zhing mtha' yas par go bar byed pa'i rjes su song ba'i dbyangs dang / tshangs pa'i sgra skad la rtog cing go bar byed pa'i rjes su song ba'i dbyangs dang / sangs rgyas kyis bka' stsal pa'i spobs pas sems can gzhan dag dang / gang zag gzhan dag gi dbang po mchog dang /
translated: It is a melody that is in accord with the understanding of infinite realms. It is a melody that is in accord with the understanding of the Brahmā voice. It is a melody that is in accord with the understanding of the eloquence that is the Buddha’s speech. It is a melody that is in accord with the understanding of the faculties of other beings and other individuals.

original: mchog ma yin pa shes pas chos ston te /
analyzed: mchog ma yin pa shes pas chos ston te /
translated: a voice that is understood in infinite realms, a voice that is understood through the Brahma voice, a voice that teaches the Dharma through the eloquence of the Buddha’s teachings, and a voice that teaches the Dharma through the knowledge of the faculties of other beings and other individuals.

original: de'i chos ston pa de'ang de byed pa yang dag par sdug bsngal zad @228b par bya ba'i phyir nges par 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i chos ston pa de'ang de byed pa yang dag par sdug bsngal zad @228b par bya ba'i phyir nges par 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: His Dharma teachings are also such that they lead to the transcendence of suffering and the end of suffering.

original: 'di ni spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the eloquence of the correct understanding of the Dharma.

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi mi zad pa'o ////
analyzed: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi mi zad pa'o ////
translated: these are the bodhisatvas’ four correct understandings that are inexhaustible.

original: bam po drug pa /
analyzed: bam po drug pa /
translated: Chapter Six

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rton pa bzhi'ang mi zad pa ste; bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rton pa bzhi'ang mi zad pa ste; bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: Moreover, the four reliances of the bodhisattvas are also inexhaustible. What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:🔽relying on the meaning, not the words;🔽relying on the knowledge, not the consciousness;🔽relying on the definitive meaning sutras, not the provisional meaning sutras;

original: don la rton gyi tshig 'bru la mi rton pa dang / ye shes la rton gyi rnam par shes pa la mi rton pa dang / nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde la rton gyi drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde la mi rton pa dang / chos nyid la rton gyi gang zag la mi rton pa'o //
analyzed: don la rton gyi tshig 'bru la mi rton pa dang / ye shes la rton gyi rnam par shes pa la mi rton pa dang / nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde la rton gyi drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde la mi rton pa dang / chos nyid la rton gyi gang zag la mi rton pa'o //
translated: relying on the dharmata, not the person.

original: de la don ni gang /
analyzed: de la don ni gang /
translated: What is the meaning?

original: tshig 'bru ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshig 'bru ni gang zhe na /
translated: What are the words?

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang 'jig rten pa'i chos dang / bya ba la 'jug pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang 'jig rten pa'i chos dang / bya ba la 'jug pa bstan pa'o //
translated: Words are the teachings on engaging in worldly phenomena and activities.

original: don ces bya ba ni gang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: don ces bya ba ni gang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rtogs pa'o //
translated: Meaning is the realization of supramundane phenomena.

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang sbyin pa dang / dul ba dang / legs par sdom pa dang / des pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang sbyin pa dang / dul ba dang / legs par sdom pa dang / des pa bstan pa'o //
translated: Words are the teachings on generosity, discipline, restraint, and gentleness.

original: don ces bya ba ni gang sbyin pa dang / dul ba dang / legs par sdom pa dang / des pa'i mnyam pa nyid shes pa'o //
analyzed: don ces bya ba ni gang sbyin pa dang / dul ba dang / legs par sdom pa dang / des pa'i mnyam pa nyid shes pa'o //
translated: The letter is the knowledge of the equality of generosity, self-control, good restraint, and gentleness.

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang 'khor ba'i skyon bsgrags shing brjod pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang 'khor ba'i skyon bsgrags shing brjod pa'o //
translated: The letter is the proclamation and expression of the faults of cyclic existence.

original: don ces bya ba ni gang 'khor ba la mi dmigs par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: don ces bya ba ni gang 'khor ba la mi dmigs par rtog pa'o //
translated: The meaning is the non-apprehension of cyclic existence.

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan dang / phan yon brjod pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan dang / phan yon brjod pa'o //
translated: The letter is the expression of the virtues and benefits of nirvana.

original: @229a *// don ces bya ba ni gang rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos thams cad la rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: @229a *// don ces bya ba ni gang rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos thams cad la rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: The meaning is the non-discrimination of all dharmas which are by nature in nirvana.

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang theg pa ji ltar rnam par bzhag pa bzhin du ston pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang theg pa ji ltar rnam par bzhag pa bzhin du ston pa'o //
translated: The letter is the teaching in accordance with the way the vehicles are established.

original: don ces bya ba ni gang chos kyi dbyings dbyer med cing tshul gcig pa la 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don ces bya ba ni gang chos kyi dbyings dbyer med cing tshul gcig pa la 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The meaning is the entry into the indivisible and single mode of the dharma-element.

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba bstan pa'o //
translated: The letter is the teaching of the complete giving up of all possessions.

original: don ces bya ban i gang 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: don ces bya ban i gang 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa shes pa'o //
translated: The spirit is the knowledge of the three cycles of giving.🔽 The letter is the teaching of the taking up of all the vows of morality, of the rules of discipline, of the good conduct, and of the mortifications of asceticism, in regard to body, speech, and mind.🔽 The spirit is the knowledge of the purity of the taking up of all the vows of morality, of the rules of discipline, of the good conduct, and of the mortifications of asceticism, in regard to body, speech, and mind, which are not apprehended.

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi sdom pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bslab pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa thams cad yang dag par blang ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi sdom pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bslab pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa thams cad yang dag par blang ba bstan pa'o //
translated: The letter is the teaching of the taking up of the vows of morality, of the rules of discipline, of the good conduct, and of the mortifications of asceticism, in regard to body, speech, and mind.🔽 The spirit is the knowledge of the purity of the taking up of all the vows of morality, of the rules of discipline, of the good conduct, and of the mortifications of asceticism, in regard to body, speech, and mind, which are not apprehended.🔽 The letter is the teaching of the taking up of the vows of morality, of the rules of discipline, of the good conduct, and of the mortifications of asceticism, in regard to body, speech, and mind.🔽 The spirit is the knowledge of the purity of the taking up of all the vows of morality, of the rules of discipline, of the good conduct, and of the mortifications of asceticism, in regard to body, speech, and mind, which are not apprehended.🔽 The letter is the teaching of the taking up of the vows of morality, of the rules of discipline, of the good conduct, and of the mortifications of asceticism, in regard to body, speech, and mind.🔽 The spirit is the knowledge of the purity of the taking up of all the vows of morality, of the rules of discipline, of the good conduct, and of the mortifications of asceticism, in regard to body, speech, and mind, which are not apprehended.

original: don ces bya ba ni gang lus dang / ngag dang / yid mi dmigs pa dang / sdom pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bslab pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa thams cad yang dag par blang ba bstan pa yongs su dag par shes pa'o //
analyzed: don ces bya ba ni gang lus dang / ngag dang / yid mi dmigs pa dang / sdom pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bslab pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa thams cad yang dag par blang ba bstan pa yongs su dag par shes pa'o //
translated: The letter is the teaching of the taking up of the vows of morality, of the rules of discipline, of the good conduct, and of the mortifications of asceticism, in regard to body, speech, and mind.🔽 The spirit is the knowledge of the purity of the

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang gnod sems dang / tha ba dang / skyon dang / khro ba dang / 'khon du 'dzin pa dang / nga rgyal dang / rgyags pa dang / dregs pa thams cad yang dag par 'joms shing bzod pa'i stobs dang nges pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang gnod sems dang / tha ba dang / skyon dang / khro ba dang / 'khon du 'dzin pa dang / nga rgyal dang / rgyags pa dang / dregs pa thams cad yang dag par 'joms shing bzod pa'i stobs dang nges pa bstan pa'o //
translated: Words are the explanations of the power and certainty of patience, which completely conquers all malice, hostility, faults, anger, resentment, pride, arrogance, and conceit.

original: don ces bya ba ni gang mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa'o //
analyzed: don ces bya ba ni gang mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa'o //
translated: Meaning is the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas.

original: tshig 'bru zhes @229b bya ba ni gang dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par sgrub pa la brtson 'grus brtsam pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes @229b bya ba ni gang dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par sgrub pa la brtson 'grus brtsam pa bstan pa'o //
translated: Words are the explanations of the practice of diligence in the cultivation of all roots of virtue.

original: don ces bya ba ni gang blang ba dang / dor ba la mi gnas pa'i brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: don ces bya ba ni gang blang ba dang / dor ba la mi gnas pa'i brtson 'grus so //
translated: Meaning is the diligence that does not abide in acceptance or rejection.

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa bstan pa'o //
translated: Words are the explanations of the dhyānas, liberations, samādhis, and samāpattis.

original: don ces bya ba ni gang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: don ces bya ba ni gang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa shes pa'o //
translated: Meaning is the knowledge of the meditative absorption of cessation.

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang thos pa thams cad 'dzin pa shes rab kyi rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang thos pa thams cad 'dzin pa shes rab kyi rtsa ba'o //
translated: The letter is that which is the root of wisdom, which is the retention of all that is heard.

original: don ces bya ba ni gang brjod du med pa'i don shes pa'o //
analyzed: don ces bya ba ni gang brjod du med pa'i don shes pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that which is the knowledge of the inexpressible meaning.

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yang dag par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yang dag par bstan pa'o //
translated: The letter is that which is the teaching of the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment.

original: don ces bya ba ni gang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sgrub pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byed pa'o //
analyzed: don ces bya ba ni gang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sgrub pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byed pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that which is the direct realization of the result of the practice of the factors of enlightenment.

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / lam gyi bden pa yang dag par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / lam gyi bden pa yang dag par bstan pa'o //
translated: The letter is that which is the teaching of the truths of suffering, origination, and path.

original: don ces bya ba ni gang 'gog pa mngon sum du byed pa'o //🔽tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang ma rig pa la sogs pa nas rga shi'i bar du yang dag par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don ces bya ba ni gang 'gog pa mngon sum du byed pa'o // tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang ma rig pa la sogs pa nas rga shi'i bar du yang dag par bstan pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that which is the direct realization of cessation.🔽 The letter is that which is the teaching of ignorance up to old age and death.

original: don ces bya ba ni gang ma rig pa 'gog pa nas rga shi 'gog pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: don ces bya ba ni gang ma rig pa 'gog pa nas rga shi 'gog pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The meaning is that which is the cessation of ignorance up to the cessation of old age and death.

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi tshogs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi tshogs bstan pa'o //
translated: The letter is the teaching of the collections of calm abiding and insight.

original: don ces bya ba ni gang rig pa dang / rnam par grol pa'i ye shes so //🔽tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti @230a *//
analyzed: don ces bya ba ni gang rig pa dang / rnam par grol pa'i ye shes so // tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti @230a *//
translated: The meaning is the knowledge and the wisdom of liberation.

original: mug dang / cha mnyam par spyod pa'i sems can rnams la bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mug dang / cha mnyam par spyod pa'i sems can rnams la bstan pa'o //
translated: The letter is the teaching for those sentient beings who are engaged in equal parts of desire, hatred, and ignorance.

original: don ces bya ba ni gang sems can rnams dgrol ba mi 'khrugs pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: don ces bya ba ni gang sems can rnams dgrol ba mi 'khrugs pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The meaning is the wisdom of liberation for sentient beings that is not agitated.

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang sgrib pa dang / sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams yang dag par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang sgrib pa dang / sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams yang dag par bstan pa'o //
translated: The letter is the teaching of the phenomena that are obscurations and that lead to obscurations.🔽 The meaning is the wisdom that is free from obscurations and liberation.

original: don ces bya ba ni gang sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes dang / rnam par thar pa'o; ;tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang dkon mchog gsum gyi yon tan dang / bsngags pa mtha' yas pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don ces bya ba ni gang sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes dang / rnam par thar pa'o; ;tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang dkon mchog gsum gyi yon tan dang / bsngags pa mtha' yas pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The letter is the teaching of the limitless qualities and praises of the Three Jewels.🔽 The meaning is the teaching of the ultimate truth.

original: don ces bya ba ni gang sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sku mthong pa dang; 'dod chags dang bral zhing 'gog pa'i chos nyid dang / 'dus ma byas kyi sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun gyi yon tan sgrub pa'i ye shes so //🔽tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: don ces bya ba ni gang sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sku mthong pa dang; 'dod chags dang bral zhing 'gog pa'i chos nyid dang / 'dus ma byas kyi sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun gyi yon tan sgrub pa'i ye shes so // tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: The “meaning” is the vision of the Buddha’s Dharma Body, the nature of cessation free from desire, the unconditioned Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha, and the wisdom that accomplishes their qualities.

original: byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug pa'i bar gyi byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan gyi tshogs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug pa'i bar gyi byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan gyi tshogs bstan pa'o //
translated: “The letter” is the teaching of the accumulation of the bodhisattva’s qualities from the first production of the thought of enlightenment up to the seat of enlightenment.

original: don ces bya ba ni gang sems kyi skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba ste /
analyzed: don ces bya ba ni gang sems kyi skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba ste /
translated: The “meaning” is the perfect enlightenment of the wisdom of omniscience in a single instant of thought.

original: mdor na gang chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong bstan pa 'di ni tshig 'bru zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mdor na gang chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong bstan pa 'di ni tshig 'bru zhes bya'o //
translated: In brief, the teaching of the eighty-four thousand collections of Dharma is called the “letter.”

original: gang sems can thams cad kyi skad dang / yi ge dang / tshig 'brus brjod du med pa'i don de ni don te /
analyzed: gang sems can thams cad kyi skad dang / yi ge dang / tshig 'brus brjod du med pa'i don de ni don te /
translated: The meaning is that which is inexpressible by the speech, letters, and words of all sentient beings.

original: 'di ni don la rton gyi tshig 'bru la mi rton pa @230b zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni don la rton gyi tshig 'bru la mi rton pa @230b zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “reliance on the meaning, not on the words.”

original: de la rnam par shes pa ni gang /
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa ni gang /
translated: “What is consciousness?

original: ye shes ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: ye shes ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is wisdom?”

original: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi ste /
translated: Consciousness is the four abodes of consciousness.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: rnam par shes pa ni gzugs la nye bar 'gro ba dang / tshor ba la nye bar 'gro ba dang / 'du shes la nye bar 'gro ba dang / 'du byed la nye bar 'gro zhing gnas pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni gzugs la nye bar 'gro ba dang / tshor ba la nye bar 'gro ba dang / 'du shes la nye bar 'gro ba dang / 'du byed la nye bar 'gro zhing gnas pa ste /
translated: Consciousness is that which goes to form, goes to feeling, goes to perception, and goes to volitional factors, and abides there.

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “consciousness.”

original: de la ye shes gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ye shes gang zhe na /
translated: “What is wisdom?”

original: gang phung po bzhi la gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i phung po yongs su shes pa ste /
analyzed: gang phung po bzhi la gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i phung po yongs su shes pa ste /
translated: It is the thorough understanding of the aggregate of consciousness that abides in the four aggregates.

original: 'di ni ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “wisdom.”

original: gzhan yang / rnam par shes pa ni sa'i khams rnam par shes pa dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rnam par shes pa ni sa'i khams rnam par shes pa dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Moreover, consciousness is the consciousness of the earth element, the consciousness of the water element, the consciousness of the fire element, and the consciousness of the wind element.

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called consciousness.

original: gang khams rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag la gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa la chos kyi dbyings dbyer med par shes pa 'di ni ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang khams rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag la gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa la chos kyi dbyings dbyer med par shes pa 'di ni ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge that the consciousness that abides in these four elements is inseparable from the realm of phenomena is called wisdom.

original: gzhan yang / rnam par shes pa ni gang mig gis shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams la rnam par rig pa dang / de bzhin du rna bas shes par bya ba'i sgra rnams dang / snas shes par bya ba'i dri rnams dang / lces shes par bya ba'i ro rnams dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rnam par shes pa ni gang mig gis shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams la rnam par rig pa dang / de bzhin du rna bas shes par bya ba'i sgra rnams dang / snas shes par bya ba'i dri rnams dang / lces shes par bya ba'i ro rnams dang /
translated: Moreover, consciousness is the awareness of forms that are cognized by the eyes, and similarly, the awareness of sounds that are cognized by the ears, the awareness of smells that are cognized by the nose, the awareness of tastes that are cognized by the tongue,

original: lus kyis shes par bya ba'i reg bya rnams dang / yid kyis shes par bya ba'i chos rnams la rnam par rig pa ste /
analyzed: lus kyis shes par bya ba'i reg bya rnams dang / yid kyis shes par bya ba'i chos rnams la rnam par rig pa ste /
translated: the awareness of tactile objects that are cognized by the body, and the awareness of mental objects that are cognized by the mind.

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called consciousness.

original: gang yang nang @231a *//
analyzed: gang yang nang @231a *//
translated: And what is internal is🔽peaceful and what is external does not move.

original: nye bar zhi zhing phyi rol tu rgyu ba med pa dang / ye shes la rton pas chos gang la'ang mi rtog rnam par mi rtog pa 'di ni ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nye bar zhi zhing phyi rol tu rgyu ba med pa dang / ye shes la rton pas chos gang la'ang mi rtog rnam par mi rtog pa 'di ni ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: And what is wisdom? It is the non-conceptualization and non-apprehension of any phenomenon through reliance on wisdom.🔽Moreover, consciousness arises from an object, consciousness arises from attention, and consciousness arises from thorough conceptualization.

original: gzhan yang dmigs pa las rnam par shes pa skye ba dang / yid la byed pa las rnam par shes pa skye ba dang / yongs su rtog pa las rnam par shes pa skye ba 'di ni rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o; ;gang yang 'dzin pa med pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang dmigs pa las rnam par shes pa skye ba dang / yid la byed pa las rnam par shes pa skye ba dang / yongs su rtog pa las rnam par shes pa skye ba 'di ni rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o; ;gang yang 'dzin pa med pa dang /
translated: And what is wisdom? It is the absence of grasping,

original: mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa dang / dmigs pa med pa dang / rnam par rig pa med pa dang / rtog pa med pa 'di ni ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa dang / dmigs pa med pa dang / rnam par rig pa med pa dang / rtog pa med pa 'di ni ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: the absence of grasping at the highest, the absence of an object, the absence of awareness, and the absence of conceptualization.

original: gzhan yang / 'dus byas rgyu ba'i chos rnams la rnam par shes pa skye ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang / 'dus byas rgyu ba'i chos rnams la rnam par shes pa skye ste /
translated: Moreover, consciousness arises in relation to conditioned, active phenomena.

original: 'dus ma byas la ni rnam par shes pa rgyu ba med do //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas la ni rnam par shes pa rgyu ba med do //
translated: But consciousness does not move in relation to the unconditioned.

original: gang 'dus ma byas su shes pa de ni ye shes so; ;gzhan yang /
analyzed: gang 'dus ma byas su shes pa de ni ye shes so; ;gzhan yang /
translated: The knowledge of the unconditioned is wisdom.

original: skye ba dang / 'jig pa la gnas pa ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang / 'jig pa la gnas pa ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Moreover, consciousness is the state of being based on arising and perishing.

original: mi skye ba dang / mi 'gog pa la gnas pa ni ye shes te /
analyzed: mi skye ba dang / mi 'gog pa la gnas pa ni ye shes te /
translated: Wisdom is the state of being based on non-arising and non-perishing.

original: 'di ni ye shes la rton gyi rnam par shes pa la mi rton pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ye shes la rton gyi rnam par shes pa la mi rton pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “reliance on wisdom, not on consciousness.”

original: de la nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde ni gang /
analyzed: de la nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde ni gang /
translated: What is a sūtra of definitive meaning?

original: drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is a sūtra of provisional meaning?

original: mdo sde gang dag lam la 'jug pa'i phyir bstan pa de dag ni drang ba'i don ces bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag lam la 'jug pa'i phyir bstan pa de dag ni drang ba'i don ces bya'o //
translated: Sūtras that are taught for the purpose of engaging the path are called “of provisional meaning.”

original: mdo sde gang dag 'bras bu la 'jug pa'i phyir bstan pa de dag ni nges pa'i don ces bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag 'bras bu la 'jug pa'i phyir bstan pa de dag ni nges pa'i don ces bya'o //
translated: Sūtras that are taught for the purpose of engaging the result are called “of definitive meaning.”

original: mdo sde gang dag kun rdzob sgrub par bstan pa de dag ni drang @231b pa'i don ces bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag kun rdzob sgrub par bstan pa de dag ni drang @231b pa'i don ces bya'o //
translated: Sūtras that are taught for the purpose of establishing the conventional are called “of provisional meaning.”

original: mdo sde gang dag don dam pa sgrub par bstan pa de dag ni nges pa'i don ces bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag don dam pa sgrub par bstan pa de dag ni nges pa'i don ces bya'o //
translated: Sūtras that are taught for the purpose of establishing the ultimate are called “of definitive meaning.”

original: mdo sde gang dag las dang / bya ba la 'jug par bstan pa de dag ni drang ba'i don ces bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag las dang / bya ba la 'jug par bstan pa de dag ni drang ba'i don ces bya'o //
translated: Those sūtras that teach engagement in karma and activity are called interpretable in meaning.

original: mdo sde gang dag las dang / nyon mongs pa zad par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa de dag ni nges pa'i don ces bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag las dang / nyon mongs pa zad par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa de dag ni nges pa'i don ces bya'o //
translated: Those sūtras that teach in order to eliminate karma and afflictions are called definitive in meaning.

original: mdo sde gang dag kun nas nyon mongs pa bshad pa'i phyir bstan pa de dag ni drang ba'i don ces bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag kun nas nyon mongs pa bshad pa'i phyir bstan pa de dag ni drang ba'i don ces bya'o //
translated: Those sūtras that teach in order to explain affliction are called interpretable in meaning.

original: mdo sde gang dag rnam par byang ba yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa de dag ni nges pa'i don ces bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag rnam par byang ba yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa de dag ni nges pa'i don ces bya'o //
translated: Those sūtras that teach in order to purify complete purification of purification are called definitive in meaning.

original: mdo sde gang dag 'khor ba la yid dbyung bar bya ba bstan pa de dag ni drang ba'i don ces bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag 'khor ba la yid dbyung bar bya ba bstan pa de dag ni drang ba'i don ces bya'o //
translated: Those sūtras that teach in order to discourage cyclic existence are called interpretable in meaning.

original: mdo sde gang dag 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis su med pa la 'jug par bstan pa de dag ni nges pa'i don ces bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis su med pa la 'jug par bstan pa de dag ni nges pa'i don ces bya'o //
translated: Those sūtras that teach in order to engage in the nonduality of cyclic existence and nirvana are called definitive in meaning.

original: mdo sde gang dag tshig dang / yi ge sna tshogs su bstan pa de dag ni drang ba'i don ces bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag tshig dang / yi ge sna tshogs su bstan pa de dag ni drang ba'i don ces bya'o //
translated: Those sūtras that teach with various words and letters are called “interpretable in meaning.”

original: mdo sde gang dag zab mo mthong bar dga' ba khong du chud par dga' ba bstan pa de dag ni nges pa'i don ces bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag zab mo mthong bar dga' ba khong du chud par dga' ba bstan pa de dag ni nges pa'i don ces bya'o //
translated: Those sūtras that teach the delight of seeing the profound, the delight of understanding the profound, are called “definitive in meaning.”

original: mdo sde gang dag tshig dang / yi ge mang zhing sems can gyi sems dga' bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa de dag ni drang ba'i don ces bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag tshig dang / yi ge mang zhing sems can gyi sems dga' bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa de dag ni drang ba'i don ces bya'o //
translated: Those sūtras that teach with many words and letters, that teach in order to delight the minds of sentient beings, are called “interpretable in meaning.”🔽Those sūtras that teach with few words and letters, that teach in order to make the minds of sentient beings think deeply, are called “definitive in meaning.”

original: mdo sde gang dag tshig dang / yi ge nyung la sems can gyi sems nges par sems par byed par bstan pa de dag ni nges pa'i don ces bya'o //🔽mdo sde gang @232a *//
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag tshig dang / yi ge nyung la sems can gyi sems nges par sems par byed par bstan pa de dag ni nges pa'i don ces bya'o //🔽mdo sde gang @232a *//
translated: Those sūtras that teach the aggregates, elements, and sense-spheres are called “interpretable in meaning.”🔽Those sūtras that teach emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, non-composition, non-production, non-defilement, and purity are called “definitive in meaning.”🔽Those sūtras that teach the practices of bodhisattvas are called “interpretable in meaning.”🔽Those sūtras that teach the practices of śrāvakas are called “definitive in meaning.”🔽Those sūtras that teach the practices of both bodhisattvas and śrāvakas are called “interpretable in meaning.”🔽Those sūtras that teach the practice of only the śrāvakas are called “definitive in meaning.”🔽Those sūtras that teach the practice of only the pratyekabuddhas are called “definitive in meaning.”🔽Those sūtras that teach the practice of only the tathāgatas are called “definitive in meaning.”🔽Those sūtras that teach the practice of only the bodhisattvas are called “interpretable in meaning.”🔽Those sūtras that teach the practice of only the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas are called “interpretable in meaning.”🔽Those sūtras that teach the practice of the three vehicles are called “interpretable in meaning.”🔽Those sūtras that teach the practice of the single vehicle are called “definitive in meaning.”🔽Those sūtras that teach the practice of the three vehicles and the single vehicle are called “interpretable in meaning.”🔽Those sūtras that teach the practice of the single vehicle are called “definitive in meaning.”🔽Those sūtras that teach the practice of the single vehicle are called “definitive in meaning.”

original: dag bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes dang / shed bu dang / byed pa po dang / tshor ba po dang / sgra rnam pa sna tshogs su bshad pa dang /
analyzed: dag bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes dang / shed bu dang / byed pa po dang / tshor ba po dang / sgra rnam pa sna tshogs su bshad pa dang /
translated: the self, sentient beings, living creatures, people, humankind, those born from a womb, those born from heat and moisture, those born from eggs, those born through spontaneous generation, the one who does, the one who feels, and various other terms;🔽and the teaching that what is without an owner is with an owner.

original: bdag po med pa la bdag po dang bcas bar bstan pa de dag ni drang ba'i don ces bya'o //
analyzed: bdag po med pa la bdag po dang bcas bar bstan pa de dag ni drang ba'i don ces bya'o //
translated: Those are called the interpretable meaning.

original: mdo sde gang dag stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba dang / dngos po med pa dang / bdag med pa dang /
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba dang / dngos po med pa dang / bdag med pa dang /
translated: Those sūtras that teach emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, non-performance, non-arising, non-occurrence, non-entity, selflessness,

original: sems can med pa dang / srog med pa dang / gang zag med pa dang / bdag po med pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo'i bar du bstan pa de dag ni nges pa'i don ces bya ste /
analyzed: sems can med pa dang / srog med pa dang / gang zag med pa dang / bdag po med pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo'i bar du bstan pa de dag ni nges pa'i don ces bya ste /
translated: the absence of sentient beings, the absence of living creatures, the absence of humankind, the absence of those born from a womb, the absence of those born from heat and moisture, the absence of those born from eggs, the absence of those born through spontaneous generation, the absence of the one who does, the absence of the one who feels, and the doors of liberation are called the definitive meaning.

original: 'di ni nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde la rton gyi drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde la mi rton pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde la rton gyi drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde la mi rton pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ‘relying on the sūtras of definitive meaning, not relying on the sūtras of provisional meaning.’

original: de la chos nyid ni gang /
analyzed: de la chos nyid ni gang /
translated: “What is the intrinsic nature?

original: gang zag ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zag ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is a person?

original: gang gang zag tu lta ba la gnas te /
analyzed: gang gang zag tu lta ba la gnas te /
translated: If someone, while holding the view of a person,

original: chos kha cig la rtsom pa 'di ni gang zag ces bya'o //
analyzed: chos kha cig la rtsom pa 'di ni gang zag ces bya'o //
translated: undertakes some practice, this is called a ‘person.’

original: gang gang zag tu lta ba de'i rtsom pa yongs su shes pa 'di ni chos nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang gang zag tu lta ba de'i rtsom pa yongs su shes pa 'di ni chos nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The complete understanding of the undertaking of the view of a person is called the ‘intrinsic nature.’

original: gzhan yang / so so'i skye bo'i gang zag dang; so so'i skye bo dge ba'i gang zag dang / dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag dang / chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag dang / brgyad pa'i gang zag dang / rgyun du zhugs @232b pa'i gang zag dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang / so so'i skye bo'i gang zag dang; so so'i skye bo dge ba'i gang zag dang / dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag dang / chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag dang / brgyad pa'i gang zag dang / rgyun du zhugs @232b pa'i gang zag dang /
translated: “Moreover, there is the person of an ordinary being, the person of an ordinary being who is virtuous, the person who follows by means of faith, the person who follows the teachings, the person who is on the eighth [level], the person who is a stream enterer,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i gang zag dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i gang zag dang / dgra bcom pa'i gang zag dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi gang zag dang / byang chub sems dpa'i gang zag dang / gang zag gcig 'jig rten du byung na skye bo mang po la phan pa dang /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i gang zag dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i gang zag dang / dgra bcom pa'i gang zag dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi gang zag dang / byang chub sems dpa'i gang zag dang / gang zag gcig 'jig rten du byung na skye bo mang po la phan pa dang /
translated: When a single person appears in the world, it is for the benefit of many people,

original: skye bo mang po la bde ba dang / 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang / lha dang / mi'i skye bo phal po che'i don gyi phyir /
analyzed: skye bo mang po la bde ba dang / 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang / lha dang / mi'i skye bo phal po che'i don gyi phyir /
translated: for the happiness of many people, out of compassion for the world, and for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.

original: phan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phan pa'i phyir /
translated: It is for the benefit,

original: bde ba'i phyir lha dang / mi rnams kyi ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang zag gcig po 'jig rten du byung ste /
analyzed: bde ba'i phyir lha dang / mi rnams kyi ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang zag gcig po 'jig rten du byung ste /
translated: for the happiness, of gods and humans that a single person appears in the world, a buddha, a blessed one, a teacher of gods and humans.

original: 'di ni gang zag ces bya'o; ;gang zag gi sgra de dag thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i kun rdzob kyi tshig gi gnas kyis sems can rnams drang ba'i phyir bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni gang zag ces bya'o; ;gang zag gi sgra de dag thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i kun rdzob kyi tshig gi gnas kyis sems can rnams drang ba'i phyir bstan pa ste /
translated: All those terms for a person are taught by the Tathāgata as a conventional expression, as a basis for conventional speech, in order to guide sentient beings.

original: de la gang dag mngon par zhen pa de dag ni rton pa ma yin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la gang dag mngon par zhen pa de dag ni rton pa ma yin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Those who are attached to those are called “non-reliant.”

original: de dag rton pa la gzud pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang chos nyid la rton cig /
analyzed: de dag rton pa la gzud pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang chos nyid la rton cig /
translated: In order to lead them to reliance, the Bhagavān said, “Rely on the Dharma,

original: gang zag la ni ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang zag la ni ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: do not rely on the person.”

original: de la chos nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the Dharma?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: 'gyur ba med pa dang / sgro btags pa med pa dang / byang ba med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / mi gnas pa dang / rab tu mi gnas pa dang / rtsa ba med pa dang / thams cad du mnyam pa dang /
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa dang / sgro btags pa med pa dang / byang ba med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / mi gnas pa dang / rab tu mi gnas pa dang / rtsa ba med pa dang / thams cad du mnyam pa dang /
translated: It is changeless, it is not exaggerated, it is not purified, it is not completely purified, it is not a basis, it is not a good basis, it is rootless, it is the same everywhere,

original: mnyam pa dag la mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa dag la mnyam pa dang / mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa dag la mnyam @233a *//
analyzed: mnyam pa dag la mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa dag la mnyam pa dang / mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa dag la mnyam @233a *//
translated: it is the same in the same, it is the same in the different, it is the same in the same and different,

original: pa dang / rtog pa med pa dang / rtsom pa med pa dang / chos thams cad la skyon med pa rnyid pa dang / shin tu nam mkha'i rang bzhin gyi phyir mtshan nyid 'di ni chos nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: pa dang / rtog pa med pa dang / rtsom pa med pa dang / chos thams cad la skyon med pa rnyid pa dang / shin tu nam mkha'i rang bzhin gyi phyir mtshan nyid 'di ni chos nyid ces bya'o //
translated: And because of the absence of conceptualization, the absence of activity, the absence of fault in any phenomenon, and the nature of space, this is called the nature of reality.

original: de la gang dag chos nyid la rton pa dag ni khams gang la'ang mi rton to //
analyzed: de la gang dag chos nyid la rton pa dag ni khams gang la'ang mi rton to //
translated: Those who rely on the nature of reality do not rely on any element.

original: de bas na chos kyi sgo'i tshul la 'jug pa 'dis chos thams cad la rton pa'i phyir chos thams cad chos nyid kho nar 'gyur ba 'di ni chos nyid la rton gyi gang zag la mi rton pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na chos kyi sgo'i tshul la 'jug pa 'dis chos thams cad la rton pa'i phyir chos thams cad chos nyid kho nar 'gyur ba 'di ni chos nyid la rton gyi gang zag la mi rton pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, because of this entry into the way of the Dharma gateway, all phenomena become only the nature of reality, because all phenomena are relied upon. This is called relying on the nature of reality and not relying on the individual.

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rton pa bzhi mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rton pa bzhi mi zad pa'o //
translated: these are the bodhisatvas’ imperishable four reliances.

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs kyang mi zad pa yin te; de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs mi zad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs kyang mi zad pa yin te; de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs mi zad pa gang zhe na /
translated: In this regard, what is the bodhisattvas’ inexhaustible accumulation of merit?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / tshul khrims dang / bsgom pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / byams pa'i sems la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / snying rje chen po'i sbyor ba dang / dge ba thams cad rtsom pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / tshul khrims dang / bsgom pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / byams pa'i sems la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / snying rje chen po'i sbyor ba dang / dge ba thams cad rtsom pa dang /
translated: the meritorious deeds that arise from generosity, the meritorious deeds that arise from morality and meditation, the meditative absorption of loving kindness, the application of great compassion, and the undertaking of all that is virtuous.

original: bdag dang / gzhan gyi sdig pa bshags pa dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa thams cad dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / sems dang po bskyed pa @233b dang / phyir mi ldog pa dang / skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dus gsum du yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang /
analyzed: bdag dang / gzhan gyi sdig pa bshags pa dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa thams cad dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / sems dang po bskyed pa @233b dang / phyir mi ldog pa dang / skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dus gsum du yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang /
translated: the confession of the misdeeds of self and others,🔽the merit of rejoicing in the merit of all those in training, those no longer in training, the pratyekabuddhas, the bodhisattvas who have generated the first thought of awakening, the irreversible, and the bodhisattvas who are impeded by only one birth, which is accomplished in the three times,🔽the merit of rejoicing in the generation of the thought of awakening by all those in training, those no longer in training, the pratyekabuddhas, the bodhisattvas who have generated the first thought of awakening, the irreversible, and the bodhisattvas who are impeded by only one birth,

original: slob pa dang / mi slob pa thams cad dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / sems dang po bskyed pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa dang / skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang /
analyzed: slob pa dang / mi slob pa thams cad dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / sems dang po bskyed pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa dang / skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang /
translated: and

original: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / sangs rgyas thams cad dang /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / sangs rgyas thams cad dang /
translated: the merit of rejoicing in all the sources of good of the Buddhas,🔽the merit of offering the gift of the Dharma to all the Buddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / 'phags pa thams cad dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa thams cad la chos kyi sbyin pa gsol ba dang / sku che bsring bar gsol ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / 'phags pa thams cad dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa thams cad la chos kyi sbyin pa gsol ba dang / sku che bsring bar gsol ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang /
translated: to all Bodhisattvas, to all Aryas, to all those in training and beyond training, and of requesting them to turn the Wheel of the Dharma and not to enter Nirvana,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la rjes su yi rang ba dang / bskul ba dang / gsol ba gdab pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa rnams byang chub tu bsngo ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / sems can byang chub tu sems ma bskyed pa rnams byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la rjes su yi rang ba dang / bskul ba dang / gsol ba gdab pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa rnams byang chub tu bsngo ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / sems can byang chub tu sems ma bskyed pa rnams byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang /
translated: The four bases of meritorious activity are to accumulate roots of virtue by rejoicing in all roots of virtue, by exhorting others to virtue, by supplicating others to teach the Dharma, and by dedicating the roots of virtue to enlightenment.

original: byang chub tu sems @234a *//
analyzed: byang chub tu sems @234a *//
translated: The four bases of virtuous activity are to encourage those who have not generated the mind of enlightenment to generate the mind of enlightenment,🔽to teach the path of the perfections to those who have generated the mind of enlightenment,

original: bskyed pa rnams la pha rol tu phyin pa'i lam ston pa dang / sems can dbul po rnams la longs spyod kyis yang dag par sdud pa dang / sems can nad pa rnams la sman sbyin zhing g-yo med par rim gro byed pa dang / mthu chung ba rnams la bzod pas bstan pa dang /
analyzed: bskyed pa rnams la pha rol tu phyin pa'i lam ston pa dang / sems can dbul po rnams la longs spyod kyis yang dag par sdud pa dang / sems can nad pa rnams la sman sbyin zhing g-yo med par rim gro byed pa dang / mthu chung ba rnams la bzod pas bstan pa dang /
translated: to attract poor sentient beings with material things, to give medicine and to serve without deceit to sick sentient beings, to teach with patience to those of little power,

original: ltung ba mi 'chab pa dang / sdig pa 'chags pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa rnams la mchod pa dang / rim gro thams cad rtsom pa dang / mkhan po dang / slob dpon dag la ston pa bzhin phangs par 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: ltung ba mi 'chab pa dang / sdig pa 'chags pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa rnams la mchod pa dang / rim gro thams cad rtsom pa dang / mkhan po dang / slob dpon dag la ston pa bzhin phangs par 'dzin pa dang /
translated: Not concealing one’s downfalls, confessing one’s negative actions, making offerings and rendering service to the bhagavat buddhas who are present and to those who have passed into parinirvana, undertaking all forms of worship and service, regarding one’s khenpo and one’s master with the same affection as one has for the Teacher,

original: chos rnams la rin thang med pa'i rin po che tshol ba ltar brtson pa dang / chos smra ba rnams la sangs rgyas bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa dang / dpag tshad brgyar yang song zhing dam pa'i chos mnyan pa la mi ngoms pa dang /
analyzed: chos rnams la rin thang med pa'i rin po che tshol ba ltar brtson pa dang / chos smra ba rnams la sangs rgyas bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa dang / dpag tshad brgyar yang song zhing dam pa'i chos mnyan pa la mi ngoms pa dang /
translated: striving to seek the priceless jewel of the Dharma as if one were searching for a jewel, regarding Dharma teachers with the same affection as one has for the Buddha, and not being satisfied with listening to the sublime Dharma even if one has to travel a hundred leagues.

original: chos la slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud med pa dang / zang zing med par chos sbyin pa dang / chos la rin thang med pa'i rin po che chen po bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa dang / pha ma la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / byas pa gzo ba dang /
analyzed: chos la slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud med pa dang / zang zing med par chos sbyin pa dang / chos la rin thang med pa'i rin po che chen po bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa dang / pha ma la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / byas pa gzo ba dang /
translated: It is to not be stingy with the Dharma. It is to give the gift of the Dharma without seeking material reward. It is to hold the Dharma dear as if it were a great and priceless jewel. It is to serve one’s parents. It is to be grateful.

original: byas pa tshor ba dang / byas nas mi 'gyod pa dang / bsod nams gsog pas mi ngoms pa dang / lus bsdams pas lus kyi tshul 'chos pa med pa dang / dag bsdams pas dag gi tshul @234b 'chos pa med pa dang / yid bsdams pas yid kyi tshul 'chos pa med pa dang /
analyzed: byas pa tshor ba dang / byas nas mi 'gyod pa dang / bsod nams gsog pas mi ngoms pa dang / lus bsdams pas lus kyi tshul 'chos pa med pa dang / dag bsdams pas dag gi tshul @234b 'chos pa med pa dang / yid bsdams pas yid kyi tshul 'chos pa med pa dang /
translated: It is to be appreciative. It is to not regret one’s actions. It is to be insatiable in one’s accumulation of merit. It is to not be hypocritical with the body because one’s body is restrained. It is to not be hypocritical with speech because one’s speech is restrained. It is to not be hypocritical with the mind because one’s mind is restrained.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten rab tu 'jog pas tshangs pas bsod nams yongs su 'dzin pa dang; gtan pa med pa'i mchod sbyin byed pas mtshan yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs sna tshogs bsags pas dpe byad bzang po yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten rab tu 'jog pas tshangs pas bsod nams yongs su 'dzin pa dang; gtan pa med pa'i mchod sbyin byed pas mtshan yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs sna tshogs bsags pas dpe byad bzang po yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang /
translated: By accumulating various collections of roots of virtue, they perfect the minor marks.

original: nga rgyal med pas lus brgyan pa dang / dag gi nyes pa thams cad spangs pas ngag brgyan pa dang / sems can thams cad la khong khro ba med pa'i sems kyis sems brgyan pa dang / mngon par shes pas rnam par 'phrul pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan du 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: nga rgyal med pas lus brgyan pa dang / dag gi nyes pa thams cad spangs pas ngag brgyan pa dang / sems can thams cad la khong khro ba med pa'i sems kyis sems brgyan pa dang / mngon par shes pas rnam par 'phrul pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan du 'gyur ba dang /
translated: By being without pride, they adorn their bodies. By abandoning all faults of speech, they adorn their speech. By having a mind that is free of anger toward any sentient being, they adorn their minds. By manifesting with supernormal knowledge, they adorn the buddha realms.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos nyid kyis chos kyi rgyan du 'gyur ba dang / phra ma med pa dang / zhe gcod pa med pa dang / 'gyod pa'i tshig mi smra bas 'khor gyi rgyan du 'gyur ba dang / brjod pa la ser sna med par byed pas chos gzung bar 'gyur pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos nyid kyis chos kyi rgyan du 'gyur ba dang / phra ma med pa dang / zhe gcod pa med pa dang / 'gyod pa'i tshig mi smra bas 'khor gyi rgyan du 'gyur ba dang / brjod pa la ser sna med par byed pas chos gzung bar 'gyur pa dang /
translated: It is to be an ornament of the Dharma through the nature of being free from desire. It is to be an ornament of the retinue through being without slander, without harsh words, and without regret. It is to uphold the Dharma through being without miserliness with regard to speech.

original: 'bras bu yod pa'i chos ston pas rab tu dga' nas legs so zhes bya ba sbyin pa dang / legs par bshad pa la rtog pas sgrib pa rnam par spong ba dang / nges par 'byin pa'i chos mnyan pa'i phyir bsti stang du byas te chos mnyan pa dang /
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa'i chos ston pas rab tu dga' nas legs so zhes bya ba sbyin pa dang / legs par bshad pa la rtog pas sgrib pa rnam par spong ba dang / nges par 'byin pa'i chos mnyan pa'i phyir bsti stang du byas te chos mnyan pa dang /
translated: It is to be delighted and to give the word “excellent” through teaching the Dharma that has results. It is to abandon obscurations through contemplating the well-spoken teachings. It is to listen to the Dharma with respect in order to listen to the Dharma that brings liberation.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la brtul zhugs kyi nags tshal phul bas byang chub kyi shing gi rgyan du 'gyur ba dang / sangs @235a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la brtul zhugs kyi nags tshal phul bas byang chub kyi shing gi rgyan du 'gyur ba dang / sangs @235a *//
translated: It is to be an ornament of the tree of enlightenment through offering the forest of austerities to the blessed buddhas.

original: rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad sngon du 'gro bas byang chub kyi snying po'i rgyan du 'gyur ba dang / las dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis ma gos pas skye ba dang / shi 'pho yongs su dag pa dang /
analyzed: rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad sngon du 'gro bas byang chub kyi snying po'i rgyan du 'gyur ba dang / las dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis ma gos pas skye ba dang / shi 'pho yongs su dag pa dang /
translated: and all their actions and afflictions are unstained.🔽By giving away all precious and cherished things without looking back, one obtains precious things in one’s hands.🔽By giving away inexhaustible treasures, one obtains inexhaustible wealth.

original: rin po che dang / phangs pa'i dngos po thams cad la mi lta bar yongs su gtong bas lag na rin po che thob pa dang / gter mi zad pa rab tu byin pas longs spyod mi zad pa dang / bzhin 'dzum zhing khro gnyer med pas sems can rnams mthong ma thag tu dga' bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: rin po che dang / phangs pa'i dngos po thams cad la mi lta bar yongs su gtong bas lag na rin po che thob pa dang / gter mi zad pa rab tu byin pas longs spyod mi zad pa dang / bzhin 'dzum zhing khro gnyer med pas sems can rnams mthong ma thag tu dga' bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: By smiling and being free of frowns, one is immediately delighted to see sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad la 'od zer mnyam par gtong bas mnyam pa nyid kyi rgyan thob pa dang / ma lobs pa rnams la mi brnyas pas 'od bkod pa gtong ba dang / tshul khrims kyi bsod nams bsags pas skye ba yongs su dag pa dang /🔽ltung ba mi gleng bas mngal gyi gnas yongs su dag pa dang / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yongs su dag pas lha dang / mir skye ba dang / rjes su bstan pa thams cad la rnam par mi rtog pas rnam par gnon pa don yod pa dang /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la 'od zer mnyam par gtong bas mnyam pa nyid kyi rgyan thob pa dang / ma lobs pa rnams la mi brnyas pas 'od bkod pa gtong ba dang / tshul khrims kyi bsod nams bsags pas skye ba yongs su dag pa dang / ltung ba mi gleng bas mngal gyi gnas yongs su dag pa dang / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yongs su dag pas lha dang / mir skye ba dang / rjes su bstan pa thams cad la rnam par mi rtog pas rnam par gnon pa don yod pa dang /
translated: They obtain the ornament of equanimity by emitting light rays equally to all sentient beings; they emit the light array by not despising those who are not trained; they have a pure birth by accumulating the merit of ethical discipline;

original: chos thams cad la slob dpon gyi dpe ma khyud med pas chos thams cad la dbang ba dang / bsam pa yongs su dag pas 'jig rten thams cad la dbang ba dang / sems can yongs su dag par byed pas rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su @235b dag pa dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad la slob dpon gyi dpe ma khyud med pas chos thams cad la dbang ba dang / bsam pa yongs su dag pas 'jig rten thams cad la dbang ba dang / sems can yongs su dag par byed pas rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su @235b dag pa dang /
translated: they have a pure womb by not discussing the downfalls of others; they are born as gods and humans by purifying the path of the ten virtues; they have an invincible purity by not being discouraged in their minds; they have the purity of the higher realms by not being discouraged in their bodies; they have the purity of the higher realms by not being discouraged in their bodies; they have the purity of the higher realms by not being discouraged in their bodies; they have the purity of the higher realms by not being discouraged in their bodies; they have the purity of the higher realms by not being discouraged in their bodies; they have the purity of the

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa la rton pas lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su dag pa dang / nyi tshe ba'i spyod pa mi 'dod pas sangs rgyas kyi chos rgya chen po la mos pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems mi gtong bas bsod nams thams cad yongs su 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa la rton pas lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su dag pa dang / nyi tshe ba'i spyod pa mi 'dod pas sangs rgyas kyi chos rgya chen po la mos pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems mi gtong bas bsod nams thams cad yongs su 'dzin pa dang /
translated: Relying on the ripening of karma, they have a completely pure superior intention. Not wanting limited conduct, they aspire to the vast Dharma of the buddhas. Not giving up the mind of omniscience, they gather all merit.

original: dad pa sngon du 'gro bas nor bdun yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba dang / lus dang / srog la mi lta bas sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su 'dzin pa dang / sngon dam pa bcas pa nyams 'og tu chud par byed pas 'jig rten thams cad la mi slu ba dang /
analyzed: dad pa sngon du 'gro bas nor bdun yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba dang / lus dang / srog la mi lta bas sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su 'dzin pa dang / sngon dam pa bcas pa nyams 'og tu chud par byed pas 'jig rten thams cad la mi slu ba dang /
translated: With faith as their guide, they perfect the seven riches. Not caring about their bodies or lives, they uphold the Dharma of the buddhas. Not deceiving anyone in the world, they keep their former sacred bonds.

original: dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur pa dang / de ltar rgyu gang dang / gang gis sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu de dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur pa dang / de ltar rgyu gang dang / gang gis sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu de dang /
translated: It is the completion of all the qualities of the Buddha, because it completes all virtuous qualities.

original: de dag yang dag par sgrub pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de dag yang dag par sgrub pa 'di ni /
translated: In this way, the causes and conditions by which the qualities of the Buddha are completed are accomplished by bodhisattvas.

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: mdor na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs mi zad pa zhes bya ste; rgya cher ni bskal pa'am /
analyzed: mdor na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs mi zad pa zhes bya ste; rgya cher ni bskal pa'am /
translated: in brief, this is called the bodhisattvas’ inexhaustible accumulation of merit.🔽If I were to explain it extensively, I could speak about it for an eon

original: de bas kyang lhag par bshad du yod do //
analyzed: de bas kyang lhag par bshad du yod do //
translated: or even longer than that.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs mi zad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs mi zad pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattvas’ inexhaustible accumulation of wisdom?

original: rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang gis ye shes rtogs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu de dag dang / rkyen de dag byang chub sems dpar yang dag par sgrub ste /
analyzed: rgyu gang dang / rkyen gang gis ye shes rtogs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu de dag dang / rkyen de dag byang chub sems dpar yang dag par sgrub ste /
translated: The causes and conditions by which wisdom is realized are accomplished by bodhisattvas.

original: de la rgyu ni gang /
analyzed: de la rgyu ni gang /
translated: What are the causes?

original: rkyen ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: rkyen ni gang zhe na /
translated: What are the conditions?

original: gang 'di ye shes yongs su tshol @236a *//
analyzed: gang 'di ye shes yongs su tshol @236a *//
translated: It is the strong aspiration to seek wisdom,🔽to always rely on, associate with, and serve spiritual friends who have realized wisdom,🔽to rely on the wisdom of the buddhas

original: ba la rab tu 'dun pa dang / ye shes rtogs pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams la rtag tu bsten pa dang / 'grogs pa dang / bsnyen bkur byed pa dang; gang yang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la rten cing /
analyzed: ba la rab tu 'dun pa dang / ye shes rtogs pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams la rtag tu bsten pa dang / 'grogs pa dang / bsnyen bkur byed pa dang; gang yang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la rten cing /
translated: and not on the wisdom of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas,🔽to have no pride in the presence of those spiritual friends and to hold them dear as if they were gurus, to hold them dear as if they were teachers,

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la mi rton pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dag la nga rgyal med cing bla ma bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa dang / ston pa bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dag gis kyang 'di bsam pa phun sum tshogs par rig nas 'brel pa'i gtam dag pa ye shes kyi gtam sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la mi rton pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dag la nga rgyal med cing bla ma bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa dang / ston pa bzhin du phangs par 'dzin pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dag gis kyang 'di bsam pa phun sum tshogs par rig nas 'brel pa'i gtam dag pa ye shes kyi gtam sgrub par byed do //
translated: and for those spiritual friends, knowing that one has perfect thoughts, to give pure teachings on wisdom that are related to the practice.

original: snod du rig nas rgyun mi 'chad par phyi rol ma yin pa'i chos so //
analyzed: snod du rig nas rgyun mi 'chad par phyi rol ma yin pa'i chos so //
translated: Knowing that one is a suitable vessel, they give teachings that are not external.

original: des chos de dag thos nas chos kyi tshogs la sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: des chos de dag thos nas chos kyi tshogs la sbyor bar byed de /
translated: Having heard those teachings, he applies himself to the accumulation of the teachings.

original: gang chos kyi tshogs la sbyor ba de ni de'i ye shes kyi tshogs yin no //
analyzed: gang chos kyi tshogs la sbyor ba de ni de'i ye shes kyi tshogs yin no //
translated: That application to the accumulation of the teachings is the accumulation of wisdom.

original: de la chos kyi tshogs la sbyor ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos kyi tshogs la sbyor ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is application to the accumulation of the teachings?

original: gang 'di don nyung ba dang / bya ba nyung ba dang / smra ba nyung ba dang / yo byad nyung ba dang / nam gyi cha stod dang / nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal zhing rnal 'byor la brtson pa dang / thos pa'i don la rtog pa dang /
analyzed: gang 'di don nyung ba dang / bya ba nyung ba dang / smra ba nyung ba dang / yo byad nyung ba dang / nam gyi cha stod dang / nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal zhing rnal 'byor la brtson pa dang / thos pa'i don la rtog pa dang /
translated: It is having few desires, being easily contented, having few affairs, being energetic, having few possessions, having little sleep in the first and last periods of the night, being devoted to spiritual practice, reflecting on the meaning of what one has learned,

original: yang dang yang tshol ba dang / sems la rnyog pa med pa dang / sgrib pa rnams rnam par sel ba dang / ltung ba rnams las 'byung ba shes pa dang / 'gyod pa med pa dang / kun nas @236b ldang ba med pa dang /
analyzed: yang dang yang tshol ba dang / sems la rnyog pa med pa dang / sgrib pa rnams rnam par sel ba dang / ltung ba rnams las 'byung ba shes pa dang / 'gyod pa med pa dang / kun nas @236b ldang ba med pa dang /
translated: seeking the teaching again and again, having a mind free of turbidity, dispelling obscurations, knowing how to emerge from downfalls, being without regret, being without mental agitation,

original: sgrub pa snying por byed pa dang / chos la gzhol ba dang / chos la 'bab pa dang / chos la bab pa dang / rtul ba dang ldan pa dang / ye shes tshol ba la mgo dang / gos la me 'bar ba lta bu dang /
analyzed: sgrub pa snying por byed pa dang / chos la gzhol ba dang / chos la 'bab pa dang / chos la bab pa dang / rtul ba dang ldan pa dang / ye shes tshol ba la mgo dang / gos la me 'bar ba lta bu dang /
translated: They are: making practice the essence, being devoted to the Dharma, being intent on the Dharma, being focused on the Dharma, being diligent, seeking wisdom, being like a burning head and clothes,

original: de la ma chags par gnas pa dang / tshul khrims la mi lhod pa dang / brtson pa mi gtong ba dang / khyad par du 'gro ba dang / 'du 'dzi la mi dga' ba dang / gcig pur dga' ba dang / dgon pa la mngon du phyogs shing yid la byed pa dang /
analyzed: de la ma chags par gnas pa dang / tshul khrims la mi lhod pa dang / brtson pa mi gtong ba dang / khyad par du 'gro ba dang / 'du 'dzi la mi dga' ba dang / gcig pur dga' ba dang / dgon pa la mngon du phyogs shing yid la byed pa dang /
translated: being without attachment, not being lax in discipline, not giving up striving, making progress, not enjoying crowds, enjoying solitude, being inclined toward and focused on the wilderness,

original: 'phags pa'i rigs chog shes pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan dag las mi g-yo ba dang / chos kyi kun dga' ba dga' zhing mos pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i sngags dran par mi 'dzin pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos tshol ba dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i rigs chog shes pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan dag las mi g-yo ba dang / chos kyi kun dga' ba dga' zhing mos pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i sngags dran par mi 'dzin pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos tshol ba dang /
translated: being content with the noble lineage, not wavering from the ascetic qualities, delighting in and being devoted to the joy of the Dharma, not remembering worldly spells, and seeking supramundane qualities.

original: brjed pa med pa dang / rtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / blo gros kyis lam dang mthun pa dang; brtan pas sdom pa dang / rkyen rnams kyis ye shes kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pas brgyan pa dang /
analyzed: brjed pa med pa dang / rtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / blo gros kyis lam dang mthun pa dang; brtan pas sdom pa dang / rkyen rnams kyis ye shes kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pas brgyan pa dang /
translated: They are not forgetful, they follow realization, they are in accord with the path through their intelligence, they are steadfast in their vows, they follow wisdom through the conditions, they are adorned with a sense of shame and decency,

original: ye shes kyi rjes su 'gro ba lhur len pa dang / mi shes pa sel ba dang / ma rig pa dang / gti mug gi mun pa dang / rab rib kyi ling tog gis chod pa sel ba dang / shes rab kyi mig rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: ye shes kyi rjes su 'gro ba lhur len pa dang / mi shes pa sel ba dang / ma rig pa dang / gti mug gi mun pa dang / rab rib kyi ling tog gis chod pa sel ba dang / shes rab kyi mig rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: they are dedicated to following wisdom, they dispel ignorance, they dispel the darkness of ignorance and confusion, they dispel the cataracts of blindness, they have the pure eye of wisdom,

original: blo shin tu rnam par dag pa dang / blo rgya che ba dang / blo ma zhum pa dang / blo ma gyes pa dang / blo rab tu gsal ba dang / mngon sum shes pa dang / yon tan gzhan @237a *//
analyzed: blo shin tu rnam par dag pa dang / blo rgya che ba dang / blo ma zhum pa dang / blo ma gyes pa dang / blo rab tu gsal ba dang / mngon sum shes pa dang / yon tan gzhan @237a *//
translated: they have the pure mind, they have a vast mind, they have an undaunted mind, they have an undivided mind, they have a very clear mind, they have direct knowledge, they have other qualities,

original: la rag ma lus pa dang / bdag gi yon tan mi snyems pa dang / gzhan gyi yon tan yongs su brjod pa dang / legs par bya ba'i las byed pa dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa dang 'gal bar mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: la rag ma lus pa dang / bdag gi yon tan mi snyems pa dang / gzhan gyi yon tan yongs su brjod pa dang / legs par bya ba'i las byed pa dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa dang 'gal bar mi byed pa dang /
translated: not being dependent on others, not being conceited about one’s own good qualities, praising the good qualities of others, doing good deeds, not contradicting the ripening of karma,

original: las yongs su dag pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: las yongs su dag pa'i ye shes te /
translated: and the wisdom of pure karma.

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: this is called the bodhisattvas’ imperishable accumulation of wisdom.

original: gzhan yang / ye shes kyi tshogs rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang / ye shes kyi tshogs rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: “Moreover, there are four aspects of the accumulation of wisdom.

original: rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four aspects?

original: sbyin pa bzhi po 'di dag ni ye shes kyi tshogs rab tu gsog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyin pa bzhi po 'di dag ni ye shes kyi tshogs rab tu gsog par 'gyur te /
translated: These four kinds of generosity will accumulate the wisdom accumulation.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: chos smra ba rnams la gro ga dang / snyu gu dang / snag tsha dang / glegs bam sbyin pa dang / chos smra ba rnams las chos kyi stan sna tshogs sbyin pa dang / chos smra ba rnams la rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang /
analyzed: chos smra ba rnams la gro ga dang / snyu gu dang / snag tsha dang / glegs bam sbyin pa dang / chos smra ba rnams las chos kyi stan sna tshogs sbyin pa dang / chos smra ba rnams la rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang /
translated: It is to give paper, pens, ink, and books to Dharma teachers. It is to give Dharma teachers various Dharma seats. It is to give Dharma teachers material gifts and honor them.🔽

original: tshigs su bcad pa thams cad sbyin pa dang / chos smra ba rnams la chos bsdu ba'i phyir g-yo med par legs so zhes bya ba sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa thams cad sbyin pa dang / chos smra ba rnams la chos bsdu ba'i phyir g-yo med par legs so zhes bya ba sbyin pa ste /
translated: They are giving paper, pens, ink, and books to Dharma teachers; giving various Dharma seats to Dharma teachers; giving all verses of Dharma to Dharma teachers; and giving the word “excellent” to Dharma teachers without deceit in order to collect the Dharma.

original: sbyin pa bzhi po de dag ni ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa bzhi po de dag ni ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur ro //
translated: These four types of giving will accumulate the accumulation of wisdom.

original: srung ba bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: srung ba bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur te /
translated: “There are four types of protection that will accumulate the accumulation of wisdom for bodhisattvas.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: chos smra ba rnams jo bo bzhin du srung ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba srung ba dang / yul dang / ljongs kyi phyogs @237b srung ba dang / phan pa'i dngos po srung ba ste /
analyzed: chos smra ba rnams jo bo bzhin du srung ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba srung ba dang / yul dang / ljongs kyi phyogs @237b srung ba dang / phan pa'i dngos po srung ba ste /
translated: protecting the Dharma teachers as if they were the Lord, protecting the roots of virtue, protecting the regions and the countries, and protecting the beneficial things.

original: srung ba bzhi po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srung ba bzhi po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur ro //
translated: These four protections cause the bodhisattvas to accumulate the collection of wisdom.

original: nye bar rton pa bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nye bar rton pa bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur te /
translated: These four supports cause the bodhisattvas to accumulate the collection of wisdom.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: chos smra ba rnams la zang zing gis nye bar rton pa dang / chos kyis nye bar rton pa dang / shes rab kyis nye bar rton pa dang / ye shes kyis nye bar rton pa ste /
analyzed: chos smra ba rnams la zang zing gis nye bar rton pa dang / chos kyis nye bar rton pa dang / shes rab kyis nye bar rton pa dang / ye shes kyis nye bar rton pa ste /
translated: supporting the Dharma teachers with material things, supporting them with the Dharma, supporting them with wisdom, and supporting them with knowledge.

original: nye bar rton pa bzhi po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur ro; ;stobs lnga po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nye bar rton pa bzhi po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur ro; ;stobs lnga po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur te /
translated: “There are five powers that are the bodhisattvas’ accumulation of wisdom.

original: lnga gang zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the five?

original: mos pa'i phyir dad pa'i stobs dang / thos pa tshol pa'i phyir brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / byang chub kyi sems mi brjed pa'i phyir dran pa'i stobs dang / mnyam pa nyid la sems nges par sems pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang /
analyzed: mos pa'i phyir dad pa'i stobs dang / thos pa tshol pa'i phyir brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / byang chub kyi sems mi brjed pa'i phyir dran pa'i stobs dang / mnyam pa nyid la sems nges par sems pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang /
translated: They are the power of faith, which is for the sake of devotion; the power of diligence, which is for the sake of seeking learning; the power of mindfulness, which is for the sake of not forgetting the mind of awakening; the power of absorption, which is for the sake of contemplating the mind in terms of sameness;

original: thos pa'i stobs kyi phyir shes rab kyi stobs te /
analyzed: thos pa'i stobs kyi phyir shes rab kyi stobs te /
translated: and the power of insight, which is for the sake of the power of learning.

original: stobs lnga po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stobs lnga po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur ro //
