translated: These five powers are the bodhisattvas’ accumulation of wisdom.”

original: tshul khrims bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshul khrims bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur te /
translated: These four kinds of morality gather the equipment of knowledge for the bodhisattvas.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: chos la rab tu dga' ba'i tshul khrims dang / chos @238a *//
analyzed: chos la rab tu dga' ba'i tshul khrims dang / chos @238a *//
translated: the morality of delight in the Dharma,🔽the morality of seeking the Dharma,🔽the morality of reflecting on the Dharma, and

original: yongs su tshol ba'i tshul khrims dang / chos la nges par sems pa'i tshul khrims dang / byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'i tshul khrims te /
analyzed: yongs su tshol ba'i tshul khrims dang / chos la nges par sems pa'i tshul khrims dang / byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'i tshul khrims te /
translated: the morality of dedicating to enlightenment.

original: tshul khrims bzhi po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims bzhi po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur ro //
translated: These four moralities gather the equipment of knowledge for the bodhisattvas.

original: bzod pa bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bzod pa bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur te /
translated: These four kinds of patience gather the equipment of knowledge for the bodhisattvas.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: chos tshol ba la brtson pas ngan du brjod pa dang / ngan du smra ba'i tshig gi lam bzod pa dang / chos tshol ba la brtson pas rlung dang / nyi ma dang / grang ba dang / tsha ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa bzod pa dang /
analyzed: chos tshol ba la brtson pas ngan du brjod pa dang / ngan du smra ba'i tshig gi lam bzod pa dang / chos tshol ba la brtson pas rlung dang / nyi ma dang / grang ba dang / tsha ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa bzod pa dang /
translated: They are to endure the criticism and harsh words of others while striving to seek the Dharma; to endure wind, sun, cold, heat, hunger, and thirst while striving to seek the Dharma;

original: chos tshol ba la brtson pas mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang mthun par 'jug pa'i bzod pa dang / chos tshol ba la brtson pas stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i chos la bzod pa ste /
analyzed: chos tshol ba la brtson pas mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang mthun par 'jug pa'i bzod pa dang / chos tshol ba la brtson pas stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i chos la bzod pa ste /
translated: They are: patience with regard to unpleasant speech and unpleasant words, patience with regard to wind, sun, cold, heat, hunger, and thirst, patience with regard to acting in harmony with preceptors and teachers, and patience with regard to emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: bzod pa bzhi po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzod pa bzhi po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur ro //
translated: These four kinds of patience will gather the accumulation of wisdom for bodhisattvas.

original: brtson 'grus bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur te /
translated: “There are four kinds of effort that will gather the accumulation of wisdom for bodhisattvas.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: nyan pa'i brtson 'grus dang / 'dzin pa'i brtson 'grus dang / bstan pa'i brtson 'grus dang / nan tan gyi brtson 'grus te /
analyzed: nyan pa'i brtson 'grus dang / 'dzin pa'i brtson 'grus dang / bstan pa'i brtson 'grus dang / nan tan gyi brtson 'grus te /
translated: the diligence of listening, the diligence of retaining, the diligence of teaching, and the diligence of practice.

original: brtson @238b 'grus bzhi po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtson @238b 'grus bzhi po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur ro //
translated: These four kinds of diligence will gather the bodhisattvas’ accumulations of wisdom.

original: bsam gtan gyi yan lag bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi yan lag bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur te /
translated: “There are four branches of meditation that will gather the bodhisattvas’ accumulations of wisdom.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: dben pa dang / rtse gcig pa dang / bsam gtan dang / mngon par shes pa tshol ba dang; sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la rton pa ste /🔽bsam gtan bzhi po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dben pa dang / rtse gcig pa dang / bsam gtan dang / mngon par shes pa tshol ba dang; sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la rton pa ste / bsam gtan bzhi po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur ro //
translated: isolation, one-pointedness, meditation, and seeking superknowledge, and relying on the wisdom of the buddhas.🔽These four meditations will gather the bodhisattvas’ accumulations of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi snang ba bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi snang ba bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur te /
translated: “There are four kinds of illumination of insight that will gather the bodhisattvas’ accumulations of wisdom.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: chad pa la mi gnas pa dang / rtag pa la mi 'jug pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang mi 'gal ba dang / bdag med pa la bzod pa ste /
analyzed: chad pa la mi gnas pa dang / rtag pa la mi 'jug pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang mi 'gal ba dang / bdag med pa la bzod pa ste /
translated: not abiding in annihilation, not engaging in permanence, not contradicting dependent origination, and being patient with selflessness.🔽These four kinds of wisdom light

original: shes rab kyi snang ba bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi snang ba bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur ro //
translated: are the accumulation of wisdom for bodhisattvas.🔽These four kinds of skillful means

original: thabs bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: thabs bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur te /
translated: are the accumulation of wisdom for bodhisattvas.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: 'jig rten gyi rjes su 'jug pa dang / chos kyi rjes su 'jug pa dang / sems can gyi rjes su 'jug pa dang / ye shes kyi rjes su 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi rjes su 'jug pa dang / chos kyi rjes su 'jug pa dang / sems can gyi rjes su 'jug pa dang / ye shes kyi rjes su 'jug pa ste /
translated: following worldly conventions, following the Dharma, following sentient beings, and following wisdom.

original: thabs bzhi po de dag ni byang @239a *//
analyzed: thabs bzhi po de dag ni byang @239a *//
translated: These four kinds of skillful means

original: chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur ro //
translated: are the accumulation of wisdom for bodhisattvas.

original: lam bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lam bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur te /
translated: These four paths are the accumulation of the bodhisatvas’ wisdom.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i lam dang / sa'i lam dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi lam dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi lam ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i lam dang / sa'i lam dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi lam dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi lam ste /
translated: the path of the perfections, the path of the levels, the path of the factors of awakening, and the path of the wisdom of omniscience.

original: lam bzhi po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lam bzhi po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur ro //
translated: These four paths are the accumulation of the bodhisatvas’ wisdom.

original: mi ngoms pa bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi ngoms pa bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur te /
translated: These four kinds of insatiable attitude are the accumulation of the bodhisatvas’ wisdom.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: thos pas mi ngoms pa dang / bstan pas mi ngoms pa dang / dpyod pas mi ngoms pa dang / shes pas mi ngoms pa ste /
analyzed: thos pas mi ngoms pa dang / bstan pas mi ngoms pa dang / dpyod pas mi ngoms pa dang / shes pas mi ngoms pa ste /
translated: insatiable attitude towards listening, insatiable attitude towards teaching, insatiable attitude towards analysis, and insatiable attitude towards knowledge.

original: mi ngoms pa bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi ngoms pa bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshogs gsog par 'gyur ro //
translated: These four kinds of insatiable attitude are the accumulation of the bodhisatvas’ wisdom.

original: gzhan yang / ye shes kyi tshogs ni gang sems can thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang / chos thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang / ye shes kyi tshogs ni gang sems can thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang / chos thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: Furthermore, the accumulation of wisdom is that which follows all sentient beings and that which follows all phenomena.

original: sbyin pa las kyang ye shes kyi tshogs su blta'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa las kyang ye shes kyi tshogs su blta'o //
translated: The accumulation of wisdom should be seen as arising from generosity.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab las kyang ye shes kyi tshogs su blta'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab las kyang ye shes kyi tshogs su blta'o //
translated: The accumulation of wisdom should be seen as arising from morality, patience, effort, concentration, and wisdom.

original: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms @239b las kyang ye shes kyi tshogs su blta ste /
analyzed: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms @239b las kyang ye shes kyi tshogs su blta ste /
translated: The accumulation of wisdom should be seen as arising from loving kindness, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rtsom pa ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ye shes kyis grub ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rtsom pa ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ye shes kyis grub ste /
translated: All the endeavors of bodhisattvas are accomplished through wisdom.

original: ye shes sngon du 'gro ba /
analyzed: ye shes sngon du 'gro ba /
translated: Wisdom is foremost.

original: ye shes la rton pa /
analyzed: ye shes la rton pa /
translated: Wisdom is relied upon.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la gnas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la gnas pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are based on the wisdom of omniscience.

original: ye shes dang ldan pa thams cad rton pa yin no //
analyzed: ye shes dang ldan pa thams cad rton pa yin no //
translated: Those who possess wisdom are reliable.

original: bdud thams cad kyis kyang de la glags mi rnyed do //
analyzed: bdud thams cad kyis kyang de la glags mi rnyed do //
translated: And no demon can find an opportunity to harm them.

original: de la sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi snod thams cad kyang nye bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi snod thams cad kyang nye bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: They become vessels for all the Buddha’s teachings.

original: sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyang 'thob bo //
translated: They receive the blessings of the Buddhas.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyang thob par byed de /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyang thob par byed de /
translated: They attain the wisdom of omniscience.

original: 'di ni ye shes kyi tshogs mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ye shes kyi tshogs mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the inexhaustible accumulation of wisdom.

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / ye shes kyi tshogs mi zad pa'o; ;btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / ye shes kyi tshogs mi zad pa'o; ;btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: these are the bodhisattvas’ inexhaustible accumulation of merit and the inexhaustible accumulation of wisdom.🔽Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa'ang mi zad pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa'ang mi zad pa ste /
translated: the bodhisattvas’ cultivation of the four establishments of mindfulness is also inexhaustible.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / tshor ba la tshor ba'i rjes su dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / sems la sems kyi rjes su lta ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang; chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //🔽de la byang chub sems dpa'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni ji ltar na byang chub @240a *//
analyzed: lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / tshor ba la tshor ba'i rjes su dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / sems la sems kyi rjes su lta ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang; chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o // de la byang chub sems dpa'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni ji ltar na byang chub @240a *//
translated: The four establishments of mindfulness are: the establishment of mindfulness that observes the body in the body, the establishment of mindfulness that observes feelings in feelings, the establishment of mindfulness that observes mind in mind, and the establishment of mindfulness that observes phenomena in phenomena.🔽What is the bodhisattvas’ establishment of mindfulness that observes the body in the body?

original: sems dpa' lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas she na /
analyzed: sems dpa' lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas she na /
translated: How do bodhisattvas observe the body in the body and abide?

original: de rang gi lus dang / gzhan gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: de rang gi lus dang / gzhan gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: They observe and abide in their own body and in the bodies of others.

original: lus kyi sngon gyi mtha' la'ang rtog /🔽lus kyi phyi ma'i mtha' la'ang rtog /
analyzed: lus kyi sngon gyi mtha' la'ang rtog / lus kyi phyi ma'i mtha' la'ang rtog /
translated: They investigate the past of the body.🔽They investigate the future of the body.

original: lus kyi da ltar byung ba la'ang rtog ste /
analyzed: lus kyi da ltar byung ba la'ang rtog ste /
translated: They investigate the present of the body.

original: kye ma 'di ni phyin ci log las byung ba /
analyzed: kye ma 'di ni phyin ci log las byung ba /
translated: “Alas, this arises from error.

original: rgyu dang / rkyen gyis grub pa /
analyzed: rgyu dang / rkyen gyis grub pa /
translated: It is established by causes and conditions.

original: tshor ba med pa /
analyzed: tshor ba med pa /
translated: It is without feeling,

original: byed pa med pa /
analyzed: byed pa med pa /
translated: without action,

original: bdag po med pa /
analyzed: bdag po med pa /
translated: without owner,

original: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa /
translated: and without possessor.

original: rgyu dang / rkyen rnams kyis byung ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang / rkyen rnams kyis byung ba ste /
translated: It arises from causes and conditions.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / phyi rol gyi rtsva dang / shing gel pa dang / rtsi dang / nags tshal 'di dag rgyu rkyen gyis 'byung zhing tshor ba med pa /
analyzed: dper na / phyi rol gyi rtsva dang / shing gel pa dang / rtsi dang / nags tshal 'di dag rgyu rkyen gyis 'byung zhing tshor ba med pa /
translated: For example, these external grasses, thickets, shrubs, forests, trees, and walls arise from causes and conditions. They are without feeling,

original: byed pa med pa /
analyzed: byed pa med pa /
translated: without action,

original: bdag po med pa /
analyzed: bdag po med pa /
translated: without owner,

original: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa /
translated: and without possessor.

original: de bzhin du bdag gi lus 'di'ang rtsa dang / shing gel pa dang / rtsi dang / nags tshal dang / shing dang / rtsig pa dang / mig yor lta bu ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag gi lus 'di'ang rtsa dang / shing gel pa dang / rtsi dang / nags tshal dang / shing dang / rtsig pa dang / mig yor lta bu ste /
translated: In the same way, this body of mine is like grasses, thickets, shrubs, forests, trees, walls, and optical illusions.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kyis yongs su gzung ba /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kyis yongs su gzung ba /
translated: It is grasped by the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: tshor ba med pa /
analyzed: tshor ba med pa /
translated: It is without feeling,🔽without action,

original: byed pa med pa; bdag po med pa /
analyzed: byed pa med pa; bdag po med pa /
translated: without owner,

original: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa /
translated: and without possessor.

original: bdag dang / bdag gi'am /🔽rtag pa'am / brtan pa'am /
analyzed: bdag dang / bdag gi'am / rtag pa'am / brtan pa'am /
translated: It is not a self or a being,🔽not a soul or a person.🔽It is not permanent, stable,

original: ther zug gam /🔽mi g-yo ba'am /
analyzed: ther zug gam / mi g-yo ba'am /
translated: eternal,🔽immovable,

original: mi gnod pa'am /
analyzed: mi gnod pa'am /
translated: or indestructible.

original: mi 'gyur ba'i chos can gyis stong ste /
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba'i chos can gyis stong ste /
translated: It is empty of the nature of an unchanging being.

original: lus 'di la bdag gir mi bya yi /
analyzed: lus 'di la bdag gir mi bya yi /
translated: I will not make this body my own.🔽With this worthless body I will attain the essence,

original: bdag gis snying po med pa'i lus 'dis snying po mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis snying po med pa'i lus 'dis snying po mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o //
translated: which is perfect buddhahood.

original: snying po de'ang gang @240b zhe na /
analyzed: snying po de'ang gang @240b zhe na /
translated: And what is that essence?

original: gang 'di de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: gang 'di de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ste /
translated: It is the body of the Tathāgata.

original: bdag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku /
analyzed: bdag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku /
translated: I will attain the body of the Tathāgata,

original: chos kyi sku /
analyzed: chos kyi sku /
translated: the Dharma body,

original: rdo rje'i sku /
analyzed: rdo rje'i sku /
translated: the vajra body,

original: mi shigs pa'i sku /
analyzed: mi shigs pa'i sku /
translated: the indestructible body,

original: brtan pa'i sku /
analyzed: brtan pa'i sku /
translated: the stable body,

original: 'jig rten gsum po thams cad las khyad par 'phags pa'i sku de bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po thams cad las khyad par 'phags pa'i sku de bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: the body that is superior to the entire triple world.

original: bdag gis lus nyes pa du ma'i skyon chags mod kyi /
analyzed: bdag gis lus nyes pa du ma'i skyon chags mod kyi /
translated: Although this body of mine is flawed with many faults,

original: 'on kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku nyes pa thams cad dang bral ba thob par bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: 'on kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku nyes pa thams cad dang bral ba thob par bya'o snyam mo //
translated: nevertheless I will attain the body of the Tathāgata, which is free from all faults.

original: des phan yon mthong bas na so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis 'byung ba chen po'i gnas kyi lus spong ste /
analyzed: des phan yon mthong bas na so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis 'byung ba chen po'i gnas kyi lus spong ste /
translated: Seeing the benefits, he abandons the body that is the basis of the great elements through the power of discernment.

original: bdag gi lus 'di'ang sems can thams cad kyi bya ba ci yod pa la zad par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gi lus 'di'ang sems can thams cad kyi bya ba ci yod pa la zad par bya'o //
translated: I will exhaust this body of mine in whatever way is necessary for all sentient beings.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / phyi rol gyi sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi po de dag sgo sna tshogs dang / rnam pa sna tshogs dang / dmigs pa sna tshogs dang / rnam grangs sna tshogs dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / dper na / phyi rol gyi sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi po de dag sgo sna tshogs dang / rnam pa sna tshogs dang / dmigs pa sna tshogs dang / rnam grangs sna tshogs dang /
translated: For example,🔽the four great elements—the earth element, the water element, the fire element, and the air element—are the enjoyment and the property of all sentient beings through various avenues, in various forms, with various objects, in various enumerations,

original: yo byad sna tshogs dang / longs spyod sna tshogs kyis sems can thams cad kyi longs spyod dang / yongs su spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yo byad sna tshogs dang / longs spyod sna tshogs kyis sems can thams cad kyi longs spyod dang / yongs su spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: with various implements, and with various enjoyments.

original: de bzhin du bdag gi lus 'byung ba chen po bzhi la gnas pa 'di'ang sgo sna tshogs dang / rnam pa sna tshogs dang / dmigs pa sna tshogs dang / rnam grangs sna tshogs dang / yo byad sna tshogs dang / longs spyod sna tshogs kyis rgya cher sems can thams cad kyi longs spyod du 'gyur bar bya'o zhes des don @241a *//
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag gi lus 'byung ba chen po bzhi la gnas pa 'di'ang sgo sna tshogs dang / rnam pa sna tshogs dang / dmigs pa sna tshogs dang / rnam grangs sna tshogs dang / yo byad sna tshogs dang / longs spyod sna tshogs kyis rgya cher sems can thams cad kyi longs spyod du 'gyur bar bya'o zhes des don @241a *//
translated: In the same way, this body of mine, which is based on the four great elements, should become the enjoyment of all beings through various doors, various aspects, various objects, various categories, various implements, and various enjoyments.

original: gyi dbang 'di mthong bas lus sdug bsngal bar yang rtog cing sems can la lta ba'i phyir lus kyi sdug bsngal gyis kyang yongs su mi skyo'o //
analyzed: gyi dbang 'di mthong bas lus sdug bsngal bar yang rtog cing sems can la lta ba'i phyir lus kyi sdug bsngal gyis kyang yongs su mi skyo'o //
translated: Because of seeing this power of the goal, he thinks of the body as suffering, but he is not discouraged by the suffering of the body because he looks at beings.

original: lus la mi rtag par rtog cing skye ba dang / shi 'pho bas kyang yongs su mi skyo'o //
analyzed: lus la mi rtag par rtog cing skye ba dang / shi 'pho bas kyang yongs su mi skyo'o //
translated: He thinks of the body as impermanent, but he is not discouraged by birth and death.

original: lus la bdag med par rtog cing sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir yang yongs su mi skyo'o //
analyzed: lus la bdag med par rtog cing sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir yang yongs su mi skyo'o //
translated: He thinks of the body as selfless, but he is not discouraged by the ripening of all beings.

original: lus la zhi bar rtog cing zhi bar btang snyoms su'ang mi ltung ngo //
analyzed: lus la zhi bar rtog cing zhi bar btang snyoms su'ang mi ltung ngo //
translated: They contemplate the body as peace, but do not fall into the indifference of peace.

original: lus la stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / dben par yang rtog la; lus kyi stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / dben pa'i mthar yang mi ltung ngo //
analyzed: lus la stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / dben par yang rtog la; lus kyi stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / dben pa'i mthar yang mi ltung ngo //
translated: They contemplate the body as emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, and isolation, but do not fall into the extreme of the emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, and isolation of the body.

original: de bzhin du lus la mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang / mi skye ba dang / ma byung ba dang / dngos po med pa dang / ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par dag par yang rtog la /
analyzed: de bzhin du lus la mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang / mi skye ba dang / ma byung ba dang / dngos po med pa dang / ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par dag par yang rtog la /
translated: Similarly, they contemplate the body as unconditioned, unborn, non-arisen, non-existent, and pure just as it is,

original: lus mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang / mi skye ba dang / ma byung ba dang / dngos po med pa dang / ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par dag pa'i mthar yang mi ltung ngo //
analyzed: lus mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang / mi skye ba dang / ma byung ba dang / dngos po med pa dang / ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par dag pa'i mthar yang mi ltung ngo //
translated: but do not fall into the extreme of the unconditioned, unborn, non-arisen, non-existent, and pure just as it is of the body.

original: lus tshor ba med pa dang / lus byed pa med pa dang / lus bdag por med pa dang / lus yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang / lus dbyer med pa dang / lus ro gcig pa dang / lus nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid dang /
analyzed: lus tshor ba med pa dang / lus byed pa med pa dang / lus bdag por med pa dang / lus yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang / lus dbyer med pa dang / lus ro gcig pa dang / lus nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid dang /
translated: He should also consider the body as devoid of sensation, devoid of action, devoid of an owner, devoid of appropriation, indivisible, of one taste, of the nature of space,

original: lus rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das @241b par yang rtog la /
analyzed: lus rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das @241b par yang rtog la /
translated: and naturally completely liberated.

original: lus g-yo ba med pa dang / byed pa med pa dang / bdag po med pa dang / 'dzin pa med pa dang / dbyer med pa dang / ro gcig pa dang / nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar yang mi ltung ngo //
analyzed: lus g-yo ba med pa dang / byed pa med pa dang / bdag po med pa dang / 'dzin pa med pa dang / dbyer med pa dang / ro gcig pa dang / nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar yang mi ltung ngo //
translated: He should not fall into the extreme of the body being motionless, inactive, ownerless, ungraspable, indivisible, of one taste, of the nature of space, and naturally completely liberated.

original: lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa de lus la rdzas dang / snying po yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa de lus la rdzas dang / snying po yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: “When he attends to the body by way of the body, he does not see any substance or essence in the body.

original: de nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pas nang na gnas pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi skabs mi 'byed do //
analyzed: de nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pas nang na gnas pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi skabs mi 'byed do //
translated: He does not give an opportunity to the afflictions that arise internally, by remaining in the contemplation of the internal body.

original: de phyi rol gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pas phyi rol gyi rjes su song ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang lhan cig tu mi gnas so //
analyzed: de phyi rol gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pas phyi rol gyi rjes su song ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang lhan cig tu mi gnas so //
translated: He does not remain with the afflictions that arise externally, by remaining in the contemplation of the external body.

original: de lus nyon mongs pa can ma yin pas yongs su dag pa'i lus kyi las dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: de lus nyon mongs pa can ma yin pas yongs su dag pa'i lus kyi las dang ldan pa yin /
translated: He has a pure bodily action, because his body is not afflicted.

original: de lus kyi las yongs su dag pa dang ldan pas lha dang / mi'i nang na mtshan gyis legs par brgyan pa'i lus thob ste /
analyzed: de lus kyi las yongs su dag pa dang ldan pas lha dang / mi'i nang na mtshan gyis legs par brgyan pa'i lus thob ste /
translated: He obtains a body adorned with the major and minor marks in the realms of gods and humans, because he has a pure bodily action.

original: de'i lus mtshan gyis legs par brgyan pas lha dang / mi rnams mngon du 'dod par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i lus mtshan gyis legs par brgyan pas lha dang / mi rnams mngon du 'dod par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: His body, adorned with the major and minor marks, is desired by gods and humans.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva remains in the contemplation of the body.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattvas’ close setting of mindfulness that observes the body in the body.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i tshor ba rnams la tshor ba'i rjes su lta ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' tshor ba la tshor ba'i rjes su lta @242a *//🔽zhing gnas she na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i tshor ba rnams la tshor ba'i rjes su lta ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' tshor ba la tshor ba'i rjes su lta @242a *// zhing gnas she na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattvas’ close setting of mindfulness that observes feelings in feelings?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Here a bodhisattva thinks as follows:

original: tshor ba gang ci'ang rung ste /
analyzed: tshor ba gang ci'ang rung ste /
translated: ‘Whatever feelings there are,🔽all of them are suffering.’

original: de thams cad sdug bsngal ba'o snyam nas des tshor ba shin tu rtogs pa dang / ye shes kyis rtogs pa dang / shes rab kyis rtogs pa dang / nye bar zhi bas rtogs pas bde ba'i tshor ba'ang tshor bar byed de /
analyzed: de thams cad sdug bsngal ba'o snyam nas des tshor ba shin tu rtogs pa dang / ye shes kyis rtogs pa dang / shes rab kyis rtogs pa dang / nye bar zhi bas rtogs pas bde ba'i tshor ba'ang tshor bar byed de /
translated: With the realization of feelings, with the realization of knowledge, with the realization of wisdom, and with the realization of peace, he experiences a pleasant feeling.

original: de 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal yang bag la nyal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal yang bag la nyal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though he experiences a pleasant feeling, he does not become attached to it.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas reg na'ang ngan song dang / mi khom par skyes pa'i sems can thams cad la snying rje chen po skyed de /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas reg na'ang ngan song dang / mi khom par skyes pa'i sems can thams cad la snying rje chen po skyed de /
translated: When touched by painful feelings, he generates great compassion for all sentient beings born in the lower realms and in situations lacking opportunity.

original: de khong khro ba'i bag la nyal yang bag la nyal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de khong khro ba'i bag la nyal yang bag la nyal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And even though he has the latent tendency to anger, he does not follow that latent tendency.

original: bde ba'ang ma yin sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin pa'i tshor bas reg ste /
analyzed: bde ba'ang ma yin sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin pa'i tshor bas reg ste /
translated: When touched by neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feelings,

original: bde ba'ang ma yin sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'ang tshor bar byed de /
analyzed: bde ba'ang ma yin sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'ang tshor bar byed de /
translated: he experiences neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feelings.

original: de ma rig pa'i bag la nyal yang bag la nyal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ma rig pa'i bag la nyal yang bag la nyal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And even though he has the latent tendency to ignorance, he does not follow that latent tendency.

original: de tshor ba dang ldan pa'i dran pas tshor ba gang ci'ang rung ste /🔽bde ba'am / sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: de tshor ba dang ldan pa'i dran pas tshor ba gang ci'ang rung ste / bde ba'am / sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: With mindfulness endowed with feelings, whatever feelings he experiences🔽—whether pleasant,

original: bde ba'ang ma yin sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin pa tshor na /
analyzed: bde ba'ang ma yin sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin pa tshor na /
translated: unpleasant, or neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant—

original: tshor ba de dag thams cad las 'byung ba'i ye shes mthong ba sgom mo //
analyzed: tshor ba de dag thams cad las 'byung ba'i ye shes mthong ba sgom mo //
translated: he cultivates the wisdom that sees the origin and cessation of those feelings.

original: de sems can thams cad kyi tshor ba yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir go gyon te /
analyzed: de sems can thams cad kyi tshor ba yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir go gyon te /
translated: He dons the armor in order to understand the feelings of all sentient beings.

original: sems can 'di dag tshor ba las nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes te /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag tshor ba las nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes te /
translated: “These sentient beings do not understand the escape from feelings as it truly is.

original: de dag 'byung ba mi shes @242b bas bde ba'i tshor bas reg na ni rjes su chags par 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag 'byung ba mi shes @242b bas bde ba'i tshor bas reg na ni rjes su chags par 'gyur /
translated: When they experience a pleasant feeling, they become attached.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor bar reg na ni khong khro bar 'gyur /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor bar reg na ni khong khro bar 'gyur /
translated: When they experience a painful feeling, they become angry.

original: sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin bde ba'ang ma yin pa'i tshor bas reg na ni rmongs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin bde ba'ang ma yin pa'i tshor bas reg na ni rmongs par 'gyur te /
translated: When they experience a feeling that is neither painful nor pleasant, they become confused.

original: bdag ni shes rab dang / ye shes su ldan pa'i tshor bas tshor ba thams cad rgyun chad pa'i thabs mkhas pa dang / snying rje chen pos zin pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs kyis sems can de dag gi tshor ba thams cad bsal ba'i phyir chos bstan to snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag ni shes rab dang / ye shes su ldan pa'i tshor bas tshor ba thams cad rgyun chad pa'i thabs mkhas pa dang / snying rje chen pos zin pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs kyis sems can de dag gi tshor ba thams cad bsal ba'i phyir chos bstan to snyam mo //
translated: I will teach the Dharma to those sentient beings in order to eliminate all their feelings, with the skillful means of the wisdom and knowledge of the cessation of all feelings, and with the accumulation of roots of virtue embraced by great compassion.”

original: yang ci'i phyir tshor ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir tshor ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: “And why are they called feelings?”

original: ma rig pas rtogs pa'i tshor ba ni sdug bsngal du 'gyur /
analyzed: ma rig pas rtogs pa'i tshor ba ni sdug bsngal du 'gyur /
translated: The feeling that is realized through ignorance is suffering.

original: ye shes kyis rtogs pa'i tshor ba ni bde bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ye shes kyis rtogs pa'i tshor ba ni bde bar 'gyur te /
translated: The feeling that is realized through wisdom is happiness.

original: de la ye shes kyis rtogs pa'i tshor ba ni bde bar 'gyur ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ye shes kyis rtogs pa'i tshor ba ni bde bar 'gyur ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the feeling that is realized through wisdom and is happiness?

original: 'di la bdag gam /
analyzed: 'di la bdag gam /
translated: Here, there is no feeling whatsoever of a self,

original: sems can nam /🔽srog gam / skye ba po'am /
analyzed: sems can nam / srog gam / skye ba po'am /
translated: a sentient being,🔽a life-force, a person,

original: gso ba'am / skyes bu'am /
analyzed: gso ba'am / skyes bu'am /
translated: a human being,

original: gang zag gam /🔽shed las skyes sam /
analyzed: gang zag gam / shed las skyes sam /
translated: an individual,🔽a human,

original: shed bu'ang rung /
analyzed: shed bu'ang rung /
translated: or a human body.🔽Feeling is the manifestation of attachment.

original: gang gis kyang tshor bar 'gyur ba med kyi mngon par zhen pa ni tshor ba'o //🔽yongs su 'dzin pa ni tshor ba'o //🔽nye bar len pa ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis kyang tshor bar 'gyur ba med kyi mngon par zhen pa ni tshor ba'o // yongs su 'dzin pa ni tshor ba'o // nye bar len pa ni tshor ba'o //
translated: Feeling is grasping.🔽Feeling is appropriation.

original: dmigs pa ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni tshor ba'o //
translated: Feeling is objectification.

original: phyin ci log ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log ni tshor ba'o //
translated: Feeling is error.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni tshor ba'o //
translated: Feeling is conceptualization.

original: lta ba dang / bag la nyal ba ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: lta ba dang / bag la nyal ba ni tshor ba'o //
translated: Feeling is view and latent tendencies.

original: mig tu 'du shes pa ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: mig tu 'du shes pa ni tshor ba'o //
translated: Feeling is the perception of the eye.

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid du 'du shes pa ni tshor ba'o //🔽gzugs su @243a *//
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid du 'du shes pa ni tshor ba'o // gzugs su @243a *//
translated: Likewise, the perception of ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind is feeling.

original: 'du shes pa ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: 'du shes pa ni tshor ba'o //
translated: The perception of form is feeling.

original: de bzhin du sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos su 'du shes pa ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos su 'du shes pa ni tshor ba'o //
translated: Likewise, the perception of sound, smell, taste, touch, and mental phenomena is feeling.

original: gang yang mig dang / gzugs su 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen las skyes pa'i bde ba'ang rung /🔽sdug bsngal ba'ang rung /
analyzed: gang yang mig dang / gzugs su 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen las skyes pa'i bde ba'ang rung / sdug bsngal ba'ang rung /
translated: Moreover, whatever arises from the condition of contact through the union of eye and form, whether it is pleasant,

original: bde ba'ang ma yin sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin pa'ang rung ste 'di ni tshor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba'ang ma yin sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin pa'ang rung ste 'di ni tshor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: unpleasant, or neither, that is called feeling.

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sgrar 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen dang / sna dang / drir 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen dang / lce dang / ror 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen dang / lus dang / reg byar 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sgrar 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen dang / sna dang / drir 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen dang / lce dang / ror 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen dang / lus dang / reg byar 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen dang /
translated: Likewise, the condition of contact through the union of ear and sound, nose and smell, tongue and taste, body and touch,

original: gang yang yid dang / chos su 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba'ang rung /
analyzed: gang yang yid dang / chos su 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba'ang rung /
translated: It is the feeling that arises from the condition of the contact of the mind and mental phenomena.

original: sdug bsngal ba'ang rung /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'ang rung /
translated: It may be pleasant,🔽or unpleasant,

original: bde ba'ang ma yin sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin pa'ang rung ste 'di ni tshor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba'ang ma yin sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin pa'ang rung ste 'di ni tshor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: or neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: gzhan yang / rnam grangs su na tshor ba ni gcig pu kho na ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rnam grangs su na tshor ba ni gcig pu kho na ste /
translated: “Moreover, there is a single feeling,

original: gang 'di sems kyi rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'di sems kyi rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: which is the awareness of the mind.

original: tshor ba gnyis te /
analyzed: tshor ba gnyis te /
translated: “There are two kinds of feeling:🔽inner and outer.

original: gang 'di nang gi dang / phyi'o; ;tshor ba gsum ste /
analyzed: gang 'di nang gi dang / phyi'o; ;tshor ba gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of feeling:

original: gang 'di 'das pa rnam par rig pa dang / ma 'ongs pa rnam par rig pa dang / da ltar byung ba rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'di 'das pa rnam par rig pa dang / ma 'ongs pa rnam par rig pa dang / da ltar byung ba rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: the awareness of the past, the awareness of the future, and the awareness of the present.

original: tshor ba bzhi ste /
analyzed: tshor ba bzhi ste /
translated: “There are four kinds of feeling:

original: gang 'di khams bzhi rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'di khams bzhi rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: the awareness of the four elements.

original: tshor ba lnga ste /
analyzed: tshor ba lnga ste /
translated: “There are five kinds of feeling:

original: gang 'di phung po lnga yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'di phung po lnga yid la byed pa'o //
translated: the awareness of the five aggregates.

original: tshor ba drug ste /
analyzed: tshor ba drug ste /
translated: “There are six kinds of feeling:

original: gang 'di skye mched drug la yongs su rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'di skye mched drug la yongs su rtog pa'o //
translated: the investigation of the six sense sources.

original: tshor ba bdun te /
analyzed: tshor ba bdun te /
translated: “There are seven kinds of feeling:

original: @243b gang 'di rnam par shes pa gnas pa bdun no //
analyzed: @243b gang 'di rnam par shes pa gnas pa bdun no //
translated: These are the seven abodes of consciousness.

original: tshor ba brgyad de /
analyzed: tshor ba brgyad de /
translated: There are eight kinds of feelings:

original: gang 'di log pa'i sbyor ba brgyad do //
analyzed: gang 'di log pa'i sbyor ba brgyad do //
translated: These are the eight wrong practices.

original: tshor ba dgu ste /
analyzed: tshor ba dgu ste /
translated: There are nine kinds of feelings:

original: gang 'di sems can gyi gnas dgu'o //
analyzed: gang 'di sems can gyi gnas dgu'o //
translated: These are the nine abodes of sentient beings.

original: tshor ba bcu ste /
analyzed: tshor ba bcu ste /
translated: There are ten kinds of feelings:

original: gang 'di mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams so //
analyzed: gang 'di mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams so //
translated: These are the ten unwholesome courses of action.

original: 'di ni tshor ba kun gyi tshul te /
analyzed: 'di ni tshor ba kun gyi tshul te /
translated: This is the way of all feelings.

original: dmigs pa ji snyed pa de snyed du yid la byed do //
analyzed: dmigs pa ji snyed pa de snyed du yid la byed do //
translated: As many as are the objects, so many are the mental activities.

original: ji snyed du yid la byed pa de snyed du yongs su rtog pa'o //
analyzed: ji snyed du yid la byed pa de snyed du yongs su rtog pa'o //
translated: As many as are the mental activities, so many are the conceptual thoughts.

original: ji snyed du yongs su rtog pa de snyed du tshor ba ste /
analyzed: ji snyed du yongs su rtog pa de snyed du tshor ba ste /
translated: As many as are the conceptual thoughts, so many are the feelings.

original: de'i phyir na sems can tshad med pa rnams kyi tshor ba tshad med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na sems can tshad med pa rnams kyi tshor ba tshad med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the feelings of limitless sentient beings are limitless.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' tshor ba rnams la tshor ba'i rjes su lta zhing gnas pas sems can thams cad kyi tshor ba skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gnas pa shes pa bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' tshor ba rnams la tshor ba'i rjes su lta zhing gnas pas sems can thams cad kyi tshor ba skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gnas pa shes pa bskyed par bya'o //
translated: “Here, the bodhisattva, while contemplating and observing feelings, should generate the knowledge of the arising, abiding, and cessation of the feelings of all sentient beings.

original: gang sems can thams cad kyi tshor ba skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gnas pa dang; dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i tshor ba shes pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshor ba rnams la tshor ba'i rjes su lta ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang sems can thams cad kyi tshor ba skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gnas pa dang; dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i tshor ba shes pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshor ba rnams la tshor ba'i rjes su lta ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva’s mindfulness that observes feelings is the knowledge of the arising, ceasing, and abiding of the feelings of all sentient beings, as well as the knowledge of their virtuous and nonvirtuous feelings.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sems la sems kyi rjes su lta ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sems la sems kyi rjes su lta ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattvas’ mindfulness that observes the mind?

original: gang byang chub sems dpa' de'i byang chub kyi sems ma brjed pa dran pas bsrungs shing mi g-yeng ba ste /
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa' de'i byang chub kyi sems ma brjed pa dran pas bsrungs shing mi g-yeng ba ste /
translated: It is the bodhisattvas’ mindfulness that protects the mind of awakening from being forgotten and from being distracted.

original: de sems la 'di ltar rtog go /
analyzed: de sems la 'di ltar rtog go /
translated: They think about the mind in the following way:

original: sems ni skyes nas zhig cing zhu ste mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sems ni skyes nas zhig cing zhu ste mi gnas pa'o //
translated: ‘The mind arises, ceases, and dissolves, and does not remain.

original: nang na'ang mi 'dug /
analyzed: nang na'ang mi 'dug /
translated: It does not remain within,

original: phyi rol tu'ang ma 'phos /
analyzed: phyi rol tu'ang ma 'phos /
translated: nor does it go outside.

original: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs te /
translated: It is not perceived as being both, nor as being neither.

original: gang bdag gi @244a *//
analyzed: gang bdag gi @244a *//
translated: It is not the self,

original: byang chub kyi sems dang po skyes pa de ni zad cing 'gags te yal zhing med par gyur pas yul na mi gnas /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems dang po skyes pa de ni zad cing 'gags te yal zhing med par gyur pas yul na mi gnas /
translated: The first arising of bodhicitta is exhausted, ceases, and vanishes, and so it does not abide in any place.

original: phyogs na mi gnas te /
analyzed: phyogs na mi gnas te /
translated: It does not abide in any direction.

original: de ni gdags par mi nus so //🔽sems bskyed pa gang gis byang chub kyi phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams yang dag par bsgrubs pa de dag kyang zad cing 'gags te /
analyzed: de ni gdags par mi nus so // sems bskyed pa gang gis byang chub kyi phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams yang dag par bsgrubs pa de dag kyang zad cing 'gags te /
translated: It cannot be labeled.

original: yal zhing med par gyur bas yul na mi gnas /
analyzed: yal zhing med par gyur bas yul na mi gnas /
translated: The roots of virtue that are accomplished for the sake of awakening by the arising of bodhicitta are also exhausted, cease, and vanish, and so they do not abide in any place.

original: phyogs na mi gnas te /
analyzed: phyogs na mi gnas te /
translated: They do not abide in any direction.

original: de'ang gdags par mi nus so //
analyzed: de'ang gdags par mi nus so //
translated: They cannot be labeled.

original: sems bskyed pa gang dag gis dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa de dag kyang de'i rang bzhin dang / de'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa gang dag gis dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa de dag kyang de'i rang bzhin dang / de'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The roots of virtue that are dedicated to awakening by the arising of bodhicitta are also of that nature and have that characteristic.

original: sems kyis sems mi shes so //
analyzed: sems kyis sems mi shes so //
translated: The mind does not know the mind.

original: sems kyis sems mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: sems kyis sems mi mthong ngo //
translated: The mind does not see the mind.

original: sems kyis sems kyi mtshams mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: sems kyis sems kyi mtshams mi sbyor ro //
translated: The mind does not connect with the mind.

original: de la sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mind?

original: gang gis bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o snyam pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o snyam pa ste /
translated: “I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems dang lhan cig mi gnas /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems dang lhan cig mi gnas /
translated: The thought of awakening does not abide together with the thought of roots of virtue.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems de'ang yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dang lhan cig mi gnas /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems de'ang yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dang lhan cig mi gnas /
translated: The thought of roots of virtue does not abide together with the thought of dedication.

original: yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de'ang byang chub kyi sems dang lhan cig mi gnas so snyam du rtog go /
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de'ang byang chub kyi sems dang lhan cig mi gnas so snyam du rtog go /
translated: The thought of dedication does not abide together with the thought of awakening.”

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' de ltar rtog pas mi skrag mi dngang zhing dngang par mi 'gyur na sems @244b la sems kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so //
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' de ltar rtog pas mi skrag mi dngang zhing dngang par mi 'gyur na sems @244b la sems kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so //
translated: If bodhisattvas do not tremble, are not frightened, and are not seized by fear when they think in this way, they watch over the mind with the mind.

original: yang de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: yang de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: They think,

original: rgyu dang / 'bras bu chud mi za ba'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni shin tu za ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang / 'bras bu chud mi za ba'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni shin tu za ba ste /
translated: “Because causes and effects are not wasted, dependent origination is very much alive.

original: sems kyi chos nyid de lta bu yin du zin kyang chos thams cad ni rgyu dang / rkyen la rag las shing g-yo ba med pa /
analyzed: sems kyi chos nyid de lta bu yin du zin kyang chos thams cad ni rgyu dang / rkyen la rag las shing g-yo ba med pa /
translated: Although the nature of mind is like that, all phenomena depend on causes and conditions, are without movement,

original: byed pa med pa /🔽bdag po med pa /
analyzed: byed pa med pa / bdag po med pa /
translated: without activity,🔽without a master,

original: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa ste /
translated: and without ownership.

original: de dag ji ltar 'dod pa de bzhin du rnam par sgrub bo //
analyzed: de dag ji ltar 'dod pa de bzhin du rnam par sgrub bo //
translated: They are accomplished just as one wishes.

original: bdag gis kyang rnam par sgrub pa la brtson par bya ste /
analyzed: bdag gis kyang rnam par sgrub pa la brtson par bya ste /
translated: I too will strive to accomplish this,

original: sems kyi chos nyid 'di'ang mi spang ngo snyam mo //
analyzed: sems kyi chos nyid 'di'ang mi spang ngo snyam mo //
translated: but I will not abandon the nature of mind.

original: de la sems kyi chos nyid ni gang /
analyzed: de la sems kyi chos nyid ni gang /
translated: What is the nature of mind?

original: rnam par sgrub pa ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par sgrub pa ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is accomplishment?

original: sems ni sgyu ma lta bu ste /
analyzed: sems ni sgyu ma lta bu ste /
translated: The mind is like an illusion.

original: 'di la gang sbyin par byed pa gang yang med de /
analyzed: 'di la gang sbyin par byed pa gang yang med de /
translated: There is nothing here that is given away.

original: 'di ni sems kyi chos nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sems kyi chos nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the nature of mind.

original: gang yang bdog pa thams cad yongs su btang ste /
analyzed: gang yang bdog pa thams cad yongs su btang ste /
translated: But when one gives away all one’s possessions

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni rnam par sgrub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni rnam par sgrub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and dedicates them to the purification of a buddha-field, this is called accomplishment.

original: sems ni rmi lam lta bur rab tu zhi ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: sems ni rmi lam lta bur rab tu zhi ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The mind is like a dream, characterized by complete peace.

original: 'di ni sems kyi chos nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sems kyi chos nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the true nature of the mind.

original: gang yang tshul khrims dang / bslab pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang / byang chub kyi tshogs gsog pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyir yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni rnam par sgrub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang tshul khrims dang / bslab pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang / byang chub kyi tshogs gsog pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyir yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni rnam par sgrub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the dedication of all morality, training, ascetic practices, and the accumulation of the stores of merit and knowledge, for the sake of omniscience, is called accomplishment.

original: sems ni mig yor lta bu ste /
analyzed: sems ni mig yor lta bu ste /
translated: The mind is like a mirage,

original: gzod ma nas yongs su ma grub pa 'di ni sems kyi chos nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: gzod ma nas yongs su ma grub pa 'di ni sems kyi chos nyid ces bya'o //
translated: unreal from the very beginning. This is called the true nature of the mind.

original: gang yang bzod pa dang / des pa thams @245a *//
analyzed: gang yang bzod pa dang / des pa thams @245a *//
translated: Moreover, the dedication of all patience and gentleness,

original: cad mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni rnam par sgrub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: cad mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni rnam par sgrub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: for the sake of perfecting patience with respect to the unborn nature of phenomena, is called accomplishment.

original: sems ni smig rgyu lta bu ste /
analyzed: sems ni smig rgyu lta bu ste /
translated: The mind is like a mirage,

original: shin tu dben pa'i phyir dben pa 'di ni sems kyi chos nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu dben pa'i phyir dben pa 'di ni sems kyi chos nyid ces bya'o //
translated: isolated because of complete solitude. This is called the true nature of the mind.

original: gang yang dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la brtson 'grus brtsams pa rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni rnam par sgrub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la brtson 'grus brtsams pa rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni rnam par sgrub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The dedication of all roots of virtue that are undertaken with diligence to the completion of all the qualities of the Buddha is called “accomplishment.

original: sems gi gzugs can ma yin pa /
analyzed: sems gi gzugs can ma yin pa /
translated: The mind is not a form,

original: bstan du med pa /
analyzed: bstan du med pa /
translated: it is not visible,

original: thogs pa med pa /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa /
translated: it is not obstructive,

original: rnam par rig pa med pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa med pa ste /
translated: and it is not a cognition.

original: 'di ni sems kyi chos nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sems kyi chos nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the nature of the mind.

original: gang yang bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni rnam par sgrub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni rnam par sgrub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The dedication of all concentrations, liberations, samādhis, and attainments to the attainment of the Buddha’s samādhi is called “accomplishment.

original: sems ni gzung ba med pa /
analyzed: sems ni gzung ba med pa /
translated: The mind is ungraspable,

original: mtshan ma med pa /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa /
translated: it is signless,

original: bstan du med pa /
analyzed: bstan du med pa /
translated: it is not visible,

original: gnas med pa ste /
analyzed: gnas med pa ste /
translated: and it is baseless.

original: 'di ni sems kyi chos nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sems kyi chos nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the nature of the mind.

original: gang yang dris pa'i tshig rab tu dbye ba bstan pa shes pa thams cad sangs rgyas kyi ye shes yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni rnam par sgrub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang dris pa'i tshig rab tu dbye ba bstan pa shes pa thams cad sangs rgyas kyi ye shes yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni rnam par sgrub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The dedication of all knowledge of the teaching of the analysis of the questions that are asked, in order to perfect the knowledge of the Buddha, is called “accomplishment.

original: sems ni dmigs pa med par mi skye ba ste /
analyzed: sems ni dmigs pa med par mi skye ba ste /
translated: ” The mind does not arise without an object.

original: 'di ni sems kyi chos nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sems kyi chos nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called “the nature of the mind.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams @245b cad thob par bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la dmigs pa'i sems nye bar sgrub pa 'di ni rnam par sgrub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams @245b cad thob par bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la dmigs pa'i sems nye bar sgrub pa 'di ni rnam par sgrub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: ” The establishment of the mind that focuses on all wholesome roots in order to attain all the qualities of the Buddha is called “accomplishment.

original: sems ni rgyu med par mi skye ba ste /
analyzed: sems ni rgyu med par mi skye ba ste /
translated: ” The mind does not arise without a cause.

original: 'di ni sems kyi chos nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sems kyi chos nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called “the nature of the mind.

original: gang yang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad kyi rgyur sems bskyed pa 'di ni rnam par sgrub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad kyi rgyur sems bskyed pa 'di ni rnam par sgrub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: ” The generation of the mind that is the cause of all the qualities of awakening is called “accomplishment.

original: yul drug las rnam par grol bar sems mi skye ba 'di ni sems kyi chos nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: yul drug las rnam par grol bar sems mi skye ba 'di ni sems kyi chos nyid ces bya'o //
translated: ” The mind does not arise liberated from the six sense objects. This is called “the nature of the mind.🔽”

original: gang yang sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi yul gyi rgyur sems mngon par sgrub pa 'di ni rnam par sgrub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi yul gyi rgyur sems mngon par sgrub pa 'di ni rnam par sgrub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The establishment of the mind as the cause of the domain of all the qualities of the Buddha is called “establishment. ”

original: sems la sems kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' mngon par shes pa thob par bya ba'i phyir sems nye bar 'dogs so //
analyzed: sems la sems kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' mngon par shes pa thob par bya ba'i phyir sems nye bar 'dogs so //
translated: The bodhisattva who dwells in the observation of the mind establishes the mind in order to attain the superknowledges.

original: de mngon par shes pa thob pa'i sems kyis sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa rab tu shes te /
analyzed: de mngon par shes pa thob pa'i sems kyis sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa rab tu shes te /
translated: By means of the mind that has attained the superknowledges, he understands the mental activity of all sentient beings.

original: shes nas kyang de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi chos ston to //🔽sems la sems kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' snying rje chen po thob par bya ba'i phyir sems nye bar 'dogs te /
analyzed: shes nas kyang de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi chos ston to // sems la sems kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' snying rje chen po thob par bya ba'i phyir sems nye bar 'dogs te /
translated: Having understood, he teaches the Dharma whose nature is such.🔽The bodhisattva who dwells in the observation of the mind establishes the mind in order to attain great compassion.

original: de snying rje chen po thob pa'i sems kyis sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed pas mi skyo'o //
analyzed: de snying rje chen po thob pa'i sems kyis sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed pas mi skyo'o //
translated: By means of the mind that has attained great compassion, he does not become weary in bringing all sentient beings to maturity.

original: sems la sems kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems zad par bya ba'i phyir sems mi skyed /
analyzed: sems la sems kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems zad par bya ba'i phyir sems mi skyed /
translated: The bodhisattva who abides in the observation of the mind does not generate the mind in order to exhaust the mind.

original: sems 'gog par bya ba'i phyir yang ma yin te /🔽'khor ba'i rgyun gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu sbyor @246a *//
analyzed: sems 'gog par bya ba'i phyir yang ma yin te / 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu sbyor @246a *//
translated: Nor does he generate the mind in order to stop the mind.

original: pa rnams la sems mngon par sgrub bo //
analyzed: pa rnams la sems mngon par sgrub bo //
translated: He generates the mind in order to connect with the roots of virtue in the stream of cyclic existence.🔽With that knowledge of the mindfulness of the mind, he engages in the certainty of non-arising, non-cessation, and non-appearance.

original: sems kyi dran pa shes pa des ma byung ba dang / mi skye ba dang / mi 'gog par nges par 'gyur ba la 'jug pa'i chos su gnas kyang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung sta /
analyzed: sems kyi dran pa shes pa des ma byung ba dang / mi skye ba dang / mi 'gog par nges par 'gyur ba la 'jug pa'i chos su gnas kyang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung sta /
translated: He abides in the Dharma of engagement, but he does not fall into the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha levels.

original: nam yang sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par ma gyur gyi bar du sems kyi rgyun de nye bar 'dogs te /
analyzed: nam yang sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par ma gyur gyi bar du sems kyi rgyun de nye bar 'dogs te /
translated: Until he has completed all the qualities of the buddhas, he connects with the stream of the mind.

original: sems skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
analyzed: sems skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
translated: With the wisdom of a single instant of mind, he also fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems la sems kyi rjes su lta ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems la sems kyi rjes su lta ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattvas’ close setting of mindfulness as the observation of mind in mind.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas’ close setting of mindfulness as the observation of phenomena in phenomena?

original: 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig gis mthong ba'i chos de dag byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gi bar du bar mdor brjed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig gis mthong ba'i chos de dag byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gi bar du bar mdor brjed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattvas, with the eye of noble wisdom, see phenomena and do not forget them until they are seated on the seat of awakening.

original: chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gang stong pa nyid las rnam par grol ba dang / mtshan ma med pa las rnam par grol ba dang / smon pa med pa las rnam par grol ba dang / mngon par 'du mi byed pa las rnam par grol ba dang /
analyzed: chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gang stong pa nyid las rnam par grol ba dang / mtshan ma med pa las rnam par grol ba dang / smon pa med pa las rnam par grol ba dang / mngon par 'du mi byed pa las rnam par grol ba dang /
translated: The bodhisattvas who abide in the observation of phenomena in phenomena are liberated from emptiness, liberated from signlessness, liberated from wishlessness, liberated from the unconditioned, liberated from non-arising, liberated from non-production, liberated from non-existence, and liberated from the absence of an intrinsic nature.

original: mi skye ba las rnam par grol ba dang / mi 'byung ba las rnam par grol ba dang / dngos @246b po med pa las rnam par grol ba'i chos chung rab tsam yang mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: mi skye ba las rnam par grol ba dang / mi 'byung ba las rnam par grol ba dang / dngos @246b po med pa las rnam par grol ba'i chos chung rab tsam yang mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see even the slightest phenomenon that is not liberated from non-arising, that is not liberated from non-occurrence, and that is not liberated from non-entityness.

original: chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas chos gang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las rnam par grol ba chung rab tsam yang mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas chos gang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las rnam par grol ba chung rab tsam yang mi mthong ngo //
translated: The bodhisattva who abides in observing phenomena does not see even the slightest phenomenon that is liberated from dependent origination.

original: chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas chos kho na mthong gi chos ma yin pa mi mthong ste /
analyzed: chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas chos kho na mthong gi chos ma yin pa mi mthong ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who abides in observing phenomena sees only phenomena, not non-phenomena.

original: de la chos gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos gang zhe na /
translated: What is a phenomenon?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: bdag med pa'i don dang / sems can med pa'i don dang / srog med pa'i don dang / gang zag med pa'i don dang / chad pa med pa'i don dang / rtag pa med pa'i don dang / 'byung ba med pa'i don dang / 'jig pa med pa'i don te /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i don dang / sems can med pa'i don dang / srog med pa'i don dang / gang zag med pa'i don dang / chad pa med pa'i don dang / rtag pa med pa'i don dang / 'byung ba med pa'i don dang / 'jig pa med pa'i don te /
translated: the meaning of selflessness, the meaning of the absence of sentient beings, the meaning of the absence of life-force, the meaning of the absence of individuals, the meaning of the absence of annihilation, the meaning of the absence of permanence, the meaning of the absence of origination, and the meaning of the absence of destruction.

original: de la chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la chos zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the Dharma.

original: de la chos ma yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos ma yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is not the Dharma?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: bdag tu lta ba dang / sems can du lta ba dang / srog tu lta ba dang / gang zag tu lta ba dang / chad par lta ba dang / rtag par lta ba dang / 'byung bar lta ba dang / 'jig par lta ba ste /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba dang / sems can du lta ba dang / srog tu lta ba dang / gang zag tu lta ba dang / chad par lta ba dang / rtag par lta ba dang / 'byung bar lta ba dang / 'jig par lta ba ste /
translated: the view of self, the view of sentient beings, the view of life-force, the view of individuals, the view of annihilation, the view of permanence, the view of origination, and the view of destruction.

original: 'di ni chos ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni chos ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called not the Dharma.

original: 'di ltar yang chos thams cad ni chos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang chos thams cad ni chos so //
translated: In this way, all phenomena are the Dharma.

original: chos thams cad ni chos ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni chos ma yin pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are not the Dharma.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med par so sor rtog pas chos thams cad ni chos ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med par so sor rtog pas chos thams cad ni chos ma yin no //
translated: “All phenomena are not phenomena, because they are empty, signless, and wishless.

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa'i lta ba la mngon par zhen pas chos thams cad ni chos ma @247a *//🔽yin no // de ltar chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas gang las sangs rgyas kyi chos med pa dang / gang las byang chub med pa dang / gang las lam med pa dang / gang las thar ba med pa dang /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa'i lta ba la mngon par zhen pas chos thams cad ni chos ma @247a *// yin no // de ltar chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas gang las sangs rgyas kyi chos med pa dang / gang las byang chub med pa dang / gang las lam med pa dang / gang las thar ba med pa dang /
translated: “All phenomena are not phenomena, because they are attached to the views of ‘I’ and ‘mine.’🔽“The bodhisattvas who thus abide in the observation of phenomena do not see any phenomenon from which the qualities of the Buddha are absent, nor any phenomenon from which awakening, the path, liberation, or

original: gang las nges par 'byung ba med pa'i chos gang yang mi mthong ste /
analyzed: gang las nges par 'byung ba med pa'i chos gang yang mi mthong ste /
translated: renunciation are absent.

original: des chos thams cad nges par 'byung bar shes pas sems can rnams la sgrib pa med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des chos thams cad nges par 'byung bar shes pas sems can rnams la sgrib pa med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Since they know that all phenomena are renunciation, they attain the gateway to the meditative absorption called ‘unobstructed with regard to sentient beings.’

original: des chos thams cad dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad la'ang bcos pa'i 'du shes 'thob ste /
analyzed: des chos thams cad dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad la'ang bcos pa'i 'du shes 'thob ste /
translated: He also has the idea of correcting all phenomena and all afflictions.

original: chos 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa med pa ste /
translated: “These phenomena are without afflictions.

original: 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not associated with afflictions.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de dag nges pa'i don gyi don la rton te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag nges pa'i don gyi don la rton te /
translated: Because they rely on the meaning of the definitive meaning.

original: nyon mongs pa'i tshogs kyang med /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i tshogs kyang med /
translated: There is no accumulation of afflictions.

original: phung por gyur pa'ang med /🔽'dod chags kyi dngos po med /🔽zhe sdang gi dngos po med /
analyzed: phung por gyur pa'ang med / 'dod chags kyi dngos po med / zhe sdang gi dngos po med /
translated: There is no becoming a skandha.🔽There is no thing of desire.🔽There is no thing of anger.

original: gti mug gi dngos po med de /
analyzed: gti mug gi dngos po med de /
translated: There is no thing of delusion.
